title: Worth a visit
review: We went by a taxi which took us to multiple tourists spots and Lal Tibba was one of those. Taxi dropped us little far from the view point due to snow fall. We walked the beautiful stretch to reach the point, Lal Tibba (meaning Red Mountains, as there is no vegetation over those mountains). There are 2 cafe there offering binoculars to view the Himalayas. We went to one of those (right next to Nahata Estates). They charge Rs.50 per person to go upstairs and use binoculars or order something from their cafe. I would recommend order something and enjoy it on the terrace with beautiful view. Their coffee and sandwiches were ammazing. An old person there will approach to click your pictures at reasonable price, your call. Over all a wonderful experience there.

title: Trek
review: Trekked to the place, a quite place. Has a lot of history associated with it. Do go to the top of the cafe for a spectacular view.

title: Hyped View point
review: 4km far from picture place, its view point. There is one good cafe. If you dont have time, you can skip this.

title: High point
review: One of the highest points in the city. Offers great view of the entire town. Try to walk the top. Also a cable rope-way option available.

title: Beautiful to see
review: Actually Mussoorie is almost covered by three Hillocks. Wincient hill, Gun hill and Lal tibba. Lal tibba  is cantonment area so natural with oak trees beautiful slopes with army maintenance keep it most attractive area of Mussoorie.

title: Snow Clad Mountains View Point
review: This place is far from Mall Road. Drive is very steep and generally narrow roads. Take taxi if you are not experienced driver. Once reached, either you take ticket to view through telescope or order food. Mostly latter is the good option. Food served was good although bit costly. The telescope is also not in good condition. The place is hyped however the view takes all the bad reviews away (coming in mind).

title: Highest point, but only geographically
review: Lal Tibba is the highest point near Mussoorie, but views are blocked by two restaurants. One of these is a tall structure which you pay to enter. At the top is a badly maintained and very foggy telescope. My camera did a better job of allowing me to zoom into disstant hills. Definitely pay the minimum you can.

title: Beautiful view
review: Lal Tibba is the highest point of Mussoorie, it has the most beautiful and mesmerizing view. The Lal Tibba owner was really sweet and good. The cafe has an entry fee for the visitors who do not wish to eat anything and free if you place any order. At the entry, I was not sure of ordering anything so \I asked for a ticket, as I did not have change nor did he have one, he allowed me to enter free, something I could never think of. When I went upstairs I took change from another visitor and paid him the fee. But, it was really sweet of him to allow me in. Also, I heard from others visitors that the food and beverages served there are really good. Must visit destination according to me.

title: Worth a visit
review: The place is actually a view point located 4 km upside mall road.  The journey is worth to take specially on a two wheeler.  The place has two double storied cafe. Entry fee is 50 per person,  free if you order food.  From top you can see himalayan range and an awsome sunset. Binoculars are installed on the roof. The scenere, hot coffee and cold weather gives you the real hill town feel

title: Beautiful
review: When we came to know about Mr Ruskin Bond lives over there the tibba visit became a must...... Not that you'll meet him..... Just respect... Highest point of Mussoorie. Beautiful view. Do visit.

title: Great view.
review: We have to pay a nominal charge of 100 much to enter, if you choose NOT to eat. If you order, then this charge is waived off. Have the option having photos taken and delivered to you - which in retrospect, I felt was not worth it.

title: View of Kedarnath mountain range - go as early as you can !
review: Lal Tibba is a view point in Landour,  most famous for being a view point of Kedarnath mountain range on a clear day.

title: Raw nature
review: One of the best places to see if u love nature. Calm n quiet. No hustle n bustle. Snow peaks seem just a touch away.

title: Spot to view the hills
review: If you are a big fan of hills and want to view it from a point where you can stand, take pictures and have snacks, this is the place for you. You would see a lot of hoardings of Lal Tibba thinking it must be some real stuff.  But beware, you ll like this place only if you keep your expectations low. It's just an elevated spot to take pictures and it's red in colour.

title: Awesome
review: It was the really really awesome experience enjoyed it ..with my friends ...touch of nature loved it

title: quintessential !!!!!!!!
review: its way above Mussoorie so quite a climb ......better to take a local car and do a day trip its beautiful with a clearer view of the Shivalik range. lal tibba or landour has some lovely cafes and bakerys so carry a book along if you like to read .

title: What a view....
review: for photo and nature lovers...its one of the finest place to admire the different dimensions of nature. its a view point and easy transportation available from the city.. amazing view amazing place.loved it

title: Lal Tibba Binocular & Cafe
review: The place is under renovation, gearing up for the snow fall and winter line view frm jan onwards. Owner Shubham is a very nice and soft spoken person.

title: Great Location and food, Courteous Staff
review: Located at the highest peak of Mussoorie, Lal Tibba is a small cafe that offers a wide variety of Momos and Maggi. I visited this place on a wintery afternoon and savoured the taste of steaming hot Momos and Maggi. The view is magnificent. They have placed a huge binocular for the visitors to have a better look at the Himalayan range and the villages down there. It is a must visit for anyone who goes to Mussoorie.

title: Best of both worlds.
review: 21 January 2019 we went to this place to see the Himalayan ranges and Tehri region on the other side. The view is amazing And is a must visit for all the tourists. The next day on 22nd January we visited the place again since it started snowing  and the experience was amazing.

title: Good walk around Lal Tibba, nothing special
review: There is nothing special about the place but still one of the better place to visit in comparison to others The walk from Chaar Dukaan area and back is in the shape of numeral 8 . Its an easy walk with no steep climbs or descent. You walk past some famous eateries, houses and heritage homes.

title: Good driving experience.
review: this place is very near to mussoorie, offers nice view of mountain range. Road to this plan is narrow and very very steep, if you are not very good in hill driving, please avoid.

title: weekend trip
review: good place for a morning or evening walk. enjoy the beautiful mountain view from here, quite clean area.

title: Nice view
review: The way to Lal tibba is a difficult drive . Around 30 minutes from Mall Road.

title: Peaceful and relaxing place in Nature’s Lap
review: Lal Tibba is one of the less commercially explored place in Mussoorie and hence close to nature and worth visiting spot according me for natural beauty lovers. It provides a mesmerising view of Himalayan Mountain peaks. You can take close look at mountain peaks like Badrinath, Kedarnath etc from the Telescope. You can also find old British architectural style hill houses here where Govt department works. All in all a must visit for relaxing in the lap of the nature.

title: Scenic, visit the cafe for the food and great view
review: We had gone there on 24th Dec with our dog Murphy and what an evening we had. Along with the beautiful views, we had great food: pizza, coffee, cheese and egg burger. The food, both in taste, quantity and money was good. Do say hi to Milo, the owners dog and chat up with Shubham, the owner, he has so much to tell about the place and is very easy to talk too. Thanks to him and his mom we stayed back to see the sunset: winterline, was totally worth it. coming back again!

title: Overhyped, Bad food and service
review: The telescope at Lal Tibba hardly offered any views and is definitely not worth the time and effort spent reaching there and standing in the telescope queue. The coffee and noodles were served to us while we were waiting the queue and the coffee was cold.

title: Great views
review: Definitely worth visiting for the wonderful view of the Himalayan mountain range. When here do have a coffee and a bite to eat at the cafes there

title: Lal Tiba is a good point in Mussorie  view of Himalayas
review: lal Tiba In mussoriie is a good place situated at a height of around 8000 ft above sea level The best thing is you can see from the restaurants in the vicinity from the binoculars provided by them, good view of Himalayas  mountain range mount Everest ,provided the skies are clear as at every minute the view changes .The restaurant charges Rs 50 per person for binoculars , you can take good photos of the scenic view or if you eat in the restaurant it is free. A guide is also there who will explain the various details of the mountain range naming the diffrent mountains. View to die for.

title: Waste if time
review: Nothing to see here. Complete waste of time.

title: Scenic landour
review: I have been to mussorrie multiple times, but it was this time that we strolled towards landour. Time just came to a standstill when we reached there. It still gives you a feel of colonial times. Sitting down for a cup of coffee...And just enjoying the views of the beautiful mountain range.

title: Worth visiting
review: Lal Tibba is a famous viewpoint in Mussoorie. One should go there to see the sunset, especially if the sky is cloudless.

title: Lovely Place
review: Wonderful place to visit in the evening. You would have a guide over there to explain you the places around the area. there is also food court available where you purchase, you get a free entry.

title: Very peaceful place
review: The place is very peaceful calm and serene. You can spend hours here looking at the beautiful views of mountains

title: Best thing in Mussorie
review: We trekked Lal Tibba twice in one week from club mahindra. Many people will find it difficult but it is extremely exciting to trek to lal tibba and TV tower. Must do trek if you are fit enough

title: Waste of money & time
review: Lal tibba is waste of time and money. But if one is determined to go, one should only go and pay for view and NOT eat the cafe in pic attached bcoz the food was horrible cold and presentation was BAD and dishes were DIRTY.

title: A must visit
review: This place is really good ..has a breathtaking view. You can see the himalayan range from this point. You need to pay some entry fee or simply order their delicious coffee and maggie .. we enjoyed the place

title: Place with Views
review: Hoghlight is on clear morning one can see Himalayas at crow fly distance of 100 kms, There is one old telescope.

title: Beautiful views of the snow-capped Himalayas
review: Lovely vantage point with coffee, pizza, desserts and other snacks.  We especially enjoyed the views of the Himalayas and were told that November and December are the best months for views.

title: Enjoyed the walk around this spot
review: The spot in itself does not have much to offer, except for the views. However the path around Lal Tibba until the chaar dukaan was beautiful. The road is quiet, surrounded by green valleys and dense woods. Prefect for a morning stroll.

title: Best place to visit Mussoorie
review: It is the best place to visit in mussoorie. It is a marvellous scenic bueaty.  From there one can see. Himalayan  mountains. Also in clear whether Chinese border is seen. On the way there is market called Char dukan. One can enjoy tea and snacks there.

title: Highly overrated
review: It’s just two rest cafes with roof top view points... a telescope from which u can see a village and some sheep.... they charge 50 per head to view from the telescope or else buy a food item from their shop... seriously , it’s very overrated..

title: Its A Restuarnt As they on Higest Peak
review: Its is a Restaurant. they have binoculars on there Terrance from where we can view few scenic mountain. they Charge Rs 50/- for entry you should be customer for there restaurant. Not so exciting.

title: Good view
review: It's just 5-6 kms from the mall road. They have a binoculars and you can have a view of himalayan range. There is a guide, who tells you about different places. This is a must go place in mussoorie.

title: CLEAN AND COLD AIR
review: I did a walk on Lal Tibba road from Mall road end. it was enthralling walk. Most meorable was , Mr. Ruskin Bond house on the way. The road is steep, and a walk is very refreshing to the Lal tibba.

title: highest point in Mussoorie
review: view from Lal tibba is breathe taking. There are two binocular cafe there, go to the roof have the view get photos clicked.

title: Scenic place in Landour
review: First of all , Lal tibba is not a place in Mussorie, its a place in adjacent landour. Mussorie and Landour are contiguous but in their character they are pretty different.

title: Nice walk followed by nice scenic treat to eyes
review: We started @around 3pm and walked all the way up. The road is really not certain and motorable but we preferred walking just to burn a few extra calories. The walk was really soothing and there were many spots worth stopping for photo break. The coffee at the char dukaan was also nice. Laal tibba is the highest peak of Mussoorie and gives u a beautiful glimpse of the Himalayas. We ended our trip to laal tibba with beautiful sunset and started our walk back.

title: Hyped.
review: Probabaly the only place u should visit in mussourie. There is lot of history. Use he guide its informative . The view is so so ans the sunset is not that great on an average day. Tourist  trap but club it with Rokbys and its ok.

title: Nothing
review: Highest point of masoori.

title: the last point of mussoorie
review: mussoorie is known as queen of hills and this is true after i visited this place for first time. I have my home in mussoorie so this was my first visit in this year. Every year i travel to mussoorie and explore some new places . This time on my list was Lal tibba . This is the last point of mussoorie. Every visitor should come and witness the most beautiful view of himalayas and the city of mussoorie and dehradun. This place is around 6-7 kms away from the main city so carry best sports shoes as we need to walk a lot to explore. Cars are allowed so u can carry own vehicle. There is a ticket of 50 rupees to go up and have a look from the top.. Overall i cherish the moments spent here and i will surely come back again to witness the beautiful sky view from here..

title: can be avoided in times of low visibility
review: was training while we were there and had thick fog cover. could barely see anything beyond the terrace we were standing on.

title: A must visit tourist spot in mussoorie 👍
review: It is very nice tourist spot to visit in mussoorie. It is built during the btitish time. Very nice view from the telescope mounted there. 2 shops with very nice seating place n nice photography points. Must try special home-made hot coffee & home-made cold coffee with icecream. Also jumbo grill sandwich is awesome there.

title: Old world charm...untouched by commercialization yet!!
review: There are very famous tourist places left in India that still evoke the old world charm of a rustic hilly countryside.

title: Lal tibba is stupid waste. But climate was awsome
review: Not bad. Not that much attractive . .....and that terris name lal tibba stupud of name... i enjoyed 8000ft hight of mountains & clouds.

title: Must Visit
review: Lal Tibba on the Landour Road has still not got as commercialised as the rest of Mussoorie. There is a telescope here which will give you awesome views.

title: Fascinating
review: Fascinating view if sky is clear...you have to pay 50/- per head to get up to the roof of the coffee shop else have food there then only you can use their roof free for better viewing. Rs 50/- per head is too much. Anyway near laltibba there is famous char dukan, landour...should try bun-omelette...its unique...

title: Amazing view
review: It's a joy to be there on a cable car from mall road. Nice location and very convenient place. having tea and Maggie at this point is an experience.

title: Heavenly walk
review: The trip to Lal tibba is one of the most scenic and enthralling trips in Mussoorie . The walk on the road from Lal tibba to sisters bazaar is so blissful and the silence is deafening.. not to miss the various hues of green in the jungle snd the beautiful wild flowers on the path.

title: Avoidable
review: Well, Mussoorie has no 'specific sights' to offer, and the place is best enjoyed if you just take in the good weather, enjoy the walks and the greenery around. With this in mind, Lal Tibba is nothing different. It is about a point, where there is a small view point with a telescope from which to see the mountain peaks on the far end. From Mussoorie if you have to engage a taxi, the only option is to go the taxi stand at the beginning of Mall Road and hire a cab, where the rates are fixed depending on destination and you pay INR 1000 for a 30 min ride to Lal Tibba for a view which is available just anywhere else in Mussourie.

title: Great views - but only on a clear day
review: This is a popular viewing point - to gaze into the mighty Himalayas. A short walk from Char Dukan. The road will take you from Char Dukan to Lal Tibba to Victor Banerjee's residence to Kellogg Church to Rokeby Manor. If you favor a longer walk, then at the church, carry on towards, Sisters Bazar, reach Landour Bakehouse and then come back vis Sunita and Anil Kudle's La Villa Bethany.

title: The Top Thing to do in Mussoorie
review: The views from here are awesome its worth a visit , its at the highest point of Mussoorie, there are 2 snack bars serving snacks & awesome Masala tea on the roof top where on a clear day you can get good views of the Himalayan peaks

title: "The Tibba(Point)"
review: Mesmerizing & breathtaking views of Garhwal Himalayas.....Lush Green Deodar Forest gives you energy and the much needed adrenaline rush for Hills and related activities..

title: Himalayan View
review: I would say a must visit place if you are in Mussorie as this will give you a great view of Himalayas and you can also see badrinat and kedarnath using binacular kept at the top during summers when the clouds are lesser in number.

title: Must visit place.
review: People who love nature this is a must visit please. View of Himalaya is the best part. All you need a cup of coffee.

title: Best place in mussourie to visit
review: This place had the best weather and the restaurant serves tatsy food.

title: Breathtaking views!
review: Visited this place in off season during monsoons. Snow capped peaks won't be visible during monsoons but you would get spectacular view of Mussorrie and surrounding mountains. Go for a stroll along the road that leads to Tehri to find some solitude and peace in the midst of misty deodar and pine forests. Also, you can have some tandoori momos at the cafes or visit the famous char dukaan.

title: A must visit place in Mussoorie
review: This is the Highest point in Mussoorie, The Queen of Hiils. It has a breathtaking view of Himalayas & if you are lucky, you can get to see upto Indo-Tibetian border using an old Japanese-make telescope.

title: Abode of country's who's who!
review: I had visited this place earlier in 1986 but only for a few hours but this time I stayed overnight at the highest point and got a chance for morning walk and came across properties of country's who's who, whom I would not like to name here. Sunrise seen from this place was awesome. A must see and must stay location but reaching here was a tough task, navigating through highly congested area of Landour Cantt.

title: Heaven for nature loving  walkers
review: Lal Tibba is located at the highest elevation of about 7000 ft in Mussoorie Uttarakhand .

title: Go once for the sake of going
review: Pickle shop, balloon shooting, unclean restaurants selling substandard food items, much hyped telescope views that's Lal tibba. This place is only commercialized and has nothing to really offer. People come here because of lack of activities in Landour but Landour is not about activities and action. Its about long walks in pines, its about music of solitude its about soaking in sun and gazing on hilltops. If you don't want these better stay off. Lal tibba has few shops, parking is available. One can spend some time viewing Himalayan peaks.

title: Offers good view of the valley
review: This place has a couple of viewing points (atop shacks) that offer views of the whole valley. Mussoorie was amidst clouds when we went so couldn't see much. Also, we drove here and the drive is quite challenging, due to the gradient and width. Worth a visit on a clear day as you can see the Himalayan range.

title: Short Visit on way to Landour
review: Really nice peaceful, serene and scenic place. We stopped over here for a very short duration to take some pictures and see the surrounding hills.

title: Enjoyed the view!
review: We enjoyed the view from here.. it was all green and not very cold as it was May .. we rented a bike to reach here and yes it’s worth a visit !

title: Ok ok...
review: This place has restaurant which takes Rs 50 for showing himalayan peaks through binocolours .

title: Awesome place
review: Lal Tibba, the highest point in Mussoorie is situated in Landour area, which is the oldest populated place in the destination. ... The beautiful views of sunrise and sunset from this vantage point can also be seen by travellers visiting Lal Tibba.

title: That view tho😍⛰
review: My friends and I walked up to Lal Tibba from Landour...the rain and umbrellas made it the most memorable hike ever!! I still cannot get over the beauty of this place We were greeted by a hot angeethi upon reaching the Lal Tibba Cafe, and had a delicate cup of hot coffee there. This place is worth a visit, cuz you wouldn’t want to go back!!

title: Winters 2017
review: Lal tibba was a very nice experience for me....  I went there second time.. But this time I am lucky to see sun rise.....  And there is an place called char dukaan....

title: Excellent View
review: It is the highest point in mussoorie. Great mountain view covered with snow. Gangotri and Yamunotri range is clearly visible from here. Must to explore in Mussoorie.

title: Scenic beauty
review: The view point is strategically located and give a good view of mountains and valley. sunset view is fantastic.

title: A peaceful adobe
review: If you are a peace lover and want some soltitude away from the hustle and bustle of the busy mall road of mussoorie then take a ride 5 kms upward toward this beautiful picturesque place called Laal Tibba. Thouh the road that leads to this place is narrow but once you are at the top you will forget every hurdle u faced and will fall in love with the natural scenic beauty..

title: Amazing view of Himalaya range
review: You should visit this place early morning between 4 to 6 AM if you want to see Himalaya. In day time due to HAZE Himalaya range are not visible.

title: Pleasing for eyes
review: Must visit this place and u wil love the nature's architecture. As an explorer u can find various landforms

title: Never Miss...
review: Beautifull Hill view... you should not leav without visiting this place. How ever you need to spend money or should buy some food to enter on the watch tower.

title: Chaar Dukhan ,Sisters bazar, Rouck bay manor resort
review: Lal Tibba is the highest place of Mussoorie. Its height is around 7000ft AMSL. Its awesome place to visit. Full of Lust green Devdar forest. Unpolluted, cool all year around. Before starting the incline there is a sister bazar where you can enjoy  food and snacks. It is actually a cantonment area. When you move forward you can visit Rouckbay manor resort. Its beautifully converted into a resort. Many famous personalities have their houses in this area for eg, Sacchin Tendulkar, Rusken Bond, Tom Alter, Pranav Roy.

title: All about Landour
review: Lal Tibba is another part of Mussorie from where one gets great views of the Himalayan Range.

title: Awesome
review: It was really feels to be like in HEAVEN when you enters in MUSSOORRIE.

title: Lal tibba waste of time
review: There is nothing in lal tibba  you will find 2 rooftop restaurants over there and that’s it there are some telescopes on the roof which they charge some that’s it nothing else

title: Long and exhausting trekk but breathtaking scenary
review: We started at 9 AM. We planned to trek 11.5 km to summit and return the same day. The trek is a bit tough tough in patches. We managed to trek 10 km till a temple as we were short of time. We had a few slow trekkers with us that is the reason we lost a lot of time. We returned down by 5:00 PM. The trek is beautiful and there a lot of places for camping all along the way. You can go up and come down the same day if you start early and have a good stamina

title: Nice walk
review: Beautiful walk and nice view. Don't forget to stop at Landour Bakehouse for some good coffee and cake

title: Peaceful walk with scenic views
review: Lal Tina has an one km round walking track with scenic views. When you are in Mussourie you must walk this stretch in the evening. Peaceful atmosphere, clean surroundings and great views.

title: Beautiful View but overrated
review: The way to this point is beautiful. The views from the Lal Tibba are also breathtaking. But it  is monopolized by one shop. You have to pay entrance fees or buy some food to reach the viewing point.

title: Highest point of Mussoorie
review: This is the peak of Mussoorie. If you are lucky and the sky is clear, one can view Himalayas from here. A short walk along the pine forest is enjoyable.

title: View
review: I don't know for what this place is famous for but awesome view and awesome weather. Wanted to stay longer but could not due to rain. Must visit

title: Beautiful
review: It's a beautiful place with a great vibe. It has some nice eating places and also great views of the Himalayas. Must go!

title: Top Point
review: Lal Tibba is  in Landour Cantt area. It is  8000 feet above sea level. Approach road is very narrow, circuitous, serpentine, and up-hill. We hired an expert  local driver. We   found only two shops selling tea-coffee, cold drink and some snacks. .A telescope was there and we enjoyed the view of  Himalayan peaks, like  Yamunotry, Gangotry, Mount Kailash, Mansarovar, Kedarnath, Badrinath, and Joshi Math. Dhanolti Town was also seen. Cool breeze was very pleasant.  A must see in Mussoorie.

title: Lal tibba overrated
review: Well let me start that this place though claimed to be highest point should be more akin for nature walks rather Hill top view.for assessing this place you have to go through a cafe which doubles up as a ticket counter.so normal ticket is for 50 bucks but if you buy anything from there overpriced menu it s adjusted.

title: Beautiful views ..
review: Great views, but if it is a foggy day, almost nothing is visible. The drive to the top is enjoyable. at places, the approach road is very narrow at times and the road almost of stones. When coming down as well, the road remains narrow (see pictures).

title: Lal Tibba
review: This is a serene spot. The mountains could be seen from the observatory. The highest point of Moossourie.  You can have some snacks while observing the surroundings. In October you will be able to see the snow clad peaks..

title: Over bloated fame
review: Lal Tibba is a waste of time and effort. Though walking around the hill, one may end up going to Sister's bazaar - however if sister bazaar is not the aim - drop it !

title: Nice
review: A nice scenery to refresh your eyes .must visit place there .it's 2-3 Kms from mall road .now a days they have started cleaning hill stations , looking better with no plastic

title: to see himalayan ranges
review: Its a best spot in mussoorie to see himalayan ranges. Need to walk for almost 20-25 mins after parking at char dukan. There is nothing than a view and 2 -3 food joints. Best to avoid during hazy weather. If you can see the ranges then there isnt ant use to go there.

title: Lal tibba - mussorie
review: One of the highest point of mussorie .... with scenaric beauty and view....

title: Must visit place in mussoorie
review: Beautiful walk with a great view of the snow capped mountains.. Away from all the noise of the mall Road

title: Brilliant
review: This place has the best view. There is greenery whichever way you look. Must visit. If you're a nature lovee, you'll love it.

title: Must visit
review: We visited the place of viewing opp Lal Tibba..its run by some military personnel Mr. Rawal and is free. The best part is he explains the mountain range and local geography. He also sells some food and goodies down in his shop which one can buy if interested.

title: To take pleasant walk
review: It's the best spot to have a pleasant walk of 2-3 Kms, there are only 2 food joints which will help you to show the mountain ranges. One can enjoy horse ride if interested.

title: View was not clear
review: The Binocular was too old to show you far distance object.And due to cloud or fog it will never be cleared.

title: Disappointed. Not worth your time.
review: After an hour of drive from Mussoorie, all you will get to see is 2 shops selling tea and momos. Nothing mesmerising about this place. You will get frustrated while reaching there. It is a one way road. You will frequently need to stop and reverse your car on a steep slope to give way to vehicle coming from opposite side.

title: Lal Tibba visit
review: Try to visit this place during the month of Oct., Nov. and Dec. when the sky is clear and you will be able to see the snow peaks. Avoid going there during the summer and rainy season as it will be fog and visibility will be low.

title: Good views, don't miss
review: This is in landour actually and a great n place. Not too manyb people to here as it's far from mall road and that's why so good.

title: Over hyped
review: Roads are good but the arrangements over there are over-priced. On a clear day it is worthwhile to visit the highest point in Mussoorie

title: Overhyped
review: We were very excited to visit this place after reading about the view. But the day we went there it was all misty and the person there just pointed at various points and told us about the places.

title: Good view
review: Lal Tibba gives a good view of Garhwal hills and valleys. There is a private house which has setup a telescope to view different points from their terrace. They charge some entry fee per person. But, at the same time, they run a cafe. So, if you buy something, the entry is free.

title: Don't go in expecting a lot.
review: To be honest i found this place a tad overrated. The view is great, the arrangement of snacks at the local point is good too. But don't go in expecting a lot from this place. To a lot of people this may strike as just another place to hangout in Mussoorie, but certainly not something to travel an extra mile for.

title: Overrated
review: The view and all is just ok. There are better view points in landour. Highly overrated. The walk to sister's bazaar has much better view points.

title: Beautiful
review: It is possibly the most beautiful place in Mussoorie. It's clean, a wonderful green cover and well managed

title: Time pass
review: It is a place just some additional mountain views, relatively quite place, we had an issue as there is no wash room at that point. Go if you have time

title: View
review: Much a do about nothing, probably has a great view of Himalayas,kedarnath and all, on a clear day. You have to pay to go up and view through an old telescope, so you can see snow clad tip, which you can see with your eyes also. Is it worth going up a narrow street negotiating traffic? Not really not for me

title: True View Hindered by Air Pollution
review: We got a taxi to drop us at the top, photographed the view and then enjoyed the long, winding walk back to Mussoorie Mall Road via Landour. I hope the views of the mountain ranges aren't permanently obstructed by the air pollution. Must be really exquisite on a clear day. There were 2 cafés, one had a viewing deck on top with a telescope - access cost INR 50 pp. Neither of the café really appealed to us. We stopped off for Waffles and Masala Chai instead at Café Ivy a few hundred metres down the down the road.

title: Go on a long walk
review: I and my husband went for hiking there, instead of taking our car... One can only enjoy it. Only if u go and hike it.. dn drive up there.. nothing up..just a Japanese binoculars to view Mussoorie town , yamunotri, Gangotri n Himalayan ranges. Better hike it and feel the nature

title: Worth the climb
review: This place has an amazing view of the Kedarnath, Gangotri and Yamunotri ranges. Reach there early to get a clear view of the snow clad Himalayan peaks.

title: Peaceful
review: Lal Tibba is one of the many viewpoints of Landour, Mussourie that engage your senses and soak you in the view. Early mornings and sunsets are two good times to be here. Being a tourist attraction, the place can feel crowded at times especially during the season, otherwise, this place is a must visit. For the best experience preferably trek up!

title: Sameeksha By Sachin - Spectacular View of Shivalik Range of Himalayas
review: Lal Tibba is the highest point in Mussoorie. This is situated at Landour town which is the part of Twin town of Mussoorie - Landour. Reaching Lal Tibba even by Car also is also little adventures as the car passes through the narrow streets and terrains. There are two buildings where chargeable binoculars are mounted. You can see the spectacular view of Neelkanth, Badrinath-Kedarnath, Swargarohini & other cliffs from there, other beautiful views can also be seen from there. A lot of greenery is around. This is a beautiful and must visit place. Highly recommended.

title: Queen of hills
review: Must visit place and don't miss this point taxi driver are not taking to this place they try to skip this point and they will drop u to mallroad  so plan places to visit.

title: Great panoramic view
review: This place is the highest point in mussoorie and situated in the landour region. It offers great view of the Himalayan snow clad ranges,gangotri- yamunotri ranges. It also gives an amazing view of mussoorie and landour.  It's best to go around 5 am before the sun rises to get a clear view of snow clad Himalayas. There is small cafe which has binoculars on top to see the view more clearly. It charges 50 pp and if you are wishing to visit early morning u need to book it a day prior coz it opens after 10 am. We went early morning and had the entire place only to ourselves which was extremely good. No hustle bustle of tourists. You can enjoy walking too in that area. It is simply good. I would definitely recommend going here but early morning for an even better view.

title: Not worth going in car.
review: Road to Lal tibba is very very narrow, and is very steep. Its one way but when other car comes from oppsite end, i felt scary.

title: Not worth the hype
review: Agreed it offers a panoramic view but definitely not a must see place if you have been to hill stations like Manali, Nainital, Ooty etc

title: A two story ugly structure
review: I wish they had more informative guides who told us more about this place instead of just  a telescope.

title: Lal Tibba/Visit in October
review: According to the locals here, best time to visit this place is October-November. You can see the Himalayan range hills then. We visited in April but  not the best view, a little foggy. You can come here to sit back and relax and enjoy at the top of a hill.

title: Amazing view.
review: It's a beautiful place. If you go in peak season you will be getting lot of traffik and would be able to cover this spot in 1day.

title: Must visit point in Mussoori.
review: Its a top of the hills from where you can see entire hill ranges of Mussoorie. Also if sky is clear you can see Himalayan ranges (Gangotri) from binoculars. There is entry fee of 50Rs per person or you can order some snacks or coffee to avail free entry. This is must visit point and can skip other points if you are short of time.

title: Dawn on the Himalaya
review: One of the best sorts to see the dawn catching the distant snowy mountains.  Well worth 50 rupees to the viewing point.  Walk a little way down the hill from Lal Tibba and you have great views of the forested slopes.

title: Go in march or april month
review: Plz go in off season i.e April if you wish to really enjoy. Otherwise you can only put your attendance no fun.

title: You Can Skip Seriously!
review: I have been to every place in Mussoorie and this place was the least attractive. Its only good if you get to see the Himalayan (Alaknanda) hills range. And you won't be able to see it often except according to the locals there, in Oct-Nov.

title: Best Place in Mussoorie
review: Great Location

title: Beautiful views
review: Nice and quiet, and great views of the snow clad mountains.  highest point in Mussoorie. a small bazaar with cassul dining.

title: Wonderful place & view
review: This is the best place in Mussoorie. Wonderful place, great location, nice view, amazing coffee. It is in Landour. Very less crowded. On the way, you can also visit Mr. Ruskin Bond's house.

title: A quiet place to get a panoramic view of Mussoorie
review: It is a small point in Landour where you can get a panoramic view of the entire Mussoorie and the villages surrounding it. Char Dukan which is famous for its eateries like momos and sandwiches is very close and is a must visit too.

title: Average view from the top
review: As you have already read probably, you have to pay Rs. 50 per person just for a view through the binoculars upstairs unless you buy something (don't remember the min amount but didn't seem to make sense to buy something forcibly) and one person gets to go free. The lady sitting downstairs is really rude and horrible. That said, view from the top is average, the day was also not clear so couldn't see the peaks. The old man however is enthusiastic and showed us the sights with patience and insisted on taking pictures for us in various poses. An OK experience because of him.

title: Nice palce
review: Nice place but we werent able to see any of the peaks of chardham felt like got fooled there.There are 50 Rs charges for feltng up there to see the view but with the binoculars only could see were the villages down there.other than this there is good road beside it whr you can sit for soulful moments

title: Nice place for people who like nature. Very peaceful and quiet place. 2
review: Very congested roads uphill. Avoid peak holidays to visit. Few parking people stopping cars of outsiders and charging Forced parking charges of Rs 100 before 1.5kms from actual place. Dont get trapped and move inside to actual point. 2 very good restaurants abd friendly local people

title: Not worth going there due to ill-mannered and rude lady attendant there
review: View was normal, nothing special. Binoculars were not in working condition so not worth going there.

title: Must visit point in Landour.
review: Visit here and if possible go early. On a clear day you can see himalayas in the backdrop. While the huge binoculars were not very clear, you can make out things which are real far away. The local gentleman manning the binocular, helps with his knowledge about the area.

title: Awesome views
review: Best view of the Himalayan range and also the Sunset from the terrace of two cafes located in Lal Tibba. The food was awesome.

title: Useless waste of time
review: I did not really like the view. Honestly, you can find the same view from many other places in mussoorie. The effort to reach there is massive as compared to the reward. There are a couple of cafes. Nothing great or something to remember. In addition, the drive to the top amd traffic are unreal.

title: Canadian Family
review: This is a really nice vantage point to see the Himalaya mountain range and surrounding Mussoorie hills. But keep in mind it is weather dependent in order to see the mountains. Unfortunately we visited on an overcast day and the weather on the mountains did not allow us to see mountain range. However this is still a nice place to visit. The cappuccino and hot chocolate was really good and there is a nice little enclosure to sit and enjoy the view. Might return to hopefully see the mountains one day. The drive up and back down is insane in my opinion.

title: Picturesque
review: The view from lal Tibba is very picturesque. But the stop over could do with some clean in toilets . The walk from lal tibba up to Rokeby manor is very beautiful , where you get lovely food and good accommodation .

title: Exactly peaceful
review: You can say exactly superb palace to visit with family and friends evening and morning moments also share

title: Most amazing view if the mountain peaks
review: Must not miss the view of the moubtains through a binoculars. Also must visit is the char Dukan and relish bun omelette,paratha,banana pan cake, masala tea.

title: Completely worth it
review: best place for a evening sunset with a cup of coffee and pancakes from the roof top restaurant there.must try

title: Amazing Place
review: Amazing place to visit in Mussoorie and there was a very beautiful view of Himalayan Mountains fully covered with snow. Lal tibba is located about 8000 meters above sea level. More colder than mussoorie city so it is advisable to be suitably clothed (i.e. Woollen Gloves, Beanie Cap etc.) as its really cold at Lal Tibba.. Really amazing views of natures for refreshing the body souls. A restaurant located at Lal Tibba that charged INR 50 per head to let people visit their rooftop viewing point (2nd level). Highly recommended this place for visit.

title: Mountains and little bit of history
review: Its the highest point of Mussoorie and you can see all the mountain ranges from here. Sunsets and absolutely beautiful. The Lal Tibba restaurant lets you go up for free if you order something or you can pay Rs 50 per head and go up. The charges include the view from binoculars of a few historical places and you also get to know interesting facts about these places. Even if you decide not to get some paid pictures clicked, the photographer is nice enough to click some pictures on your phone for you. You can definitely go up there enjoy the coffee and click some really nice pictures.

title: Good view
review: Before it there were chaar dukan (4 shops) where you can eat. Waffles were good.... And coffee was excellent.

title: The lady at point of telescope view is a cheater
review: You find a simple restaurant there and on the roof of restaurant has a telescope. The restaurant lady charge Rs 20 per person for going on the roof for viewing the mountain ranges by the telescope. Its a total cheating as the lady is absurd and charge it without authorization. I inquired later at other place and found that the telescope is installed by local tourism department and remaining part of building was given on rent for restaurant. Lady was charging it by pretending that its her private property.   When I complained about this to her she was rubbish in talking and deserve a slap on her face. Pls do not go for see from telescope there is nothing to see from telescope because its in bad shape and there was no person to help in finding the mountain ranges. Instead of it you can roam the other place of lal tibba itself which have a nice round trek and a popular char dukaan.

title: Place where you can see Himalayas
review: Lal tibba is the place from you can see the beautiful Himalayan mountains covers with the snow.

title: Sunset point
review: Very nice to go evening time to see Himalaya and very nice drink to tea and coffee I like very much stay one hour there very good service very nice people thanks very much

title: Great vieuw to the Himalayan
review: We had a great vieuw by sunset. The staff was friendly. We had ordered some chai en fries and got free entry. It was a nice vieuw from the highest point to the Himalayan. It was beautiful to see the sun going down.

title: Excellent view of the himalayan peaks
review: We visited Lal tibba on way to Dhanaulti from mussourie. We took a cab package with tour and drop to Dhanaulti at 2350/-. Places covered were - Char Dukaan, Lal Tibba, Buranskhand view point, Dhanaulti Eco Park.

title: Overrated
review: The approach road is very very congested.  Don't even think about taking your own car. The spot itself is nothing more than a restaurant where you can have t at the rooftop (they charge you 50 per person if you dont plan to order anything to eat). Even the scene is nothing to boast about. Taking a taxi will cost you approx 2000.

title: Amazing views of the Himalayas
review: Worth the long winding journey to the top for the amazing views across the valley and the Himalayas in the distance. Perfect spot to watch the sunset! It gets very chilly in the winter so wrap up warm!

title: Not to be Missed
review: Highest point in Mussoorie with an excellent guide who regales you with stories of yore from the region! Lal Tibba is a quaint little restaurant that charges INR 50 per head to let people visit their rooftop viewing point (2nd level). The road leading up to Lal Tibba is really narrow yet unique, and is something that must be experienced when in Mussoorie; wasn't too impressed with the binocular/telescope-like device though.

title: Lovely walk to Lal Tibba- What a view
review: A lovely 2.50 km walk to Lal Tubba and back. Clean pathway. Scenic beauty beyond imagination.

title: A walk in the Himalayas
review: Lal Tibba is an excellent place to visit in Mussoorie. Because it is located 1,500 feet above Mussoorie, the weather is more colder and pure. With a beautiful view of the Snow Covered Himalayas, the walk is just divine and invigorating. In winter, its advisable to be suitably clothed (i.e. Woollen Gloves, Beanie Cap etc.) as its really cold at Lal Tibba.

title: Quite walk around Masoorie.
review: If you love walking than you should not miss this one. View is worth from Lal Tibba. In the evening mighty Himalayan peaks gets beautiful with orange hues...

title: Lovely view and Nice walk
review: The best way to explore is on foot. It is quiet, peaceful, fresh and green all over with lovely views of the Himalayas. At the point Lal Tibba is a government rest stop which offers a few refreshments and has binoculars on the top level which allows you to get a closer look at the snow capped mountain ranges.

title: Just to Mussorrie and snow peaks.
review: Reached at around 12.30 pm. The snow peaks were not clear because of clouds. The Japanese binoculars were of no help. Rather I could get clearer view through my own binoculars. You have to cross through a narrow bazar to reach the heighest point.The restaurant,a little below was good enough for a sumptuous lunch.Over all the children ,their parents and the grand parents enjoyed this 4 hrs trip up and down from Mussorrie.

title: The most popular tourist spot in Landour
review: Lal Tibba is the most popular tourist point in Landour, Mussoorie.  It is popular as it provides the best views in Landour.  On a clear day in the early part of the morning once can get a good glimpse of the snow capped mountains.  There is also a red painted restaurant where one can go and enjoy come snacks and tea and catch the views from the rooftop. A must visit.

title: Mussoorie visit
review: This is a must have when you visit Mussoorie.

title: Pure bliss
review: The view of the valley and Himalayan range from top of Lal Tibba is simply breathtaking. Walk down the quiet roads of Landour and you would not want to come back to the hustle and bustle of metros again.

title: View of snow covered mountain ranges
review: I was lucky to go to Lal Tibba on a sunny day. So I got beautiful views of snow covered mountain ranges shimmering in the sun. I walked there from Char Dukan. It's a pleasant walk of about 1 km. Then I walked back around the other way so that I came to Char Dukan from the other side. This is a slightly longer walk but equally pleasant and more peaceful as there was hardly anyone on that route.

title: lal tibba is the highest point in mussorrie
review: must visited place when you travel to mussorrie.it is the top most point of mussorrie.worth view.you have to take your own vehicle to reach this point.it is approx. 8 km from mall road mussorrie.

title: Full Himalayan range view ... lovely place
review: Lal Tibba is a far away place from main Mall Road but well worth the journey

title: Quiet provincial feel
review: Nothing much. And that is precisely why it is nice. In India where everything can a bit too much ...Too.many shops , people , guides and trinket sellers ....This place has nothing much.

title: View of Nature at altitude of 7350 Ft from MSL.
review: Lal tibba is a tourist destination , approx 15-20 minutes uphill from Mussorie . In the winter season one can experience snow fall . A spot to be experience in the evening time ( between 1500 Hrs to 1630 Hrs). It has cafe whose roof top has telescopic binocular and from which one can see the snow capped Himalayan range. Late evening can be challenge as chances of cloud covering the view can happen. Dont forget to take the Hot Choclate coffee ( Rs 50) from the cafe to rooftop. Place is too chilly . But has real beautiful landscape which will mesmerize you.

title: Top point of hill station
review: Lal tibba is toppest point on hill station we reached there by ropeway. It's full of adventure and so many beautiful points. Recommended

title: Great views of the peaks
review: We trekked up from Mussoorie to Landour, was a pleasant walk,it is the top most point & has a telescope installed on the terrace  which gives you a clear panoramic

title: Best place to spend time in Mussourie (plus landour)
review: Lal Tibba is supposed to be highest place in Mussourie. At the namesake hotel, you get to see a lovely view of himalayan range.

title: Awesome place
review: Ahead of char dukan a very peaceful and beautiful place from where we can see the snow covered mountains.It has a cafetaria and you can view the snow covered mountains clearly with the telescope.A paradise on the mountains

title: Not worth the hype
review: I don't think it's worth the hype at all. Too much fog in the winter months and there are places with more scenic beauty around Landour. Don't recommend it.

title: Must visit in mussorie
review: Highest point in Mussoorie. Good views all around. Can go by foot from mall road or take the longer route via taxi. You can view the snow clad Himalayas and glaciers from the telescopes  up over the restaurant rooftops.

title: Highest Point
review: This place is at a height of 7000ft approximately and gives you the view of whole of Mussoorie and Garwal Ranges. It has many places to visit

title: Overhyped.. good only for 10mins
review: There is nothing much to do in Mussorie.. Lal Tibba is just an overpriced /overhyped viewing point.

title: Amazing view
review: The view you get from this place is amazing. The Nag Tibba range is visible in its beauty. Plus you can have tea or coffee there also.

title: Fun Visit for chai
review: Very Beautiful place , Amazing View of Mussoorie and Himalayan Range , Amazing weather to enjoy. Very very quiet and close to Nature.Must Visit if you are visiting with friends also you can enjoy snacks at Char Dukan and then you can have a nature's Walk till Lal Tibba View point.

title: Must watch
review: Lal Tibba is a must watch if you stay at Dhanaulti. In a clear sky, you can enjoy a 360 degree panoramic view of the mountains including the snow range.

title: A bit disappointing Lal Tibba
review: I had heard a lot about Lal Tibba and beautiful view from there. But I was a bit disappointed as the weather was not clear.

title: Highest point in Mussoorie
review: Lal Tibba is the highest point in Mussoorie. A bit away from the Mall Road. These days there is diversion because of road construction between Picture Palace and Landour Bazar. So, they take us from a longer route which is quite smooth. While going to Lal Tibba we must ensure that the weather is clear otherwise the snow peaks, particularly, Badrinath, Kedarnath, Yamunotri and Gangotri will not be visible. On the way to Lal Tibba you can see the house of the famous writer Mr. Ruskin Bond.

title: One & Only Place to Visit in Mussoorie
review: This is the only worth place to visit in Mussoorie. Mr. Alam the guide here is free to provide U entire knowledge here. This man really deserve appreciation & tip coz of his humbleness & warmth towards guest.

title: Nice view
review: The view is spectacular and the air breeze is fresh, loved to walk and stay for few moments and enjoy the nice climate

title: View of the Himalayas Glacier form Lal Tibba
review: Excellent views of the four "-Tries" from the top of the Lal Tibba with the binoculars and excellent briefing by the guides there. The photoshoots form the top was lifelong memorable. Besides the Momos (grilled ones) were mouthwatering.

title: Vaccation
review: One of the highest point of mussoorie which motorable, one can see ranges of himalayas clearly while standing on lall tibba with telescope  already installed which was used earlier! You can very clearly ranges of snow covered mountains!

title: Good view,  Rs.  50 entry fees
review: Lal Tibba -  visited on 30-12-2017.. Small cafe with binocular to see himalayas from top..  Entry fees Rs.  50 per head and if u order food (which is definitely Rs.  80 or more)  one person gets free entry..

title: Lal Tibba ...High
review: Lal Tibba , not great but nice place to visit . You can have excellent view of mountains from here . Do try Moms and maggie here.

title: Sunrise and Sunset
review: This place is famous because of the iconic view of sunset and sunrise from here is amazing. Though very crowded and according to me a bit hyped still it is worth while to give it a visit once in your life.

title: Only view point
review: This is only view point, you can see line of Himalaya mountain if weather is clear.

title: Beautiful view!!!
review: Lol Tibba is a must visit place in Missourie.  Icy Mountain View was excellent and perfect. We have taken lots of photographs.

title: must visit
review: Great views and worthgoig during the mid day.. there is no good dinning experience.. the restaurant tricks you to pay more

title: Worthless place
review: The roads are too small , nothing to see

title: Beautiful place with beautyful view
review: It was just a casual visit. As I was here after 2 years so I became very happy to see those same old things. Here one thing I noticed that this place became highly comorciliez. This place became polluted as well. Well it was nice to visit here.

title: For a quick stop and food
review: have few cafes which specialized for Pancakes however you need to see which can deliver best , i didn't know hence ended up with not best. This is not which is mussoorie is for hence choose this place if you have friends group who likes to sit and chat.

title: Most Beautiful Location
review: I would recommend, go there by cycle as you would really be able to appreciate the beauty of the place and the scenic beauty in between. Those steep curves were amazing. The place is also beautiful with picturesque snow laden Himalayas in December. Best this is the cold coffee there.

title: Amused
review: Awesome valley view on Himalayan ranges. Hills, clouds, ropway,alluring scenery was speechless. Just visit. Peaceful.. i loved the place. I

title: Owesome place with scenic beauty n nature felt deep inside
review: Would rate Lal Tibba as one of the most beautiful places around Mussoorie. Calm , clean and well maintained place where you can have variety of food from the small restaurants serving delicious food. Situated on height from Mussoorie town so climate is always kool here , ideal place to relax njoy the lap of nature , few properties for stay have been recently developed ,recommended to stay for one night n feel the calmness.

title: Amazing View
review: Lovely place to visit just for sunset view. Approach is a bit challenging but definitely worth the effort.

title: So called highest point in Mussourie
review: Good view of snow clad mountains & also glaciers from here.

title: Lal tibba
review: Lal tibba is situated on the top most hill of missouri  .The drive to lal tibba is quite scary  with twist , turns and steep height.

title: Breathtaking view!
review: The view of snow capped mountains is simply breathtaking, one should simply soak in the beauty of this place.

title: Scenic view of the Himalayas
review: Indisputably the highest point in the region, Lal Tibba might excite you for the bit better panoramic view of the Himalayas and a bit colder breeze!

title: Rip off
review: Not much to see here .. disappointed . View is ok much better views from the different hotels in mussorie

title: excellent place
review: This a the top most point of the town which enable us to appreciate the beauty of the valley, ranging mountains and sunrise/sunset time add an extra beauty to it.

title: Beautiful place
review: Highest point in Mussoorie.Beautiful during sunset. There is motorable road till the top but no public transport. You can see himalaya ranges from here.

title: Lal tibha
review: If you are in  mussoorie you should definitely visit Lal tibia where you get a beautiful paranorma of the whole place

title: Must visit if you are in Landour
review: A beautiful view from top of Mussoorie, this is a must visit if you are in Landour. There is a shop that offers a telescopic view to the peaks and also food. I had pan pizza and coffee, both delicious.

title: Great location
review: There’s a laal tibba cafe. Downside is they charge you for the access to location. 50/- per head which is adjustable to whatever u order . But it’s a great location and food is nice enough to try . Best thing is our pics turned out to be great at this location

title: Awesome view point
review: One of the highest points in the old city part of Mussoorie, Lal Tibba is more of a view point. A steep narrow road leads to this place. There is an entry fees to access the place. Carry your binoculars to enjoy great views with more precision. There is lot to see here - the Himalayan peaks, the mountain ranges, the coniferous vegetation, the terraced farming, the soon valleys ... All are so awesome.

title: Nice location to view hills and himalaya
review: It is facing towards Nag tibba hills. Next range of Himalaya after Mussoorie range.

title: Lal tibba scenic view point
review: Lal tibba is at 8100 ft which is highest peak point in mussourie band.. with the telescope available the view of various Himalayan range from gangothri, yamunothri, badrinath and kedarnath.. I understand that during winter days the scenic view is excellent as there is no clouds.. i would recommend to use photography service available and it would be nice memory. This place shall not be missed in mussorie trip..

title: High Point!
review: This is literally Mussoorie's highest point!

title: Nice. Must do!
review: Its a must do if in Mussoorie. The Highest point. Lovely views of the Himalayas and some lovely beverages in the cafe below.

title: Must visit once. Nice location
review: Beautiful location. Can see mountains from there. Nice place to visit with friends and Family. easy to locate and reach

title: Breathtaking view
review: Lal tibba is such a gorgeous place.

title: Nice uphill trek to Lal Tibba
review: It's a nice uphill trek to Lal Tibba from Chaar Dukaan and the roads are clean surrounded by Tall trees.

title: Lal tibba tour
review: nice view and a calm walk in the hills definitely cheers you up...add to it some hot fries and coffee :)

title: Beautiful nature walk
review: The walk from Chaar Dukaan to Lal Tibba is a refreshing one with beautiful views and amongst trees on either side. The cafe at Lal Tibba is delightful. Walking the complete route brings one back to Chaar Dukaan. It is clean and the air is pure. Be careful of monkeys.

title: A small tourist spot - Good for Binocular Views
review: Lal Tibba is a very small tourist spot indeed. All you can do here is spot viewing with binoculars/ telescope. There are two small restaurants and at the terrace, you can pay the guy some 50 bucks (as per they charge) to get a good glimpse of the Himalayas and other spots, provided it is a clear sky.

title: Sun Rise Point
review: Early morning visit to Lal Tibba. Fresh rejuvenating air, honey lemon tea and maggi set my day with Sunrise.

title: The peak of Mussoorie
review: where you will meet the sky and can play with the nature. I will say, one will get authentic pleasureeeeeeeeeee.

title: Breathtaking view of the Himalayas
review: The narrow road making its way from Chaar Dukaan doesn't give a hint of the panoramic view that awaits you... but turn the last corner and you come to Lal Tibba to see the splendor of the Himalayas in full view. For a city rat like me, the view was breathtaking to say the least!

title: Highest Peak at Mussoorie for exhilaratig Views of Himalayas
review: This is the highest peak of Mussoorie at 500 Feet elevation, located 4 Kms fm Kulri Bazaar. Offers exhilarating views of Himalayas & even Badrinath Kedarnath Peaks on clear days.

title: Another spot created
review: Since Mussorie does not have much options for tourists this is another spot created accidently for tourists good for clicking pictured with scenic mountains behind if the weather is good.

title: Lovely view point on way to Landour
review: Good point to take a wide view of the valley. Good photo point. However, we were on a day when there was quite a mist , though sunny,and did miss the best views,

title: good for take photos
review: it is most beautiful place. 4 km from kurli bazar. its just a valley view from height. you can take some photos. dont visit rainy day, it is risky

title: Nice place
review: An interesting drive up to the place and you will reach the quaint Landour town with a small market (if you can call five or six cafe's in a row that) and a parking that charges you through the nose. If you don't want to have coffee, just do not park and drive on the Lal Tibba road where one can stop anywhere (almost) and walk around. Very much in the midst of nature here. Loved the drive around the mountain. Plenty of places to look around.

title: Good place
review: This  place is very scenic and natural .  I went with my family to visit there and I got surprised when I saw it . This place is very beautiful.

title: Been with family
review: Highest point in Mussorie. However, highly over-rated. Can be skipped. It takes a while to reach Lal Tibba and the cabs charge about INR 1,000 for every trip. Lal Tibba doesn't have anything different.

title: Great place
review: Lal tibba is at a height where winds dance around you unashamedly. Relax when you are there. The place is surrounded by private Raj era cottages mostly deserted.

title: at pick of 7500 ft, must visit place
review: you can get view of Kedarnath-Badrinath Mountain range. also Gangotri-Yamunotri Mountain ranges can be seen. advisable to visit around 9 to 11 am as sky is more clear. as per local people best time is after Nov. to march when sky is much clear there

title: Waste of time
review: Me and my friends went there the lady was there is good to talk for everything like food and stars...

title: Beuty
review: Great place to walk for nature loving people nice shops to have good snacks walk route is in shape of 8 & you reaches in the end at starting point

title: Go for the Views !
review: Walk walk walk all along and soak in the lovely views ...Inflate your lungs with crisp mountain air ! Most of the times due to mist & fog the views may not be clear ... but its still worth it..!

title: Outstanding scenic view of Himalayas
review: Lal Tibba is a point in Landour in Mussoorie which offers an incredible view of the Himalayas and is surrounded by lovely deodar forests

title: At last Blue Clear Sky = Himalayan Peaks
review: The monsoon wad late with its finish this year so much so the views of t Himalayan Peaks were not visible.  Today was perfect and the road around Landour and the top floor of Laal Tibba (free to enter+telescope ) provided one of the best viewings I have experienced.  The walk was a major Plus.

title: Awesome As-usual
review: Just loved it, never forget to go there there at Mussoorie..  Char Dukan and Coffee, Honey Tea with Omelet and Pratha.

title: Bethany Home
review: An amazing spot of Landour complete with a coffee shop and snacks place. Gives one an overall view of Mussorie

title: Mesmerising views so quite!
review: Lovely place ,could sit there for hours!! But don't expect anything else it is jus a valley view! There is one Maggi point where you can help hunger and get some awesome views. It was my second visit to this place and I loved it ! If it is not raining then you can have poster view of mountains!

title: Best place to visit in Mussoorie!
review: The owner of this cafe called 'Lal Tibba' offers patrons entering his cafe access to binoculars through which one is able to see the farwaway snow clad Himalayan peaks. He also doubles up as a guide and gives you a briefing on the history of Mussoorie. All this without your needing to purchase anything from the cafe. As we had just had breakfast and were not in a position to have anything at his cafe, we just offered him a tip for sparing his time which he flatly refused.

title: Best Places
review: Lal Tibbat is most beautiful place in Massoorie. I m in my business trip to Massoorie then I was there with my  on friend who is a owner inof a petrol pump. This place is very beautiful , silent, and world best place to visit.

title: Family trip
review: Nice view. This is such a place at height, to be enjoyed with silence,... must go kind of place. Youvwill love it spring and rains

title: Snow Fall at Lal tibba
review: we went to Mussoorie lal tibba in january 2017. It was snowing very heavily at that time.  We enjoyed a lot there, specially children. Lal tibba was full of snow n tourist.  The himalayan view was awesome.

title: Beautiful view
review: The only thing good about this place is the beautiful view of the snow clad Himalayas. One time visit.

title: Good view
review: Highest point of moussorie. View is beautiful. Best time would be to go in morning before 11. But not at all recommended for personal driving, if   u haven't been there before.

title: Amazing Views
review: The hill houses a camp of the Indian Military services and Broadcasting stations or towers of All India Radio and Doordarshan.The beautiful views of sunrise and sunset from this vantage point can also be seen by travellers visiting Lal Tibba.

title: Casual visit
review: The place offers good view of Himalayas. The snow covered peaks can be seen from the roof tops of two cafes which operate there.

title: A high Point for Good view
review: Its a just a view point, which is highest point in the area. It gives a good view. There is small restaurant, which can provide Maggie, pakodas and very Good coffee. A good place to take pictures. One advise, if you have professional camera, then instead of clicking pictures yourself, pay Rs 100 to a professional cameraman who will click good pictures. Telescope is not good not maintained well.

title: Very crowded, and nothing great
review: Please avoid this point from your itinerary. Nothing but a huge telescope which gives you some image of the mountains. But super crowded, and so many people trying to take selfies!

title: Nice peaceful place with good views
review: This is a cool and peaceful place. Couple of restaurants with telescope placed on their terrace, which is free to use. Good valley view. Calm close to nature, one can sit and relax for an hour or so. Reaching there is comfortable by car (only for people comfortable with Hill driving). Nice track to walk around surrounded by trees. We missed having food at Char Dukan which is enroute to Lal Tibba. Heard it is a great place for foodies.

title: Best panaromic view of himalayas
review: It was the best destination place to hangout with friends in mussoorie the best thing is to view of himalayas and snow peak mountains from here we always recommend everyone of my friend to come to this place .. thank u

title: If you want to enjoy the snow go for it
review: Whenever you are planning check weather. You will enjoy the snow only when rain is predicted. Also, beware of Pahadi Dogs at Lal Tibba.

title: 2 Star
review: Nothing to describe. Cab drivers just add a point in the list of "Locations to Show". From here you will see the usual view that you will see through out the Mussoorie. But one wont realize it until you have been there once. If possible avoid please.

title: One of the most amazing place in Mussoorie
review: This is one of the top point In Mussoorie. The viewpoint from this point is breathtaking. I think September is not the pick season. And that's the reason it was not that much crowded. There are two shops and in the rooftop the view is amazing. You may walk through the roads surrounded with lush green forest. All over the experience is great.

title: Great Himalayan Views
review: To see the Himalayas at this time of year, you have before the sun comes above the horizon. The views here were great at 5 am.

title: A walk to remember!
review: Go for it for a breath taking view of hills. And if weather is on your side - you can see clouds floating and painting the grand canvas of hills.

title: A must visit place
review: Laal Tibba is a must visit place in Mussoorie, especially if you are the one who can relate to nature and are in love with its serenity. I reached here on a rainy day and felt it was the place I had been in search of. Away from the overcrowded streets of Mussoorie, amidst the lush greenery and cool breeze, I felt so connected to nature.

title: Lovely view and awesome taste
review: I visited this place with my family and getting unique pan cake in chardukan over there near church.

title: Mesmerising
review: View was beautiful...... road spectacular..... going there was mesmerising...... bought chocolates... they were delicious......a day full of feast for eyes

title: Scenic
review: The spot has a large binocular but nothing was visible due to mist. Seems Oct to march is when one can see the Himalayas from here. Nevertheless, it was a beautiful ride and sight for city dwellers like us.

title: Its the Highest point in Mussoorie.
review: Laal Tibba may offer good views of the himalayan peaks if the weather is clear. there is a telescope from where in you can see Good views.

title: Beautiful view of nature
review: Lal Tibba is the highest peak topmost point in mussoorie. It provides view of himalayas mountain peaks. The environment is quite relaxing. Enjoy walk and take natural photos.  Its natural beauty, greenery all around and calm atmosphere is amazing. At some places the roads are steep and narrow. It is better to take local taxi. Its chill over there.

title: Calmness of nature
review: visiting here offers you the sereneness you have been looking for. take a break from hectic life schedules and visit here to refresh yourself. walking through the canopy of trees, you realize how much nature has to offer us, but still we do not care for nature. calm and soothing breeze at this place will surely bring positive energy into you.

title: Just about average
review: For people who've experienced mountains real close, this might not be worth the trip. Heavily crowded, its just a spot at high altitude from where you can seemingly see snow clad mountains up close. If en route, you may drop by,  not a place you would miss otherwise especially if you are staying in landour.

title: Exotic
review: Not to expect markets here but only nature and peace away from the over commercialised mussoorie roads and mall road which are highly avoidable

title: lovely walk
review: lal tibba is beautiful walk .. in the mist in the trees on deserted roads.. its just you and the mountains and the winds and the views. be prepared to walk.

title: Highest Point Of Mussoorie
review: Lal tibba is the highest point of mussorie. A very old telescope is installed there to view the landscapes. Lal tibba offers great views of the himalayan snow clad peaks like bandarpooch and kedarnath. The place is also good to witness sunrises and sunsets.

title: Scenic beauty
review: Must visit when in mussoorie.  Beautiful scenic beauty and you can see the snow peaked mountains from here. The place just below the view point serves amazing coffee. Only place in Mussoorie which has parking space but roads to reach here are very narrow.

title: Fantastic place to be around
review: We have been there for some sort of a picnic with friends and loved this place ! The area is quite cool and not too many disturbs you ! We carried our food and beverages and Sat in one of the Hawa Mahal ( pit Stop ) ! While we were there and we knew there is small place where there are orphan kids , we plan to go there as well !

title: Waste of Time & Money
review: It claims to have a great view, but as we were staying in JW, We already had that view and not only that views like those can be seen from most parts of Mussoorie.

title: Best Sunset Ever!
review: The walk to this place is lovely and if the weather is good, you'll be lucky to see the most spectacular sunset of your life.

title: LOVELY BREATHTAKING VIEWS
review: MUST VISIT PLACE WHEN U VIST MUSSOORIE.... the view is amazing .  u can enjoy some little snack... tea coffee , maggi etc with a breath taking view of the valley, One suggestion.... the drive towards 4 dukkan and lal tibba is steep so drive carefully and if ur not so confident with driving on steep hill better take a local taxi.

title: Our pre honeymoon :-)
review: Fantastic place with cloud covered hilltop...fresh air... Breathe easy..  lovely smell of woods.. Overall fantastic

title: Trip to Mussoorie
review: Amazing views, great place to be. One of the best place in Mussoorie and the highest peak of Mussoorie as well. Loved the climate and the view u get to see is beautiful. Worth spending time in lal tibba. Must visit klick cafe in lal tibba

title: What a view!
review: This is a must see in Mussourie. Beautiful walk and incredible surroundings! We visited in July, so the clouds were coming in and out. Just awesome!

title: Lovely walk with the little one
review: The walk from char dukaan up to lal Tibba and then back was excellent. It's a circular walk around old houses, buildings, big trees and on a nice cemented road with the odd vehicle coming along. Take sometime and is lonely but do it. Don't get scAred or worried. It's worth the time and the memories and the journey. The views from lal tibba are superb and clouds all around are a delight.

title: Love
review: I loved this place quite and mesmerizing a must visit place for everyone i must say. take a round and u would love the nature for sure

title: Good Views
review: Lal Tibba is at one end of a circular walk one can take in Landour - Bada Chakkar. The whole walk itself is beautiful. However there is nothing very special about Lal Tibba per se.

title: great experience
review: a must visit place. from char dukaan to lal tibba walk was awesome. but there is nothing special in laltibba. you can enjoy walk and take some photos.

title: Family trek
review: It was nice especially Anils cafe ka bun omelette..amazingeven the valley view was great..Lovely weather..Too good

title: Experience
review: Guys went to Lal tibba but I didn't find anything exciting......specially after walking so much it was just waste of time....so before going  just make sure...but there are char dukkan and you can eat some nice pav egg which is famous out there.....

title: Nostalgia
review: Awesome place for cycling and this round trip from chaar dukan to chaar dukan by laal tibba will be d best memories of ur life as it is of my life now.........its healthy adventurous and scenic...... U can enjoy d smoothing cool breeze with chirping of birds...... U can enjoy d darkness of trees with few rays coming out of those tress........ Very beautiful estates.........cycling trip is a must in lifetime if u r in mussoorie.

title: Amazing Hill views
review: One has to travel through very narrow roads of old mussoorie to reach Lal Tibba. However, it is advisable to visit only when the weather is clear else the Himalayan range is not visible due to dense fog.

title: Scenic beauty enjoy n hot coffee hand made
review: Lal Tibba binoculars since 1942 in India n placed at this place by Mr Krishna Lal Thukral in 1969 is heaven on earth . Enjoyed quite place with mesmerizing hot hand made coffee n pan pizza was just in beatable . Must visit .

title: Track to Lal Tibba from Char Dukan
review: Its a beautiful to walk from Char Dukan to Lal Tibba. In view of full nature & when you reach Lal Tibba then you get immerse in to beautiful valley views. Lal Tibba had a couple of Cafes which offer good food as well.

title: Away from hustle bustle of mussoorie
review: Go here if you're looking for some peace and quiet.. Away from the crowds of the mall road..

title: LAL Tibba
review: The location is good but there are no facilities even like a washroom.  You have to climb to the second floor if one of the two restaurants who charge 20 rupees per head.  The up keep is awful.  The saving grace is the binoculars which let you have a good look.  you can get good pictures.  The place is a tourist attraction and should be maintained better.

title: Lal Tibba
review: Amazing view from the only 2 restaurants available. They claim to have the best binocular available in india. Didn't get a chance to see it since clouds were heavy. But believed it seeing the beautiful view.

title: Amazing view
review: Landour ia a place you would like to settle down at. This place hides the abode of so many celebrities like Ruskin Bond, Sachin Tendulkar, Vishal Bhardwaj.... I am sure once you spend a couple of days here, you would appeal yourself to stay there forever.

title: Amazing View
review: View from this place is amazing and if you visit at the time of snowfall, place looks not less than heaven. Have some omelette and tea there and enjoy weather :)

title: Visit to Lal Tibba
review: This is the highest point in Mussoorie. One gets a good view of Mussoorie, but again there is no good hotel to have snacks etc. Very poorly maintained. One can visit once, if one has plenty of time available.

title: Mesmerising Views of Himalayan Mountain Peaks
review: Lal Tibba is located at Depot Hill in Landour which is the highest point in Mussoorie. It is still untouched by commercialization. Lal Tibba is the highest peak of the hill station and it offers spectacular views of snow capped peaks which house the most revered shrines of India- Kedarnath and Badrinath.
