Visitors can enjoy a clearer view of the surroundings through a Japanese telescope that has been installed at the edge of the cliff. Apart from mountain views, tranquil environment of Lal Tibba is relaxing. It also has old British architectural style hill houses where Indian Military services and Broadcasting stations or towers of All India Radio and Doordarshan are working now. There are some good places nearby to dine and these are Cafe Ivy, Anil's Cafe Char Dukan , The Mudcup Café.

title: Everything appears red.
review: This also an amazing place where everything appears red (as name suggests) during sunset. This place is good for a wonderful activity like trekking.

title: A point of solace
review: A place where you can just relax and let go off the walking you have recently done in mussoorie. It makes you feel chilled out and at home along with the tea point. It is a tad bit expensive but if you go in winters you wouldn't resist for some Maggi plus tea.

title: must visit place
review: must visit to lal tibba and have a cheese maggie out there love u mussoorie.. I think its a porchse area of mussoorie. Most of the well knowned people stay there such as Ruskkin Bond and Victor Banerjee

title: Nice experience
review: If you want peace and want to connect with nature go to Lal Tibba track and don't forget to visit landour bakehouse in sister's bazzar.

title: Wonderful. Highest point in Mussorie.
review: Its a scenic place. One can see Mussorie from this highest point. One can park the car in Landour near the St Pauls Church and take a walk to this point which is a nice road. I prefer walking this road rather than taking the car straight up to the last point. Also there at the top a old age Binocular installed by the British in 1942 is there. You can see the village below which was settled by the British and a Mandir (temple). You can also see the Himalayan range if the weather is clear. have a cup of coffee at the rooftop. Enjoy the panoramic natural beauty and weather.

title: Nothing special
review: Well the views are good but not great. The only good thing around Lal tibba was char dukaan and cafe ivy! Do not forget to try the waffles at cafe ivy and pancakes at Anil's cafe.

title: Overrated
review: The view from here is not worth it. The road to this place is more scenic.

title: Holidays
review: Worth visiting at least one time. I love driving to Lal Tibba, really thrilling. Cool and lovely, nature watching hill top.

title: Good Place to Go Walking if you have half a day.
review: The place is simple, and nothing to be excited about. You can see wid birds and if lucky then Red Panda also crossing your way.

title: unless u want to sip coffee or eat something at a quaint place.
review: the road to reach here and then find that there is nothing special about it except for 2 men made hype (becoz they hv their 2 restaurants here with open to sky terrace with long distance binoculars to look from at the mountain ranges.

title: Good place if the wether is fine
review: It's a great place with quite walkways deep pine forests, deep valleys and quite environment....... The fact that Sachin Tendulkar and Ruskin Bond also stays there adds to the attraction

title: highest point of Mussoorie
review: highest point of mussoorie and very peaceful... It is one of the best place for nature lovers,gives you a beautiful view of the doon valley and also make you feel the fresh air. It is a must visit place for all the tourists.

title: The view!
review: Great view of the valley (depends on the time of visit, due to fog). View through binoculars isn't that great, take your own if you have one. There are a couple of small cafes too, serving maggi and coffee. Visit Ivy cafe nearby if possible in the evening. Roads leading to lal tibba are narrow and may get clogged.

title: All Tibba
review: Just waste of time to go lay Tibba and dhanouty.nothing interesting  in both the places as they are not at all good points of seneic  beauty

title: Average place. Warning: too steep a climb
review: One has to pass through narrow lanes to reach this place. Be warned that the climb is extremely steep for vehicles. Also, one might have to wait for vehicles coming from opposite side. This is tricky if one are driving uphill, even more so if there are rear passengers.

title: excellent spot
review: this was an excellent spot to visit and take view of high peaks.  these peaks are covered with snow.  with awesome weather and lovely view worth visiting.

title: Peaceful
review: One of the best places to visit in mussoorie .. Himalayan view is just amazing. A beautiful walk before you sit down to eat ..

title: Top of Mussoorie
review: Going and coming is a task and jams r common, Go in morning before 10, it's worth it.

title: Waste of time
review: This is a 3 storey terraced structure with a telescope on the top. The telescope must be 25 years old, with poor visibility. You have a whole host of people pushing and elbowing you around. Opposite Lal Tibba is a restaurant, the terrace of which has a more organised viewing gallery.

title: Must walk to Lal Tibba from Char Dukaan
review: The walk from Char dukaan to Lal Tibba is BEAUTIFUL! The mountain air, the pine trees, the clean roads, the old stone houses, the views.. Aah, it's as good as it can get! Lal Tibba itself is a point on the road where people climb a view point to check out the views. I didn't climb the view point to see the view but it is likely to be similar to the beautiful view one gets while walking to the place. Doing the walk to Lal Tibba is a must in Landour. It'll make you fall in love with nature all over again!

title: Great view
review: On a clear day it should give views on Gangotri  Badri and Kedarnath. even without clear days, which are few, it is a very good sight.  There r a couple of restaurants which charge a few to go on top of their buildings and view via a set telescope

title: Breathtaking
review: Must visit if you are in Mussoorie. It is the highest point of Mussoorie. Beautiful scenery. You can even view snow clad himalayas from there. However, avoid going to hills at night as one of my acquaintance staying there has informed that there are wild animals there who attack if they feel threatened.

title: Lal Tibba, mussoorie
review: Picturesque place atop mussoorie. Narrow road requires skilled drivers but both the journey and the destination are rewarding in itself. We went there along with some friends who reside in mussoorie and who swore by its beauty, the yummy Maggie and cheese toast and pancakes of char Duran and the tikona park, Victor banerjee n Sachins house and ancient mountain houses built in British style, a lonely Mazar well protected by a tree and a huge stone lifted by the trees roots which is a wonder in itself. Lal Tibba was in the British Era, a place with fresh air atop a hill, where the ailing British troops were sent to convalescent from the diseases. Those who couldn't make it were buried there in the cemetery. Sisters Bazar is named after a Catholic sister who stayed there to serve the forces.A truly must visit, I went there on friends recommendation and I recommend it too... A must visit place esp for the metro people like us.. Who can't oblige our so obliging friends in turn with a place so breathtakingly beautiful, soulful and picturesque as lal Tibba... Thanku friends for taking me to a virtual heaven on earth... What a respite from the hustle bustle of our city life...

title: top of the world
review: its good for those who want to go for small vacation with less expense. kids find good walking towards lal tibba ,, small mountain top for entertainment of small kids

title: Highest point of Mussoorie
review: Lal Tibba,maths highest point in Mussoorie, is accessible from the Landour side of the city.

title: Best location for views of Gangotri peak, Lal Bahadur Shastri Academy, etc.
review: Do not forget to take a powerful digital SLR camera. You will be able to view and take pictures of Gangotri peak and many other beautiful locations from Lal Tibba.

title: Nothing special
review: It gives you a bird's eye view of snow covered himalayas. There is a telescope which is very old and hence everything you see through it appears to be abstract and bizarre. A DSLR or any zoom camera would give you a better abd clearer picture of that. Even if you see it through naked eyes, it will be clearer. It is a good point for clicking pictures. There are two eateries. Apart from that there is nothing special.

title: Beautiful place
review: Better point to stay for peace lover with nature's view if there had good hotels. Moreover, approach through vehicle is very narrow

title: Natural Rehab
review: It was peak summers in delhi and temperature was around 48 degrees. And than when I reached mussoorie as I stepped out of the car I was just amazed and regretted on my life that why m I staying in that oven! but than I thought that if every delhite started thinking like this than they will convert this paradise into there oven.

title: Waste of time
review: Nothing extraordinary is there. Just the regular scenic view of Mussoorie . Cliffs , clids and rocks. My friend insisted me to visit here but we came after 10 minutes

title: Soon valley view
review: Lovely vantage point to get view of Doon valley. The are is beautiful. One must visit charr Dukakis when you are visiting Lal tibia. It is in a town called Landore which is just 8 k.m. From Mussoorie. Have lunch in Rokby Manor excellent food and great location.

title: A One Time Place
review: The Lal Tibba is known as the "Highest Point in Mussoorie" but quite frankly other than it's "Height" there's nothing much to see here, to be honest. There's a Telescope or the top of a restaurant from which you can barely see and for Rs.20 a really warm and friendly man will show you a temple on a hill. That's it. The only thing that I found to be good there was the view and the wind plus their Cold Coffee..!!

title: Nothing out of ordinary!!
review: The best way to reach Lal Tibba is to walk from the Char Dukaan, which is hardly a 30 mins walk. You will not regret it, as its a beautiful path.

title: Must visit in the morning.
review: Had a nice time here. Spent around 3 hours...

title: Windy highest point in Mussoorie
review: Lal Tibba is better known as the highest point in Mussoorie.

title: high peak
review: One of the very high peak in the area and awesome views can be seen from here. One must visit this place to have a larger view of the mountain ranges.

title: Excited to visit
review: It was just amazing. One can see the range of the Sibalik mountains from this place. The place is just soundless and just ready to worship the God. Children also felt encouraging. The coffee served to us by Didi is really very good. Next time again I will visit, this is sayings of my daughter, as we have forced to leave the place after two hours of lovely stay there on.

title: Go for great views
review: The highest point in Mussoorie, this is best visited early morning when the touristy crowd is still sleeping. You have a viewing bay here where for a small fee you can see the peaks with a telescope. The view of deodar forests from Lal Tibba is breathtaking. There is also a small cafe nearby where you can have a nice cup of tea sitting in lap of nature and enjoying the views.

title: Walk to the Lal Tiba and not by vehicle
review: To reach Lal Tiba you have to cross narrow streets some 25km from the city of Mussoorie. Once you reach there after some traffic jams, do not make the mistake of taking the vehicle upto the Lal Tiba, lest you miss the chance of taking a 2km walk up and 2km back around the hill. Stop your vehicle next to the parking lot opp St Pauls Church and walk into the state of well being. Just keep on walking enjoying the natural beauty around. After all you are there to enjoy the weather and the scenery around.

title: Great views
review: Lal tibba is an awesome place to be in Mussoorie, with friends and family alike. The weather, eateries, cafe's are a rage here... View of the Himalayas is breathtaking

title: Heavenly!!
review: Breath taking view and calm. One time visit.. won't hurt!

title: Not worthy just a binocular
review: Lal tibba is just a shop a point they charge 20/- to see from binocular and view is not much worthy. Only one shop, better to bring some food item with you. instead of binocular there is a right side road, it has some good view.

title: amazing views
review: The views from here were very nice. Go to this place for sunrise and sunset. Both are very nice. Sunrise is better.

title: Great location
review: Lal tibba is in the Landour area and enables a fascinating view of the hills especially the Dhanaulti range , there is a cafe with an old telescope through which the hills and villages can be seen , The cafe charges ₹20 per person per view or has special food packages which include a view. The terrace top telescope is managed by Mr Jai Singh who is a guide and a photographer , in his 20 TH year on the job , he is extremely enthusiastic and exudes positive energy , he personally delivers the prints to hotel by evening , and amazingly like a typical person of the hills walks up down from below the library road area , very inspiring .

title: Lal Tibba
review: Excellent location to see peaks of Gangotri and Yamunotri and must visit to Rakeby Manor for lunch. Also recommend to walk around this place it is a very serene atmosphere with great views

title: A serene promenade
review: The road to Lal Tibba takes you to a tranquil walk, on a road lined with lovely flora, away from the bustle of the city. It is this very lane that houses the residence of actor Victor Banerjee, a few other private residential properties, an old school and a cemetry. Don't miss the walk!!!

title: nice place to watch sunset
review: on the way to lal tibba, please stop at char dukan and have tea or go to cafe Ivy

title: Beautiful place with scenic views
review: Laal tibba is actually a view point and the highest point of mussoorie. It is just 5 kms from the mall road. There is a place you cross while going to Laal Tibba, called char dukan which has some small yet amazing snack joints. I would recommend to walk from char dukaan to lal tibba, its beautiful.

title: Good for a view
review: Beautiful view and chai at Lal tibba!  Nice to get there early and walk around.  There is a view point and a small cafe serving hot and cold drinks. Tables by the road side, the location is quite and serene.

title: Amazing views!
review: The best way to reach Lal Tibba is to walk there from Char Dukaan - about 30 minutes. Since it was a hazy day we could not see the mountain tops clearly but believe this would be fantastic on a clear day. The guide at Lal Tibba was helpful, friendly and informative. This is also a great place for a quick bite where one can enjoy snacks in a quiet, serene place with spectacular views all around.

title: Highest point at Mussoorie
review: Lal Tibba is the highest point at Mussorie, a place which is a must visit. However, on the day we visited, it was Saturday falling in between a long week end and there was too much of traffic jam on way to and also on return. On the way there is a place called Char Dukan where you can do some souvenir shopping or enjoy refreshments / meals. Also in the vicinity is Hotel Rokeby which is supposed to be facility owned by Sachin Tendulkar and his partner. The place offers stay and fine dine facility,but we could not eat at the place due to long waiting. At the point there are good opportunities to get some good pictures.

title: Lovely view
review: On a clear morning you can see the snowy tips of the Himalayas. The walk is a little steep but it's short. Also there are some delightful cafes on the route.

title: Beautiful !
review: Simply beautiful and serene view will give your mind a soothing feel . Just sit back and enjoy the nature!

title: High & Higher..
review: Just at a stone's throw from char dukan this place is the highest place in Mussoorie . From here a panaromic view of the himalayan range can be seen provided the mother nature favors you. We had no such luck as the clouds surrounded us from all sides. The atmosphere there was soothing to the body and soul. On a clear day your day will be made.

title: Nice place for a little walk
review: It's a small hike from Char Dukan. You can have some great views from this place. The place is beautiful. You can sit at the top and just enjoy the views , while the wind blows your hair. It's a superb feeling.

title: Good view !
review: Enjoyed the good scenic view . Binoculars on top really gives very good view. There is a small shop on way next to stairs . enjoyed delicious veg momos there . Good place to visit and the road leading to Lal Tibba is a good walking track

title: Probably the place one should not miss!
review: Breathtaking view of the Garhwal mountains and on a clean and sunny day you may have a grand view o the Himalayas from here.

title: Highest view point of Mussoorie
review: Around 15-20 minutes ride from mall road. We heard that if weather is clear we could see many points like Kedarnath, Badrinath peeks China border etc. with big telescope, but the day on which we visited weather was not very much clear it was very cloudy so guide showed us a couple of local points which were visible with naked eyes also. So try to visit this point when weather is clear.

title: Beautiful Walk
review: If you are planning to go to Lal Tibba, go on foot. Its a beautiful and entertaining path. Starting from picture palace, after walking a few meters, you would reach the Little Lama Cafe. You can try some different kind of food items here. After another 15 mins walk, you reach Doma's Inn. Its a Tibetan style, beautiful restaurant. They rent bikes and Scooty as well. Its very close to Ruskin Bond's home. On the way you go through old Mussoorie, Landhaur Bazar. Your next stop is Char Dokan. Form Doma's Inn to Char Dokan, it takes from half an hour to 45 minutes depending upon your physical strength, as its a steep hike. Char Dokan is a very delicious place. I am saying this because you can have many delicious items here. We tried aloo parantha, pan cake and shakes at the first shop while going. Then your last stop is Lal Tibba. From Char Dokan to Lal Tibba, its an easy beautiful romantic walk through woods. Lal Tibba is the highest point in Mussoorie. There is a view point with  binoculars. If you are lucky enough and the sky is clear, you might see snow covered Himalayan range from there. Try chocolate shake at view point. Best time to visit this place, according to my experience, is early morning and you should have breakfast at Char Dokan.

title: Beautiful place to visit once you are in Mussoorie.
review: Very nice breakfast sitting at top of the hill with peaks of Himalaya in front of you is unforgettable.

title: Lal Tibba
review: An isolated off the mainland area of Mussorie. A decent place to relax until it is dusky. Local shops prepare limited types of snacks that most people relish.

title: The highest point of Mussoorie
review: Lal Tibba is an absolute beauty when we are talking about the view, basically it is said to be the highest point of Mussoorie and you can see the Himalayan belt on a good day.

title: Scenic place
review: Worth visiting. Walking distance from chaar dukaan. Do not take cabs for this one as its a pretty straight forward walk.

title: Highest Point!
review: This is the highest point in Mussoorie and you can see most of the mountain ranges depending on the visibility. Travelling by car is the best mode of transport.

title: Useless placr
review: This place is an utter waste of time. Its a small cafe with a binocular installed on 2nd floor. But the binocular lenses are spoilt and there is no view.

title: Highest scenic place !!!
review: Its only a highest place of mussoorie, from where you can go around a 180 degree scenic view of snow covered hills. Average place to go .

title: not maintiained
review: getting there is a bit of an exercise and the place is not maintained. though at a height and the view from the top is breath taking much could have been done

title: great view
review: Just a top view of mussoorie at height of around 8000ft there are two binoculars facility, paid and free. Choose the free one at the pizza shop its pizza is also different and good

title: Lal tibba - highest point of Mussoorie
review: Highest point in Mussoorie at 7580 sq ft.. Visit this place for some quiet time.. on days when the sky is clear 1 can see the snow capped Himalayas.. road is treacherous. Do engage local cab for the travel.. do visit this old red three storeyed cottage for a good view of the surroundings and the Himalayas! The my charge ₹ 20 per person for the view or alternatively you can purchase any food item for free entry.. must try are the kit Kat shake and chicken pan pizza.. on the way you can also visit the gun point and further down - char dukan.. which is famous for its coffee and pan cakes (haven't tried it myself).. ride to and fro from Mall Road to lal tibba would cost any where between ₹ 1000-1200 in a sedan or SUV..

title: Highest Point in Landour (Mussoorie)
review: Its about few hundred meters from Chardukan, Landour. From Laal Tibba, a complete 360 degree view of the Himalayan ranges could be seen. It has entry fee of Rs 20 per person. There is a restaurant there where one can enjoy cup of hot coffee or other snacks as well Maggiee with beautiful view of the Himalayas and the valley. On the top floor, there is a Telescope which allows breathtaking views of Himalayas...the shop at the bottom also sells local made Chocolates and candies apart from other delicacies....must see place...One can walk up and down here while being at Landour...the walking through the Deodar forest is amazing......

title: Over hyped
review: Nothing exceptionally great about it. It's ok types.

title: Don't expect much...
review: There is nothing much to see in mussorie altogether, so you hardly have any option but to visit few average places that are there.

title: Much hiked places
review: This is the highest point in mussorie. You can ahve a  look of valleys and mountains. There is nothing very special.

title: Its really beautiful place of Mussoorie and everyone should visit here once.
review: from here you can see most of beautiful places all around and we hope once you will visit you will enjoy

title: Good in afternoons or evenings
review: Good for sunset if weather is clear than crowded morning. Good view. You can go to white building and not red. Red building an outlet charging Rs 20 each to go on view point terrace.

title: Is it Mussoorie?
review: Barely 3-4 kilometer outside the hustle and bustle of the Mussoorie this is a little heaven. Lined by long Deodar tress and clean road this is walker's dream. Carry a book, order a cup of tea and Maggi in one of the two cafes in Lal Tibba and I could spent a whole day doing nothing and just enjoying the view and the calmness of the place. You may give a miss to the Kempty falls but do not miss Lal Tibba if you are a nature lover.

title: Good Experience when in Mussoorie.
review: This is a good place to visit which is much colder than Mussoorie. It is worth visiting on one of the mornings for a bird eye view of the city and some walk.

title: the best place to go in Mussoorie
review: its the highest pint in Mussoorie with a fantastic view of the snow caps...there is a 18th century graveyard just a few minutes walk from there,hidden in the pine forest,nice and eerie.

title: Mesmerising!
review: Click view is where you should enjoy a hot drink, some snacks and the breathtaking view of the snow covered peaks! Their telescope is far more modern.

title: Lal Tibba
review: Roads are very narrow. So, only 1 car can go at a time and I will not recommend to visit this place as I got stuck in middle with my car and I had to reverse the car on the 60 degree inclined road

title: Disappointment
review: It promises great views but we didn't enjoy aby due to clouds. The walk up to it from Char Dukan was nice.

title: Great views
review: Breathtaking views consistently across the entire area. Fresh air, well maintained areas, and a lot of peace. The trip to and from this area is quite a thrill too.

title: Nice tourist place
review: Very nice place to see the heritage of our country and get some fresh Oxygen this place is really A must visit.

title: Good views of Mussoorie from height
review: Way to the point is too narrow. You must be a good driver and be ready to stuck many times at dangerous slopes.

title: Highest point in Mussoorie Region
review: There is one private twi storied property run by a friendly owner lady. You can go to the upper levels by paying a fee of Rs 20/- PP or you can choose to buy a cup of hot delicious coffee which allows free entry. There is place to sit on the both floors where you can sit and enjoy the mystic view of the Himalayas and thru 1967 Japanese Telescope you can see Gangotri, Kedarnath, Badrinath etc on a clear sunny day. Tip:- Come before 12 Noon to improve chances of clear view else in the noon clouds may come over hills and spoil the view.

title: Top most of Mussoorie
review: On New year I have been there with family and friends, this place is the highest point of mussoorie. 2-3 old telescope installed on the the roofs, the person charged 10 Rs per head. You can see the Gangotri and Jamnotri peaks from there, the beautiful scene of forest and clouds. Sometime in Winter you can see the heavy snow fall if you are lucky enough.

title: Scenic View
review: The view offered on the top of Lal Tibba is certainly wonderful (I for the first time was able to take a 360* panoramic photo) but also wonderful is the quality/taste of the items served! Don't miss it!

title: Natural Hill Top
review: This place is usually neglected by travellers but it is surely worth visiting as it is serene, natural, huge greenery and very nice for photography lovers

title: Nice view from lal tibba
review: its a nice view from lal tibba , we can see himalayan glacier from here, visit in early morning before 10 am to have nice view. after 10 cloud come over glacier

title: Heaven
review: Lal Tibba is approx. 4.5 Kms from main Mussoorie. It is a good tourist spot and tourist are attracted towards it as it is still untouched by commercialization and other commercial activities. Lal Tibba gives you a mesmerizing view of the Himalayan Range, one can closely have a look at the peaks like Bandarpunch, Yamnotri, Gangotri, etc. with telescope which was installed there by the municipal authorities in 1960's.

title: Walking in the clouds!
review: Wonderful view! We were in Landaur for a few days and luckily the very last day there was a clear sky with great views of the snow capped mountains. If you are planning to visit that lookout spot it's best to ask about weather conditions. We were told that between 10 and 12:30 is best for views since it can become misty during the afternoon - which it did. I'm not sure if that is only in March - but do suggest that you check out the weather and the timing to try to get the best view.

title: Nice views
review: A view point with a nice little cafe . There is a huge binoculars to get  Himalayan views. I could see more with the naked eyes though ! We went around 5 in the evening and had an amazing sunset view. Also tried the next day and the pics came out great ! They have a 20 rs charge pp for going upstairs and checking the view out ! If you order something feom the cafe, they give you free entry

title: Mesmerizing View!
review: When me and my family visited Lal Tibba last weekend, it was snowing and the place was full of snow. The view was amazing. I was awestruck with the view.

title: Not to be missed!
review: The path to Lal Tibba can test your fitness, but the  view is heavenly and certainly worth the trudge!

title: View and food
review: This place is little far and the access road is bit tricky. So its advisable to go with a driver. View from this place is very nice and there is a shop where you have to pay Rs. 20 to go upstairs to have better view. this includes telescopic view. Before lal tibba there is char dukan where food is very good.

title: Looong walk
review: It was a bit disappointing to walk the long winding route and then there was nothing not even a gorgeous view

title: Good
review: You can see Very good view of ice covered himalya. One time visit. Some relaxing moments can spend here.

title: Great view
review: Offers spectacular views of the mountains. The taxis however charge a bomb for an excursion. Though only 4 kms not walkable due to the very steep incline.

title: Awesome
review: When we walked and reached Lal Tibba, Sun was quite strong. But the chilling factor was there. Still remembered last visit way thirty years back. That great view was still breathtaking but we couldn't find snow. A very tiring walk but worth visiting.

title: Awesome view
review: Awesome view..the walk in the clouds in  real sense... a quite peaceful environment and a cup  of coffee..

title: Not great
review: The main attraction of Himalayan view is not clearly visible from this place. Though nearby coffee and camera shops will try to sell this place

title: Very good place
review: U will get very good view worth going, place is at height and near from library Chowk, u get view of city and mountain

title: very good place if you want to see Himalaya
review: lal tibba achi jagah hai, par waha tak drive karna thoda mushkil hai, par aap jab upar pahuchte hai to aap sab bhul jate hai kafi acha najara dekhne ko milta hai, par waha par do shops hai jo apni chatt par jane ke liye charge karti hai aor wo bhi bade rude tarike se 20 rupees for per person, aap yaha se mussoorie aor Himalaya ko ache se dekh sakte ho.

title: Must visit
review: One  of the less visited spots in Mussoorie, probably due to accessibility, this is a must visit place. Fresh cool air, amazing views, surrounded by tall, pine trees, this is it. A walk up to Lal Tibba and down, was certainly the high point of our Mussoorie trip

title: beautiful view
review: visiting this place is memorable experience, but reaching there is very hectic way to this place from mussorie is very full of chaos and narrow way for cars but finally when you reach their all is paisa wasool means worth it . visit this place

title: Beautifull Himalaya view on a sunny day. We enjoyed the view and the excellent coffee
review: Beautifull Himalaya view. Excellent cappuccino. This visit makes you a happy person if its a sunny day

title: Good walk around the chakkar
review: It is just surreal having a walk around the chakkar. There you see the much talked about Lal Tibba. When the weather is clear, you can see mountain peaks through the telescope.there, but going there on a cloudy day would be a waste. The tea shop out there gives you a break to have a cup of tea and admire the beauty around.

title: top peak of mussoorie . see badrinath from here
review: Its situated bit far away from mussoorie . i walked from mussorie to here with a bycycle . i though of giving up many times but i didnt . i did not feel regret when i reached there . the view was mindblowing

title: Excellent Himlayan View on a Sunny clear sky
review: The place is a nice walk from the char dukan. Its breathtakingly awesome. You get a clear view of some of the himalayan ranges like kedar and badrinath on a clear sky. Also doon valley looks stunningly beautiful

title: The vantage point
review: This is amongst the highest points in Mussoorie - and with a breathtaking view of the snowcapped Himalayan range...

title: Don't expect much...
review: It's just a highest point of the Mussoorie. There are two buildings there which are taken over by private shop owners. They charge tickets for tourist to go to the terrace. I don't think they have Valid to do that.

title: The Pine forest
review: greenery everywhere

title: Excellent views
review: Providing a clear view of the hills and valleys around the city, it is an amazing place. The highest point of Mussoorie, you should not miss this place and is a must visit for the Char Dukan...

title: Good Place to go to
review: Not very crowded. can see a good distance away till the himalayas. A very enterprising lady serves great food to go with the weather

title: Excellent Himalayan mountains view
review: It was an enjoyable visit to Lal tibba the highest point of Mussorie. Being a sunny day the snow capped himalayan mountain view was excellent

title: Overrated...
review: Heard a lot of this place when I was in Mussorie. On my visit did not find it that attractive. A visit to Dhanaulti is perhaps a better choice which gives you a much better and serene view of the Himalays.

title: Snowscaped mountains
review: The chocolate pancakes of char dukaan are die for . They are yumm and in the cool weather with fresh breeze these pancakes and coffee would be very much delighting . Also tbere is a church near char dukaan it has a calm and soothing ambience . One can enjy visiting there with frnds and couples .

title: Mist covered mountains!
review: Lal Tibba is the highest point in Mussoorie and is located about 5 km from the main town. It boasts great views of the himalayan ranges and is worth a visit for the lovely ride to the place itself. Unfortunately we visited on a very misty morning and couldn't view the mountains in all their splendor but it's worth a one time visit all the same.

title: Nice place but Overrated...
review: Its a nice place to see the sunset but being a tourist attraction it gets crowded and you kind of lose the charm. There are other unexplored roads in Landour which will give you serene sunrise and sunset views. Explore them on foot or rent a bike.

title: Best place in mussorie
review: This is the best place in mussorie.  Amazing view of the great indian himalayan range from here. Area close to it is also good for walk ..

title: Lovely view of Himayala's
review: Its one of the highest point of Mussorie giving u complete 360 degree views of valleys/ mountain of mussorie .

title: High place in Mussoorie
review: Very cold place. You can see some Himalaya pic with open eyes. One of best tourist attractions in Mussoorie.

title: Nice place to see snow fall and click pictures
review: This place is a must visit during snow fall as you can see those snow covered pine trees in the month of January. There are 2 restaurants which provides amazing view and nice snacks with bonfire.

title: Nice scenic view
review: a very nice scenic view from there. A good point for chill out with family and friend OR peaceful environment for romantic hangouts.

title: nice view point should not miss
review: nice view point should not miss , mainly the road reach it, just feel the road & the old Mussoriee test

title: Nice View!
review: Nice view- esp. of the snow! The walk up from Picture Palace is also nice if you have the stamina. Taking the car up can sometimes be a problem because of the traffic jam.

title: A place from where you never want to come back
review: Highly scenic, awesome weather, very close to nature and lovely people, these all attributes make this space special. Once you spend some time here you never want to come back from there. Must visit place if you are are planning to visit Mussoorie.

title: A good walk
review: A nice view. Coffee/Tea and Maggi. It is bracing walk with a viewing point and with the cold a warm drink omelettes and a Maggi would be what the doctor ordered.

title: There should be a word for something better than excellent here!
review: It was one of the best hilly trips in my life. The walk upto Tibba is a little tiring but once you reach the top, I am sure it is difficult to stop smiling.

title: Nice&beautiful
review: Lal Tibba is the highest peak's topmost point and most famous place in Mussoorie. ... Located at the Landour area in Depot Hill, Lal Tibba provides a mesmerising views of Himalayan mountain peaks. ... Lal Tibba of Mussoorie is located at 4.5 kms from Mussoorie city at Landour Rd.

title: Good  view of the mountains
review: This place  is located in/near Landour & one must visit for natural beauty  . Road to Landour is too small . Thanks to our driver who knew the road & how to drive. One should  also  visit a point called chardukan where one can have some snacks or lunch . There are 4/5 Dhaba type rest/cafes  and a classy cafe called Ivy cafe.  I liked view from Lal Tibba  &  char dukan area. With this my trip to Lal Tibba looked complete.

title: the highest point!!
review: the highest point in mussoorie, lal tibba offers spectacular views of the himalayan ranges including kedarnath and badrinath mountain ranges on a clear day. start early when the sky is clear.

title: Just amazing
review: Quite ... chilling and amazing place... u can really have a peaceful experience... not crowded at all.. would love to visit again

title: Could be a nice place!
review: We visited yesterday with 2 kids but we still wonder why we visited.. Too much hyped place n too crowded.. Only a terrace that too charge 20 bucks to be thr.. But yes if you walk above that point that's calm n scenic!! Visit at your own risk..

title: The highest point in the Queen of Hills.
review: Lal Tibba and the adjacent Landour cantt are so different from the main city, which now has become so over crowded that one does not enjoy the salubrious climate and the clean air, it was famous for till even late 1960s I have been to Mussoorie so many times and know all the nooks and corners of this nostalgic town. Lal Tibba is a must-visit place when one is in Mussoorie.

title: Highest view point
review: It is a bit overrated really being a high viewing point to soak into the sight of the valley and he mountains. But I still recommend it for the walk across the beautiful long trees from char dukan. Also, ill-maintained the Japanese binoculars were new experience...

title: Good view, a little tough to reach for vacationers with kids if it's snowed but worth it
review: Guided by a local friend, we managed to drive up to this highest point (as was reported). One can get some good views of the Himalayas from here, but sadly the day was too clouded. It was on the part of the hill where we didn't have direct sunlight, so some of the previous weekend's snow was still there /hadn't melted away - - and the kids enjoyed it. There's a small shop and on top of the terrace there's a fixed old school binoculars and to access it the shop below charges 20 bucks/head. They alternatively get you to order some stuff from the eatery and waive this 20 bucks per person charge for every dish ordered. I suggest that one can simply pay the 20 bucks, instead of ordering  a hot chocolate for 120 (like I did). Plenty of eating options at Char dukaan or Rokeby nearby. Enjoy the views, take some selfies and share away - - it's nothing fancy, but definitely worth checking off the list if you've made it to this part of the world.

title: Viewpoint
review: Lal tibba is just the highest point of Mussoorie from where you can view the snow covered peaks. It also has a small restaurant serving Maggi etc.

title: Highest Point
review: The highest point in Mussorie. Reaching there is a bit problematic as the roads are not proper, but still local drivers are good enough to find ways to reach.

title: A Picturesque Viewpoint
review: The way upto the destination is full of steep roads so choose a powerful car and an experienced driver to get up there. Also, preferable time to visit is when there is little sunshine as it looks more soothing the eyes with all the lush green and ice caps of the Shivalik Range. The food of the eatery downstairs serves pretty good food and also, if you order something from them, they don't charge you for the entry to the viewpoint.

title: One of the best views in mussoorie
review: This place offers very good views of himalayas from mussoorie (ofcourse if you are going to dhanaulti or other place they will beat this, but in mussoorie this is the best place), returning back char dukan is old and famous and offers good food!

title: Second highest point in Mussoorie
review: Pointers:

title: The place where you get the most sensational view
review: I visited Mussoorie last weekend with my gang of friends. Going to Lal Tibba was not on the itinerary but when asked by our hotel manager we planned it and it was the best decision we took. Snow-capped mountains, lush greenery, and cold mountain air made it all worth it. The binoculars are provided to help you get a closer view of the snowy mountains. Also, there is a small cafe where you can enjoy maggi and coffee. On the way to Lal Tibba, you will find a number of cafes lined up. The most famous being the Char Dukan. My personal favourite is Cafe Ivy. the loved the interiors of this cafe and the food is also delicious.

title: Top of Tehri Garhwal
review: Not quite technically, as Surkanda devi is the highest in Tehri region of Garhwal. This place is for someone who loves sighting peaks. Way to this place from Mussoorie market area is a nice choice for a walk. defence or central govt employees have an option to stay at the DRDO place adjacent to Laltibba if available.Do not forget to carry your binoculars.Better the power better your sighting.

title: Highest point near Mussoorie
review: This is located at about 8000feet. Very good views on clear sunny day. Nice restaurant at top. Only small cars go as road is narrow and steep.

title: Lal tiba
review: Cafe is not so good but kit kat and orea shakes are very good and the binoculars do not work properly but the view is good and himalyas can be seen it is cold up there so take your sweads and jackets with you but i did not found that place so likely

title: Just very ok place
review: It's only a small terrace type structure made where you can go on the terrace with  a small entry fee to watch some of Himalayan ranges with telescope. Doesn't make sense going specially to see them from telescope. yes can b a little fun to small kids, but it's quiet windy n very chilled atmosphere there.

title: lal tibba
review: on clear day you could see himalayin range, yamunotri, gangotri and go-mukh...One can reach here by car or by walking .

title: Sunset from Winterline
review: Though this is not a much developed tourist point (just a couple of cafe announce you are at lal tibba, these cafes charge money to go to their rooftop and watch sunset), it does have its unique charm of having sunset not behind the hills but on a winterline.

title: Highest point of Mussorie
review: Highest point of Mussorie. Nice view point of the places beyond Mussorie. Having a coffee cold or hot at this place is lovely.

title: Good view of himalyas
review: Nothing much.just a binoculars of British time which gives a good view of Himalayas

title: Grat place to visit
review: its a grat place to visit if you want to see Himalaya, glaciers can be viewed clearly fron telescope available there.

title: Nice Peak and view ..
review: Only thing great about the place is the coffee at the Lal Tibba stall ... the telescope view is farce . Nice view and highest point

title: Great for viewing the Himalayas
review: You get to see snow covered Himalayas from this point. The only problem is reaching here. If you dont have your own car you can get a car rental that will charge you Rs 850 for a return trip from the bus stand just outside Mussorie. No buses or public transport is available for the place. The drivers for these prepaid trips arent friendly and wont drop you back any where else other than where they picked you. Mind you the total distance from the bus stand to lal tiba is only 5Km and they charge 850km  for the to and fro ride

title: Nothing much to offer
review: I have visited this place in Nov and after a hactic and crowed journey from Mall road to Lal Tibba i found it almost waste of time, since the view it was offering is viewed same as gun hill. The telescope provided at the point also nat managed properly, front glass was not clear at all. So people may avoid this place there is nothing much interesting.

title: Coffee Shop at Lal  Tibba
review: Excellent Coffee at Coffee Shop

title: Awesome
review: We really loved the place , the sight. It was lean season. A photographer hanging around there kinda insisted we take a picture against the faraway mountain and the serene nature in the background. We agreed reluctantly and let him take a picture .. We now have one of the best family pictures in our album.

title: Breathtaking! Don't miss it!
review: Absolutely stunning views of the snow capped peaks of the Himalayas. We went back a second time during our trip to catch the sunset views, highly recommended.

title: Most beautiful place in Mussoorie
review: This is the best place in Mussoorie.. it gives a sneak peek of the mighty Himalayas.. I recommend to walk it up... it will literally take your breath away...

title: View of snow capped peaks
review: Must visit for a view of snow capped Himalayan ranges afar. There is a telescope which gives a good close up too.

title: Very good view from here
review: Don't miss to see Himalayan range by binocular from here. Amazing view..

title: everything average
review: not good place average view from binoculer they have to change the binoculer and guide which is since from 1965

title: "MUST WATCH IN MUSSOURIE"
review: If u are in mussourie, then its a must visit place. As you will get the complete view of himalyan range with the hot cup of coffee & maggie served. The guide there also will tell you the history and other important things to know. From binoculars one can take the closure view of the range. Peace, Quiet and to spend a quality time. MUST Visit place.

title: Okay
review: It's just a large roof kind off a thing to look at the mountains....but you have to pay 20 rupees fee...and it's exactly the same view you see standing on the roads....the roads leading to this place are beautiful though

title: A good view point
review: Lal Tibba is a peak some kilometers away from Mussoorie. Its not a big place and offers only a view point of the snow capped Himalayan range, which is a magnificent view. You have a small cafe below the view point and you have a telescope placed at the view point. Be sure to visit the place on a clearer day and in the mornining to get the best view.

title: Good view, nothing extraordinary!
review: Like many points on hill stations, this is one of them. The view is certainly breathtaking, but the thing with Mussoorie is, that everything around you has the same mesmerizing view.

title: Good place for great views
review: Its a lovely place for great views of the mountains. You will enjoy it a lot if you go with your family.

title: Landour...the most beautiful part of Mussoorie
review: The highest point of Mussoorie...great views...do visit La Villa Bethany...an excellent choice for a comfortable and memorable stay in Landour...

title: Amazing views
review: The highest point to see the Himalayas in Mussoorie where the views are spectacular.  I took a car up then decided to walk down which was a much better option as you can really take in the scenery.

title: Hot Tea at the Highest point in Mussoorie
review: Enjoy clear Himalaya view through Deodar trees in October and treat yourself with hot momos and tea. You may go to the roof of the restaurant where telescope is installed by buying a ticket but don't ask for the ticket (sic). The sun and wind will refresh you. Worth a visit if you have a good driver to drive through narrow, curvy and steep slope.

title: Serene
review: It has a great view of Mussoorie. the walk around the hill is a great way to absorb nature. One should definitely visit.

title: Charming!
review: A tiny Church by the side of the street. Paved, clean roads. Beautiful scenery. You will be among the clouds. Charming! Must go for a walk

title: good walking trail
review: a very lovely place at the end  of the  hillside and on the edge, near to char dukaan, lovely walking trail through the woods, n o traffic, lovely sight seeing and must see place

title: Wonderful driving experience
review: Bliss to drive on mountains. Be cautious if one is not sure of their driving habits.

title: Take some beautiful pictures here...
review: You get an amazing view from this place.. This is the highest point in mussoorie situated at around 8000 mts above sea level.. There is s shop which offers you various snacks along with an option to view the entire range with a telescope, I am sure you will enjoy the mesmerizing view from here..

title: Peaceful Place !
review: It is located in old mussoorie city. From here you can get a beautiful view of mountain and valley. Take a cup of coffee , sit there and enjoy the scenic and beautiful view.

title: What a view!
review: Definitely worth going! A little spot in the middle of the mountain. The view is so beautiful, especially on a clear day. A little shop offers chai, coffee and small snacks. Trash bins are provided, so it's easy to drop your trash in the appropriate place.

title: Highest point in Mussorrie
review: Awesome view of himalayas from this highest point in lal tibba. it is just 5 KM from Mall Road. better get the hotel on Mall Road

title: so so place
review: lal tibba is around half an hour far by taxi from mussoorie. the area is hilly as expected . it is 2nd highest peak in the region after dalhoti.

title: very beautiful and must visit
review: Its the highest point from where you can see the peaks of Badrinath and Kedarnath on a clear day.Beautiful Kumaon village can be seen through telescope.  this place offers you nice views .

title: One of the must visit in Mussorie
review: Visited in the month of oct 2016. It is one of the highest point and located in Landour. Awesome view where you can view Himalayas. Learnt from locals there that few celebrities own properties there. Very nice place for a morning walk. There are 2 building painted in Red where they sell tea, maggi and has binoculars in the terrace where you get a beautiful view of the mountain ranges. They charge around 30rs.

title: Good walk
review: A the view is nice and one can walk to it if you are staying in Landour. Not worth coming over otherwise.

title: Viewpoint in Landour
review: A "viewpoint" like the usual ones in a hill station, complete with telescopes and snack bars. The view is good on a clear day. We visited the place for Sunrise in mid October.  Had a stunning view of the morning rays of sun over the snow covered  peaks. Lots of birds in the trees around.

title: ok view
review: i found the view from here ok. you can have better views from the mall road, or from gun hill, and they are all almost the same.  so no need to spend for a taxi again.

title: Landour
review: On an infinity loop, Lal Tibba is another end of Landour. Nice quaint place but nothing much to see. One can go for long walks but that's it. Less commercial than Mussoorie and one can enjoy a quaint little bakery run by Rokeby Manor owners.

title: Trip to Lal Tibba
review: with lot of expectation we went (morning 10.30)but we ware unlucky

title: Badrinath -- There You Are, WOW!
review: It's not every morning the air will be so clear as to allow you to see a small portion of the Himalayan mountain  range.  This was one of those gifted mornings.  Badrinath and Kedanath and some of the smaller villages below were quite visible -  unaided by binoculars or telescopes.   See my pics for " I was there and got my ticket punched."  An area, which is above Mussooire and often forgotten / not visited - Landour.

title: Lal Tibba
review: Its a must go for a walk.quiet and if the weather is clear you should go in the morning, Beautiful view of himalayan ranges.

title: The Highest Point in Mussorie
review: Lal Tibba is a place to visit Only On A Clear Day. Do not visit on a cloudy day . The place offers a good view of the peaks and holy places in Uttrakhand. Telescopes are available for use at a nominal charge of Rs 20/- per person . One can take cars upto the point if you are comfortable driving on narrow hilly roads. A good place to go for a walk if you like to walk . Don't forget to visit Cafe Ivy on the way at Char Dukaan

title: Bliss!
review: Next trip to Mussoorie, we intend to stay for atleast 2 nights up at Landour. What a place!! Old world charm, walking trails, incredible views.

title: Peaceful getaway
review: Away from the mall road hustle, this place offers you nice views (people there will charge for the binoculars).

title: Highest point in Mussoorie
review: This is the highest point in Mussoorie. Great views of the mountains from here. More than just spending time here, I would suggest people to walk around the Landour area. Beautiful streets amidst Deodar forest make the walk a very pleasant one.

title: Awesome view!
review: The highest point of Mussoorie. Breathtaking view of the distant hills and the Himalayan ranges. Difficult approach roads through the market. Recommended to hire taxi!

title: Nice strategic viewpoint
review: The only place where u feel like a true gill station. It was not too crowded when we were there.  However getting there was a nightmare in terms of traffic. Do try to walk the streets of landour on ur way down.

title: Must visit
review: Landour area in Mussoorie is beautiful.Its the highest point from where you can see the peaks of Badrinath and Kedarnath on a clear day.Beautiful Kumaon village can be seen through telescope through payment of 40rs. Next stop after laal tibba is chaar dukaan area,where intially their were 4 shops,now they have seven in all.We had lunch at Anil's cafe and the food was outstanding.The best was apple cinnamon honey pancake,it was best ever pancake i had.Maggi,pakoras and oreo shake were also very good.But the icing on the cake goes to honey lemon ginger tea which was very refreshing in cool weather.

title: The red peak top : A treat for your eyes
review: I hired a scooter from mall road and rode all the way through landour via anils cafe into the most amazing views of the valley in mussoorie. No wonder people ranging from sachin tendulkar to jayaprada to Ruskin bond live there. Lal Tibba is the highest point where a red(lal) three storeyed structure is erected with a binocular on its top floor. Take a 50₹ ticket and it is worth the money. You get to see the snow capped mountains of himalayas and if you go early in the morning mr jai singh will show you the sunrise, gangotri , yamunotri and the Tibetan border as well.

title: NICE VIEW
review: Same as many other places in Mussoorie. Will get a great view. Nothing much to do except enjoying the view.

title: Awesome Himalayan View
review: It is one of the place is highest attraction point in Mussoorie. You can drive till here, but i will suggest to walk after Char Dukaan to enjoy the view of himalayan range. Relax for an hour or two, have coffee and snacks, click some pictures with an awesome view. In all do visit once.

title: Nice view but I expected even More..
review: I visited lal tibba last week. As I belong to Hill areas, nothing was new for me..  it couldn't fascinate me much.. The view was awesome but u can find better view and weather in mussoorie and other hill stations. There were only two small restaurants.

title: GOOD FOR COUPLES
review: The highest peak in mussorie, should visit once ... do take care that you go at day time or at early morning ... Best place for Couples or Honeymoon Couples to visit.

title: Panoramic view of mussorie
review: It is at relatively higher altitude from where one can get to see  top view of mussoorie & few himalayan peaks . Try to be there early morning before it gets cloudy/misty which could block the views. Municipality has installed a telescope for visitors use.

title: Landour-a dream
review: The view of the hills dotted with bungalows is like a beautiful dream. A two km. walk around will make you wish to live here forever.It is serene and peaceful.There is a lovely bakery at Sisters bazar here where you can get some awesome bakes in a quaint cottage like joint.You can sit here in cozy comfort and watch the clouds pass by lazily as you munch on your cookies.The Sun plays hide and seek with the mist.

title: Panoramic view..
review: A high point around Mussoorie where you get to have the panoramic view of the long ranges of Himalayas, if you are lucky with clear skies. We were here on a misty morning, couldn't get much. In any case, this not an exciting thing for those who have traveled into the interiors of Uttarakhand or Himachal or Ladakh. Good for tourists on short trip to Mussoorie/Dhanoulti circuit. For those who are not used to walking up the steep roads, take it easy and take enough breaks.

title: A perfect day
review: Landour combines beauty with a quaint and charming sophistication. The view of the hills, snow peaks, fog and pines; it's nature flaunting its beauty just to pamper our souls.

title: Lal Tibba
review: Lal Tibba is the highest point in Mussoorie and its popular among the visitors for its mountains and beautiful view of hills.

title: amazing
review: must visit Char Dukaan , a set of four ( now 5) adjacent shops since british era. have a oreo shake at Anils cafe ( favorite place of Sachin Tendulkar). A visit to mussoorie is incomplete without Char Dukaan

title: High point without much view
review: This place is capitalized by two restaurants who charge for viewing from their terrace. View is blocked by trees &hillside. Would get a better view from Camel's back road. Road very good for trecking back but too steep to reach by climbing

title: Wonderful Place during Monsoon
review: Lal tibba offered the splendid view on a rainy evening. Even though we were unable to see the view due to mist, other than that the walk was the best one. Take a walk around and immerse in the serene atmosphere . Be careful when you drive there on your own. The road to Lal Tibba was so challenging as I usually drive in plains. Must visit place in Mussorie.

title: A must visit place- Enjoy viewing the Majestic Himalayas
review: I have been to mussoorie quite a few times but i dont know how i missed this place till now. Probably the best place in whole of town to relax and catch up with your friends while munching snacks from the cafes along the route.

title: Must visit
review: At highest point of Mussoorie the view is awsome.  Reach upto last point because some locals and shopkeepers try to stop you before actual sight.  Get help from google maps.

title: Highest point in Mussoorie
review: This is the highest point in Mussoorie & offers beautiful views of mountains. There is a binocular placed at top. Road is fine for travelling. There are 2 refreshment shops (2 floors each) located at Lal Tibba. One of them charges 40/- per person for going on top & second one charges 20/- per person. You can avoid these charges if you buy refreshment from them. I chose the second option. You can sit there & enjoy cool weather with momos, hot coffee etc.

title: Amazing views from here on a good day
review: This is the highest point in Mussoorie and there is a telescope too, and the place offers amazing views of the Himalayan ranges in the far distance. I hiked up here from Landour market and past Chaar Dukaan. Taxis are available from Picture Palace in Mussoorie but the hike is really pleasant too.

title: Must visit during peak season
review: It is the highest point of mussoorie from where the himalayan range can be seen, but only in absence of mist and cloud . The owner of the 2 storey building will charge you Rs 60 and coffee free with that. They have other snacks as well to offer. And on the top there is a vintage binocular placed .

title: Awesome View
review: the place is awesome.. we get a good view of the mountain range. there are lot of people who say that Himalayan snow-clad peak can be seen if the sky is clear.. well i couldnt see one. not sure if it is true. but overall the place is very beautiful.

title: nice view of himalaya
review: 2km garden  spread with heights and from the peak point you can see real snow covered huimaya with the help of binauculars.

title: A high point of the city
review: A long walk upto the point but you get fantastic sunset. Wear comfortable shoes so that you can walk up effortlessly. Also be careful of the monkey  there. stop every 100 mts to soak in the views

title: place is good
review: place is peaceful , they have two small restaurants there where they  tell you that u have to pay rs. 50 to go on top either can buy some snacks and go for free for pay rs 50.  but the truth is you will get the same view if you stand down. their binoculars on the terrace aren't working well. plus the weather should be clear to get the proper himalayan peak view if its cloudy then no view .  just relax and enjoy the view.

title: We had to "catch " the sun-set
review: We had left char -dukaan (the four old style shops adjacent to each other under a quaint sloping roof) which gives the appearance of the English country side,foregoing a french omelette......  for we had to reach Lal Tibba to grab the setting sun.....(sun overshadowed the omelette) and we had to walk and walk and the thought of missing it was too sensitive.....we walked on and on and on and people were curiously returning.....perhaps for thew m this was not too grand a spectacle.........we had reached the point  and with other  travelers  saw the grand spectacle .......the Omelette ready in the sky...........WE HAD MADE IT.......we sat there mesmerized and happy and tired only physically........... and clicked the photos as many as we could....the picture was complete.... the sun set in the midst of mountains presents a unique picture ... a family offered to drop us back    to Landour and again we missed the omelette but  the nature's omelette(the setting sun spectacle) was bountiful for the eyes.........

title: Top of Mussorie
review: It is wonderful and beautiful place if you are in Mussoorie. Visit whenever you want to want. It is open for 24*7. But best time is morning and evening. You can entire Himalayan belt.

title: Feel fresh
review: We went there twice

title: Good vantage point after a relatively tough climb.
review: It is a relatively steep climb on a narrow road. Must be a nightmare during high season. We went during low season and  encountered one or two cars either way and had to back up a little. Bikes would be the better option of travel. Once at the top, you could eat at Chaar Dukaan or have Maggi and Tea at the little shop at the hill top. The shop owners have a telescope up top to view the Kedarnath, Badrinath peaks on clear days. Wonderful pancakes available at Chaar Dukaan.

title: Highest view + 2 floors !!
review: View the valley at it's best through their Binoculars on the Top floor.

title: Must Go
review: Its walk is so haunting. Leave the car near the Ivy Cafe, have a coffee and refresh there, then go for the walk....its mystifying

title: a bit of a hike!
review: going up from Mussoorie by cab one can venture into this area high up. peaceful , quiet, with a few shops who sell tea coffee , Maggie. everyone makes a trek here. can be skipped if you are not a nature lover

title: Road is too steep
review: Road to lal tibba is too steep. I couldn't go there as i was with family. Plan to go there if people travelling with you are fine travelling on steep mountain roads.

title: Great View
review: The view is pretty awesome if the weather is clear. You can see the himalayas and other mountain ranges. Friendly local people/guide adds to the value.

title: sun set view
review: its far away from main massorie.its totally in lap of nature.we can see the view of himalayas and sun set..its nice view seeing point

title: Nice View
review: Good place to spend the day but only during sunny days. You have a nice view of Velly, fresh air and have a quick bite at Char Dukan

title: Higest peak of mussoorie
review: Mountains of Kedarnath & Badrinath can be seen with help of telescope. The hill houses the Indian Military Camp and the towers of Doordarshan and All India Radio.

title: Just for Himalayan Range View
review: This point is famous for the Himalayan Range view. It has 2 Cafe's on the top. But avoid this place if the weather is too cloudy or it is raining. As when we visited sky was completely cloudy so there was no view for us.

title: sight seeing
review: this place is located at the peak of mussoorie hill, have very beautiful view of mountains from where with nice snacks and coffee

title: Good view
review: must visit place for nature lovers. you can see stunning view through telescope of snow peaked mountains with nice walk.

title: good view
review: This point is famous for the Himalayan Range view. It has 2 Cafe's on the top. But avoid this place if the weather is too cloudy or it is raining. As when we visited sky was completely cloudy so there was no view for us.Mountains of Kedarnath & Badrinath can be seen with help of telescope. The hill houses the Indian Military Camp and the towers of Doordarshan and All India Radio.

title: The best place to have your coffee in missouri
review: This is very refreshing and beautiful place. The view of mountains and Himalayas are very beautiful. This is a must visit place for any tourist in Missouri. And you can enjoy the view of Himalayas with sip of hot or cold coffee.

title: close to nature
review: Its serene.. mesmerizing..peaceful.. simply beautiful..

title: Lal tibba a strict NO
review: There is nothing at Lal Tibba, Nothing to see. Just a 2 floor building from where you can see mountains. it is not worth the trek.

title: Excellent view
review: Highest point in mussoorie. excellent view . Spend some quiet couple of hours . Not to be missed at all

title: Nice place
review: Lal tibba is highest peek in mussoorie region. It is nice calm place. From here you can see far away places as per guide told. Char dham , himalaya etc . I could not see any as weather was foggy. There are two building on which they have fitted binocular to see surrounding peeks. They charge Rs 20 person . Even there is horse riding facility there. As person at one of that building claim that near by many movie celebrity and sport person has vacation homes. I could not authenticate that as i could not verify it. There is one famous cafe shop cluster called "Char dukaan " . People sit and relax and enjoy maggi variety and coffee etc. Its is worth try place. There is church nearby. One can visit there too.

title: The Journey to the Top
review: If you are looking for a fun-filled day out with friends, Lal Tibba is a place to be at. The journey from the foot of the hill to the top is an experience worth having. Once you reach the top, you can have a view of the himalayan range from there, if the weather is clear. September-October is best time to visit according to the locals. Other than this, nothing much is there to be wowed.

title: The walk's the main point
review: We visited towards the end of June. Couldn't really see much from the viewpoint, because of the mist.  So the point itself was a bit of a letdown.

title: View point for Peaks
review: A popular point to view the various peaks of Himalayas, but make sure sky is clear when you go there, else you would not see anything.

title: Over rated place, but better than other options in Mussoorie
review: Its a nice drive uphill to reach the place. There are 2 restaurants with nice views available. We did nnot go during dawn etc so maybe its better at that time. Its a decent experience, nothing too exceptional but worth visiting if you are in Mussoorie as a tourist.

title: Lal tibba is nice
review: You should take the bicycle from 4dukan to lal tibba for a joyride

title: Didn't had much fun here.
review: If someone had to visit, go in may month as i visited in june but due to fog, it did not work well.

title: A view to the valley and mountains
review: To catch a glimpse of lush greenery and deep valleys overlooking huge lurking mountains... Sit on the top and look the telescope... BE ready to pay for it or order the items in compensation... Even appreciating nature costs you money. Local shop serves best tea to sip on

title: Peaceful and serene
review: went there by cab from mall road and were on foot on the way back. It was a nice, peaceful and serene place to visit. Enjoyed the cold coffee(laal tibba),  omelette and waffle(at chaar dukaan).

title: Breathtaking!
review: It is the high point near mussourie n offers beautiful view. On a clear day, snow peaked mountains can be seen.

title: Nice View .. enjoy with Maggi , hot or cold coffee.
review: Nice view on top .. have a telescope to look the mountains..and enjoy the view with Maggi, hot or cold coffee.. have seating space also to eat.. you can even spot many monkeys on the trees..not to worry they are far on the trees..

title: Good sunset view
review: Plan your site seeing as you reach there at the time of sunset. Nothing else is there to see. It is a private property and they take entry Rs. 20 there. If you like you can have coffee and maggi there.

title: Walk, don't drive!
review: Now this is a place where one should only be walking to, not driving to. Not for the faint hearted though, as the climb is long, steep and arduous. The views from the top are fabulous and one can see a lot of ranges on a clear day. There are two small restaurant cum view points with telescopes at the top where you can rest before beginning the walk back to Mussourie or you can stop at Chaar Dukaan which is a small group of shops on the way for a breather.

title: Great place to hang arround
review: Lal tibba has very good view of Himalaya's, and also a good place to spend some time with hot coffee. It felt like you are in the old charming place of 1940's when you walk to the small streets nearby, over all good place to spend some quality time.

title: Great View
review: Must visit place if like great views . Suggest to visit early morning or in the evening . The drive is also quite adventurous

title: Highest peak of Mussoorie
review: This is called highest peak of mussoorie, though we did not enjoyed much here. Its a normal place with few binoculars to see some places located on far away hills.

title: Great experience. Coffee was worthless.
review: The view is awesome. But there are 2 ladies who charge for visiting the place. They are worthless and they serve very bad coffee and maggi which can upset ur stomach and mood both. They claim they are sitting there since 1969. Someone should remove them.

title: Nice walk
review: Walked there from Rokeby Manor. Lovely walk accompanied by friendly street dogs. It was cloudy but the sunset was nice. Took the hotel car on the way back.

title: Mesmerizing view
review: Do visit this place, its just 5 kms from mall road, accessible by car and easy parking. Before the reaching the main view point there is a place you cross called 4 Dukaan. Sit there grab a bite and then enjoy the beautiful view of the mussoorie hills.

title: An over rated place
review: costly to reach; no good eat out place around; decent views. A good thing is that there is a small, cosy, heritage hotel closeby Deodar Woods. People staying there may visit Laltibba.

title: Good location
review: Nice place for outing & good mountain view.Lal Tibba have natural beauty and Green View.I have see china border from  Lal Tibba.

title: For the Church & Waffles!
review: Lal Tibba- The promise of breathtaking view is overrated. Don't go just for that. But if you are a group of friends looking to step out for Maggie , waffles, pancakes then the Char Dukan offer all of that. A fee other cafes have also opened up. And the 18 Century church is a must visit. THAT is beautiful.

title: Must to Visit - Early Morning
review: Be there as early as possible.. You will remember the beauty for very long... just can not explain in words. Being early @ 6 AM will also avoid the CROWD ...

title: Over rated.
review: Can be skipped. It's supposedly the highest point here but we came from sisters bazaar and the road to Lal tibba was downhill. There are just 2 buildings there with an open terrace and the owners charge you 20 bucks to go to the terrace or you need to order something to eat. This is a commercialized place. Nothing much to see.

title: Highest and coolest place
review: Highest point in Mussorie as well as the coolest place surrounded by fir trees, this place is the must visit place in the town

title: Excellent place. Must see
review: its the highest point in mussoorie. on clear day u will see gangotri, badrinath and other top destinations thru LAAL Tibba thru telescope. Road is extremly narrow. often vehicles get stuck unless someone retreats and clears the traffic. one sided road and too narrow. get a good driver as there are lot of Steep slopes. place is nice. the walk from Laal Tibba is very good.

title: Very beautiful
review: Treat for nature lovers!!!Cool and calm place.It's near Ruskin Bond's home and Sachin Tendulkar's paradise.May visit for peace and scenery

title: Bad experience
review: Very bad experience for all tibba... The way was. Very terrible and very far from the main mussorie. But there was nothing at lal tibba... It was totally waste of time and money..

title: Sunset point or Mountain View
review: An ordinary place for sunset point and mountain view. Getting to that place is bit frustrating due to heavy traffic .

title: Peaceful & divine
review: Its quite a ride from the main city however its a peaceful and divine place with beautiful mountain view and cool breeze..

title: Gorgeous place to see the sunset.
review: Laal Tibba

title: Must Visit
review: Great views of the Himalaya's. Very fresh air, nice place to go and sit for some time and relax. Not very crowded like other places in Mussoorie. There are two cafes, you can go to anyone and see the great views from there terraces.

title: Great Spot for see Beauty of nature
review: Lal Tibba is a great place for Nature beauty lover visitor. You can see Kanchanjanga peak as well as Other peaks of Himalaya with Help of Binocular. Food & Snacks facility also available. Local person are also very helpful.

title: walk to lal tibba!
review: We walked from Landour to Lal Tibba, and loved every bit of it.  The quiet roads and the breeze, the view, the mist, everything was worth it. The Lal Tibba spot itself is just about okay. The mist reduced the visibility so the binoculars perched on the roof of a tiny cafe, was not worth the experience. But, we clicked our own photos. And yes, the lady downstairs charges 20 rupees to go up to the roof, which should not bother you unless you're expecting tea with the view!

title: Gorgeous sunset
review: You just shouldn't miss sunset from 'lal tibba' if you ever visiting mussoorrie:) I am not sure how much you appreciate mother nature but if you do then you would love it..I quietly saw the sun going down amidst the jungle and mountains, and it's changing color made me feel so so happy :)

title: Landour is beautiful
review: Landour is what Mussoorie ought to be. Lal Tibba is part of the circuit, but the look out points are purely commercial set-ups. The eating joints on the way are pleasant. We loved walking from mall road to Lal Tibba.

title: Average views nothing great
review: nothing great here other than a quiet hillock to sit and watch Himalaya.The taxis charge a bomb to go there and the food/coffee whatever people are raving about is bad.This is highly overrated attraction of Mussorie.

title: A must visit for its beautiful sunrise/sunset
review: Well, this place is amazing to catch the sunset or sunrise. I would like to say that since it is really up hill walk, a lot of people decide to turn back and not see the view. Please don't fall for that. You must must visit the place. Carry water bottle as you may feel thirsty after the steep walk uphill.

title: Nice himalyan view
review: This place is the highest viewing point in mussoorie. The nature at its best. Do hire a guide for all 5 spots. Visit this place before 12 to avoid traffic . Nice place for taking pics

title: Lovely view
review: Its a quiet little place tucked up in Landor.  Its best for people who like quiet and serene place.  On a clear day You can see excellent view of the himalayas

title: This is must visit point
review: Lal Tibba offers a great view of the mountain ranges in Uttrakhand and best is to enjoy it via the binoculars which local people rent out. This location Has a decent tea shop which also offers good maggie

title: Good
review: A crime to goto this neck of the woods and not come here. Touristy as this was a weekend but then the crowds get to you but the place takes it all away. Great location and stunning place to walk. Must plan more walk centric holidays in this place. The walks are worth it

title: best location
review: I liked this place the most. quite, away from city, scenic. This is the highest point located in old mussorie which is established mostly by british.

title: Nice point to view the mountains
review: Should visit place for anyone visiting mussorie as you get a splendid view of the entire mountain range and valley

title: Beautiful place
review: Beautiful place, calm and quite. Visit early in morning to see the snow capped mountains. Nice place.

title: It's all about the View ...
review: We were unable to see any snow-capped Himalayas during our 11-day visit to Landor Cantt. But, we walked the Loop to Laal Tibba many times just for exercise. It's probably a 30 minute Loop. But, Char Dukan eateries (pakora & chai at Anil's) will add 30-45 minutes.

title: Nice place to walk up to
review: Though as a view point it doesn't offer much after 9am, because of the haze all around yet its a nice place to walk upto and then walk further towards Sister's bazar. The ponies used by the tourists as usual dirty the beautifully constructed road up to this point. There is a constant request to keep Landour clean,then why dirty it with cow dung and pony poop?

title: Waste of time
review: No special view from lal tibba. The roads leading to this place is very steep and narrow. Only advised for the professional drivers.

title: Old Mussoorie.
review: I got to see the Old Mussoorie on the way.We took horseback rides in Lal Tiba. Because of fog we could not see the Himalayas. The viewpoint was too small,but the horseback ride was fantastic.

title: Avoid if you can!
review: Very narrow roads and very steep climb only to find some good climate and horse riding. Not worth it if you plan to drive on own. Don't commit the mistake of self drive in an SUV as I did. The roads are very narrow for two cars to pass each other. Climb is very steep so only advised for small petrol cars with good power. No traffic police to man the traffic and it is a complete chaos so avoid. In case you hire a local taxi you will be ripped off your hard earned money as you have no choice.

title: best place to visit in mussoorie.
review: No doubt it is a best place in mussoorie. but go with more time. dont hire a cab from toll they are charging huge money for limited time. just go there in the morning around 7-8

title: Beautiful background
review: We have viisted mussourie so many times before but got chance to experience this place for first time.

title: Amazing views. Great food!
review: The place is really worth a visit. Offers breath-taking view of the valley, mountains, using binoculars.
