To add to the enjoyment was the food: the cold coffee was sinful! and the guy rightly advertised it while entering the place: stating so many celebrities have had coffee there. We also liked the sandwiches. A must visit place

title: Good view of Kumaon peaks
review: This "point" has a few telescopes mounted on top of short buildings. You either pay an entry fee or purchase coffee from the owner. We had cold coffee, which was good. You can have a panoramic view of the Kumaon mountain range from here. We were disappointed to not see snow-capped mountains from here. There is smog everywhere, possibly because of the recent forest fires.

title: Morning glory
review: Fantastic place , must visit : go by taxi , come by foot ; nice long walk but worth it

title: great scenic beauty but that's about it!!
review: lal tibba is a new tourist attraction coming up in mussoorie but does not really live up to expectation. it has great scenic beauty and good restaurants serving waffles/pancakes but nothing much else to be honest. come here if u have time to spare. avoid otherwise!!

title: Excellent spot
review: When you go up lal tibba, first thing that comes in to your mind will be how the road is being built. Its of that height and got beautiful view. But the real beauty lies in the walk way through the pine forest at lal tibba. There is a road at right side of lal tibba and it takes you inside silent and calm pine forest. You will feel like you are in a mysterious place. On the way you will see lot of old british establishments and you will get beautiful view of entire mussoorie and dehradun at some places.

title: Excellent View of Himalayas
review: Only two shops are situated on the Lal tibba hil top. Very nice view of himalayas. The shop owners & care takers are not too keen to entertain the visitors.

title: Highest point in Mussoorie
review: The place is a hill with stairs to go on top. There is a place to sit on level 1 and on Level 2, the highest point is a beautiful place. The place has a panoramic view of Himalayas and whole of the mussourie around it. There is a binocular available at the top from which  you can see some of the temples and landmarks around here.

title: great view, getting there an adventure
review: As others have said, really impressive view though the drive there is an adventure--narrow streets with lots of turns.  The viewing stand charges, and there was an insistent photographer there when we visited.

title: Lovely sunset and sunrise point
review: A must visit place, should go there in the morning or in the evening for sunset.  It is lovely view point but we have to be careful about the two private telescope operators who cheat you.  They have very poor telescopes.  The whole Landour area is good for taking a walk.  The chardukan the 4 shops and the churches give you an old world charm,

title: Very quiet and clean
review: Enjoyed the walk along the quiet road with a view. The period residences were striking. Would definitely recommend. However access by road can be a pain, what with the narrow roads.

title: Nothing much to see
review: There is nothing much to see. Planned to stay for few hours but even half hour seemed likfe eternity here.

title: Avoid during summers
review: Touted as one of the prime view points and a favorite of a recently retired leading cricketer, this place is best avoided during summers. A couple of building there allow visitors to climb up the terrace for a fee to take in the view. There is no view to be had during summers and this place is best avoided, considering the trouble it takes to reach the place during the peak season. Probably worth a visit post the monsoons

title: Need good visibility to enjoy
review: All tibba is the high point of Mussoorie from where you can enjoy 360 degree panoramic view. On a clear day you can see snow capped Himalayas with peak like gangotri, yamunotri, badrinath, kedarnath visible as informed by the guide.

title: ok
review: i think the place is over crowded with stalls . but nice view. i guess that cant be helped do take the cable car

title: An average place
review: It is a beautiful drive to this place and the view is amazing, but these are the only two things I can say which are good about this place! You get the typical road side food ie momos, maggi etc.

title: Himalayan range view
review: Visit on a clear sky and you get a view of the magnificent Himalayas! Try to make it early in the morning (before 10), thats when the morning light catches the mountains the best. Entry fee is small.. Rs 20.

title: Peaceful, beautiful mountain range
review: This spot is a must watch, but the city tourism department has not put up any sign boards which could lead the tourists to the highest spot for mountain view. You are completely dependent on  the taxi drivers for reaching the spot. There are two buildings and the view from one is very good where as from the other not at all. But the tourists wont know which one to go to. The city administration should think about it.

title: good view, pleasant breeze, highest pt in mussorie.
review: great place to sit & meditate. on a clear day can see the himalayan range. . you can order some food from the cafe and sit and enjoy the view/breeze.

title: Breathtaking views of mussoorie n beautiful landscape
review: Lal tibba is a place which is amazing to have a drive with frnds . I recommend to go till the end (language school).  On the way one can see breathtaking views . This place luks amazing in winters with all snow covered n ppl enjoying the beauty

title: lap of nature
review: what to say about this place?? super view of Doon valley.. i suggest please visit this place early in morning.. i was there at 9 AM so its too late for enjoy beauty of this place, and enjoy Cold Coffee in cool atmosphere to refresh your mood.

title: Quite n serene
review: This place is away from the hustle bustle of mussourie. Binoculars have been placed upon two double storey buildings which was not so interesting. But the quite walk upto the lal tibba is enjoyable along with the picturesque view of the valley..

title: main attraction in mussoorie
review: Best place to chill, one of the highest points in mussoorie.

title: Thrilling ride to the top but not much besides
review: This is a good 30 mins drive from Mussoorie. The drive is quite steep and should be attempted by only highly skilled drivers. Alternatively get a local taxi to get you there. There are 2 3 storey towers constructed to get a clear view of the mountains. The views are nice specially around sunset time. Because of the raging forest fires, Himalayan snow peaks are not visible these days. Still worth a visit.

title: DAy Trip
review: Lal tibba .has great view of the snow peaks for those interested .

title: Great view of Himalaya
review: Really curvy roads but worth visit. View from the top is really nice and the bungalows of colonial era gives a awesome look to the areas on way.

title: Confusing!
review: Its apparently the highest point in Mussoorie.  But trust me nothing great about it.  If you have a private car, NO USE.  because apparently apart from the local taxi drivers, no other driver is equipped to drive on the steep roads.  So you have to pay like 1000 bucks for local taxi to go this point.  Try it at your own discretion..

title: This place is privatised
review: The two buildings there control the location. If you want the view there is an illegal charge of Rs. 20. There won't be any receipt.

title: One of the very few places left in Mussoori worth visiting
review: Our trip to Mussoori could have been lackluster if would not have  visited Lal Tibba. It is said to be highest peak in Mussoori.

title: Nice view
review: I took a taxi to reach Lal Tibba which took around 40 to 50 minutes to reach. Taxi ride was thrilling at few places as road was toooo steep. Lal Tibba is highest point from where you can see various places of Mussoorie.

title: British
review: love the area still we can see some Britishers house good bakery must try in Rockby Manor for some eatery,You can have a look the house of Ruskin Bond Famous Writer on the way next to DOMAS Restaurant.

title: Good
review: Char Dukan must visit for cheese toast pan cakes and best lemon & Ginger tea to die for.... Was walking distance from our stay at landour

title: Top point to explore the beauty of Mussoorie
review: Lal Tibba is the highest point in Mussoorie. You can view a maximum length of this hill station if whether is clear. There is nothing to do but you must have good long focus length camera or travel telescope with you to catch the scenery. Reaching to this point is somehow risky as the the path for the drive is very narrow and single and there is a big high distance. You must drive your car very carefully.

title: Top point
review: Highest point of mussoorie.nothing more than this.

title: Nice view
review: Nice view for some quiet time. The place is far away so you need to have two way taxi. Also, get back early as it gets dark soon.

title: Timing of visit is important
review: Visit the famous view point only if the timing is good… else the arduous winding and steep climb will go in a waste. As for us, we could not enjoy the snow-capped jewels of the Himalayan Crown because of the haze….

title: Hyped place
review: Though the highest point in Mussoorie there is no point visiting this place if you see haze or mist.

title: Must visit !
review: I suggest a hike rather than taking a car. We set out early at about 9. Passed thru couple of sleepy towns, climbed steep roads and finally reached St. Paul church. This is a good resting place. Had toasted sandwich from Anil coffee place and it was yummy. On our way back we stopped by at Doma's restaurant. That was a great break. Excellent food !

title: peace full place must visit
review: we went lal tibba and found very peace in the area .lots of good students .place for library .language school run by foreign people .theam houses .dewdar trees and long sleeved velly full with greens .area cover with himalyan range and good food .good for walk and seat .its a dream place.

title: superb view of the mountains beyond and the forests below
review: it was an experience to view forests from above and see a glorious sunset together with a excellent view of the mountains. Had a very welcome coffee at the little cafe.

title: Lal Tibba - Highest point of Mussoorie
review: Lal Tibba is a must visit place of Mussoorie, you can go there before sunset to see the red light of sun being spread over the clouds, with a special coffee made at Himalayan View Cafe with cheese maggie.

title: If you want to see the himalayn range must go
review: The place is quite good, you can see the natural beauty of mussoorie, you can also see the himalayan ranges from lal tibba. alos can have great breakfast and wonderful coffee

title: One of the best place
review: Lal tibba is one of the best place in mussoorie.  Nature is at its best. You can see beautiful Himalaya from this place. Also Sachin house is very near to lal tibba

title: Highest point in mussoorie
review: We stayed .5 km from laal tibba..Highest point in mussoorie..go in the morning before 12 am ..because after that ot will be diff to see the himalaya..on opposite side.you can see city..

title: Mind blowing place to view Sunset
review: Astonishing and mind blowing view from Lal Tibba Top. Best time to visit is Sunset. You will fall in love with the great view of Great Himalaya and forest beauty nearby. Difficult to reach but it was another great experience to reach there. During Sunset, you will also experience very cold and chilling wind at high speed, and this adds to its beauty and uniqueness.

title: Good
review: It is called highest point of mussoorie. Scenic beauty watch from here although that can be seen from other places in mussoorie. There are two 2 storey buildings on which telescopes are mounted. The only place in mussoorie from where snow capped mountain can be seen.

title: Privately owned place for making money
review: Lal Tibba is privately owned place and charge a ticket Rs 20/- per person. They donot warn tourists that Himalayan view is not possible at all times of the day. Hence only visit Lal Tibba before 11am else ticket money is a waste.

title: Beautiful
review: From Lal Tibba, you can see the beautiful himalayan range that covers the char dham as well as Nanda Devi.......You need to visit it at a particular time of the day as well as season to get the clear view of the Himalayan range....

title: Halt for the view
review: The owner himself claims that his coffee is famous and many personalities have come here. He has pictures to prove it. Perfect place to halt and marvel at the views.

title: Nice view
review: Road to reach this place is very narrow and peak season and long weekend it gets too overcrowded for my liking.

title: Amazing view, must visit place!
review: The walk towards Lal tibba is amazing with lush green mountains and tall trees everywhere. once we reach the point, we managed to get a great view of snow capped mountains.

title: You can actually see Himalaya
review: The walk around Lal tiba is serene. From Lal tiba you can actually see Himalayas and that leaves you speechless. There is plenty available to front and eat so don't worry on that.

title: Great views
review: A bit offbeat but the most beautiful point to be in here in Mussorie. Fantastic views and great family place

title: Snow View
review: A must visit place for nature lovers. Especially for those who enjoy hills. Snowy peaks of the Himalayas were clearly visible even around 12 noon today. Early morning view is expected to be clearer. It is almost the highest spot in Mussoorie.

title: Breathtaking view
review: Good experience having tea and maggi on the top and enjoying the view. The surroundigs could be better kept.

title: Nice view of Himalayas and Valley
review: It's a point the point from where you can get a good view of the Himalayas and the Valley. It's simple but well-maintained trek. Road to reach Lal Tibba is very narrow so avoid self driving.

title: View is awesome
review: The view is awesome here , over all a average place .Actually it's good for the people who doesn't have any view from their hotel , in our hotel we had an awesome view so it was one of the same kind .

title: Only Place to visit in Mussorie.
review: The drive to Lal Tibba was excellent. The view from the top is awesome. Must visit. Try the authentic coffee at the top.

title: Absolutely gorgeous sunrise and sunset
review: This place is a must do on your itinerary to Mussoorie. If you're lucky, you would get to see the snow capped Himalayas from Lal tibba, which is the highest point. Even on a low visibility day, the sunrise and sunset are an absolute delight with their lovely colors on the sky and dense forests when you look down. Also, do try the cold kitkat coffee sold right below the viewpoint.

title: Cab ride to Lal Tibba but not very special
review: The entire area of Mussoorie has steep sides and much of it is woodsy and nice.  Lal Tibba is less "developed" than other areas, but the point is still "private property" and inaccessible.

title: Highest place
review: Walk to lal tiba from char dukan is fabulous. Hand beaten coffee is very good at rs.50 it include entry ticket.

title: Overrated
review: Better views of the Himalayan range elsewhere. Not a difficult trek or walk but not worth going. Other attractions hold more importance like the sister's bazaar and the old cemetery

title: Best Place
review: Best Place to visit. In a clear weather this place is just like heaven. There are even Binoculars available. You will be able to see Kedarnath and Badrinath peaks from there. Its a must visit place in Mussoorie.

title: Dont go on a poor visibility day
review: Please guys, its such a waste of time and energy to clinb steep hill of Laltibba if the visibility is poor. All you will see are pine trees and surrounding mountains.

title: Good point.
review: It's a very high place in mussorie and never easy to drive and reach. You should hire local taxi if driving alone. At Lal tibba you can view chain of snow covered mountains and have a cup of good coffee along with Maggie.

title: Great View!
review: That's all that is there to see - a great view. Take your zoom lens, your binoculars and enjoy the view.

title: Beautiful! Must See!
review: We were here on March 9, 2016. This was the best place in Mussoorie! It is the highest point there...very good view of the mountains..trees..cool breeze. It was amazing to see the clouds, vast sky and the sun set. We were charged 60rs per head for entry which included view through the telescope placed on the top of the building and a coffee. I must warn you there are just 2 small old buildings at Lal Tibba and the road to it is very narrow and an expert local cab driver would be the best person to take you there. So do not expect more...if its just nature that you are looking for, you will love this place!  The road leading down is also very good, perfect for photographs.

title: not great but to visit once
review: this is an ok place to be but i went there twice then never because i spent my time on other better place in mussoorie

title: Breathtaking view
review: Lal Tibba has a breath taking view of sunrise. The walk to Lal Tibba amidst deodar forest and quietness is refreshing and rejuvinating. You can view all the 5 peaks from Lal Tibba. If you are in Landour, a walk to Lal Tibba is a must.

title: nice view
review: its a point the point from were you can get a good view of the Himalayas and the Valley. its a simple but well maintained trek.Road to reach lal tibba is very narrow so avoid self driving

title: Good for once a visit
review: The place is good to have a view of the Himalayan range. There is a high power binocular installed on the roof by which you can have a closed range view of the place. There is also a shop below to have coffee and snacks. The trek upto the point is great, if you can do that. Otherwise you can take a vehicle up there.

title: Highest point in moussourie !
review: It will great to go for a 1 hour trek to lal tibba. But if you cant walk , you can take you cars and taxis too. You get the view of ice clad mountains if the weather is clear.

title: Excellent view
review: It is the highest peak point in Mussoorie. It is about 5 km away from Mussoorie at Landour area in Depot hill. One can see the peaks of Kedarnath and Badrinath from here. On a clear day one can also see through big telescope the peak of snow clad Himalaya. The road to reach here is narrow. It's better to use experienced local drivers.

title: Lal tibba
review: Very steep hill , only expert driver can climb on this , you may get overall view from this spot....

title: Must visit.
review: Lal Tibba is must visit place while in Mussoorie. It's 5 kms. walking/Drive from Mall road. Views are awesome from Lal Tibba.

title: What a view, must visit on a clear sunny day to catch a glimpse of the mighty Himalayas
review: You get a hot cup of coffee, a guide to talk you through the scenes, and a great view to complement it all, all for 70 bucks per person. Be careful while driving upto Landour, roads are really steep and narrow, it takes skills to pass an oncoming car. But once up here you feel its totally worth it.

title: Heaven
review: Please visit lal tibba if in Mussorie, and have coffee and burger. Best in world. Views are really amazing. People are all very polite. Meet Mr.Rawat he sells organic honey and that's really awesome.

title: Must do if you are in and around Musoorie
review: The four kilometre walk around Landour is beautiful and will be my most favourite part of the Musoorie experience. Do not event think about missing a snack break at CHAR DUKAAN (Tip Top).

title: Definately a must to go
review: Located on top of the hill, very isolated place great for peaceful and long morning walks. A must for every traveler who visit mussoorie.

title: Nice climate and sunrise
review: The place is ideal for morning walk and sunrise view. The place is calm and lovely. The char dukan is the same place where God of cricket sachin had breakfast when he came mussorie.

title: For Valley Lovers
review: Lal Tibba is place for Valley lovers and nature lovers. One can see very beautiful natural mountain and tree views. the sun set view is awesome. One can clearly see the Winter Line from lal tibba.

title: A good place to see the Himalayas on a clear day...
review: This place is supposedly the highest point in Mussoorie. The weather is relatively cooler here compared to the town below. You need to be lucky and have a clear sky to see the snow-capped Himalayan range, which is worth the view. Else its just another place in and around Mussoorie.

title: Nice view of paudi garhwal range and a little glimpse of himalayas
review: We walked to Lal-tibba from the city and that was the best part of going to lal tibba, the zigzag mountain roads with Pine Forests on one side and hills on other are simply mesmerising. There is a small 2 storied structure built on the Lal Tibba Point and lady charges 20 rs to let you go up. She also boasts of the coffee and momos and maggi and sandwich. We tried the coffee and the sandwich but they were nothing but average. They also charge you for the telescope and claim that they have best lenses available in India, however that is not true. They just give you a blurred view of farthest mountains, which look prettier with naked eyes. But the place is worth going once and if you can, then better walk, it almost 10 kms from the Mall Road.

title: Over rated.
review: It is just a red coloured single storied little place where you go to the first floor and check out the view. Pretty lame. Go around this place and take a hike in the jungle. It is much more beautiful .

title: Sunset @ Lal Tibba!!!
review: Not everyone will be ready to visit this place. But my suggestion will be do anything to be there @ Lal Tibba during Sunset. Its an awesome view. You could see that the Sun sets not behind the hil but instead a straight line!!! The view of the Himalayas and the layers of hill behind fog makes it a WOW place.

title: Off the trip attraction which can be missed
review: Off the trip attraction which can be missed

title: A must visit place
review: For some unknown reason this place is not much publicised but it is arguable the number one place to visit around Mussoorie if you love mountains and would like to have a enchanting view of the Himalayas.The ideal time to reach there is before noon if you would like to have a clear view of the range.

title: Scenic views
review: Highest point in mussoorie. One can see Yamunotri, Gangotri, Badrinath & Kedarnath from the topmost point. but monsoon season may not be good to see due to fog and cloud. Clear weather is good time to visit.

title: Very cold Nd very peaceful
review: At d peak of Mussoorie ... I went in Dec end on d new year eve it was very cold .... U can d Himalayas from here ... I won't suggest to take ur kids when it very cold .

title: mermerising view
review: You can see snow covered mountains of greater himalaya from here. you can go there by hiring a taxi. You can spend about 30-60 minutes here.

title: Amazing views
review: On a clear day you can see the snowcapped peaks crystal clear. There are binoculars on the top level which offer fantastic views.

title: Fantastic Views
review: Must walk from Chaar Dukaan to Lal Tibba - Excellent view from here, particularly if you go on a non-cloudy day you can spot the Himalayas. Also if you can take a day off there are treks down to the villages.

title: nice point
review: for natural beauty , the place is good and is not far from main market . the road from here to sisters baazar is beautiful .

title: High on the mountain
review: Highest point of Mussoorie from where you can see THE HIMALAYAS,you have to pay 20rs to go on to the terrace of this cafe at the end of the road.

title: Good Place
review: You can see the Garhwal villages & snow capped mountains on a clear day.......its a beautiful sight from up there

title: Nice views of the Himalayas
review: There is a small cafe built at the end of the road- who will charge you 20 bucks to climb up to the top. Pay him another 20 and order the coffee. Worth it. Keeps you warm while you take your time to soak in the views of the Himalayas- with or without the binoculars. Worth a visit

title: Why is this a tourist spot??
review: Lal tibba is supposedly a tourist spot, the reason for which is beyond my comprehension.

title: Great View.
review: The view from this place is great. Tourists can see snow covered mountains and beautiful valleys. through telescope one can see Gangotri Yamunotri Badrinath.

title: On top of the world of Mussoorie, an exciting expereince
review: I took my daughter and her children to view the Snow Covered Himalayan Mountain ranges from Lal Tibba, the highest viewing point in Mussorrie. |My daughter lives in London and this was an amazing expereince for her children and her husband who were at Himalayan Mountains for the first time. My son-in-Law was really amazed to see such a lovely view, they do not have Mountain ranges this beautiful in UK. WE just about managed to see some snow covered peaks, the clouds came of for just a few minutes. There is a lovely tea shop shop which sells Lemon & Ginger tea and we all loved the expereince.

title: Great view of Himalayas
review: It is basically a point from where you get a great look of the valley. It is a bit far from the main city and hence have a dense forest cover. There is a small house present at a particular point from where you can get a great view of mountain range sipping a cup of hot coffee.

title: Lal Tibba
review: Very nice location, the locals there will give you a lot of helpful information about the vegetation, himalayan peaks and other famous points of Mussorie

title: @the highest point of mussoorie
review: This is the highest point of Mussorie,where you can have an telescopic view of gangotri,yamnotri.

title: Visit to Lal Tibba
review: Just a ordinary place with a view had to shell out 20/- Rs each to climb up to the telescope to watch hazy Himalayan range not worth the money spent on taxi to come all the way.

title: Serene....!
review: Beautiful view of the himalayas....luvly place to sit and enjoy the nature....A walk from char dukan to lal tibba recommended...must go :-)

title: Good View, Good Coffee!
review: Lal Tibba  - Views are good, but they charge you Rs 20 per person, just to climb the terrace... weird!  And yes, coffee is good.

title: Sunrise view point
review: The nature at its best. Felt like keep on seeing and experiencing the view of portrait view of Himlayas.

title: at the peak
review: getting up the laal tibba is little tidious with narrow roads. Once up at the point it feels worth moving up there to get the view of Himalayan Ranges.

title: nice view
review: nice view from the top seeing the beautiful city and nature lovers really like those mountains passing out by clouds.

title: Heaven on earth
review: Highest peak in the queen of hills. Beautiful place. Always covered with clouds. Mesmerizing views. Best part of this place is,, take a walk from here to sisters bazaar. I promise you , you'll remember it for lifetime. Simply amazing.

title: The real Mussoorie
review: Apart from the God of Cricket it hosts/ed several known names like late Dev saheb, Ruskin Bond, Tom Alter.

title: Eye Catching Beauty
review: I have been there in Dec 14, I was there at right time I got to see the best ever Nature's beauty. One can enjoy the scenery if you can have clear sky.  Dec Jan best time to visit.  Photographers and nature lovers don't forget to get your Cams.

title: Excellent View from Uptere
review: Another excellent spot to visit and see the breathtaking view of the area from up there.We went there ans its very cold in January. Worth visiting place.

title: One More Beauty Spot.
review: Its like one more of the beautiful spots at Mussoorie. We went that time it was quite chilly and had great time with family. U can see the himalayan view from there. If you in Mussoorie do vieit once

title: Fine for a one time visit
review: Lal tibba is quite famous as its the highest point from where you could get an almost 360 degree view of the surrounding. We were stationed in a hotel in Landour and we booked a taxi for the whole day and started off with Lal Tibba. The adventurous kind would prefer the hike I think.

title: View from the Clouds
review: Yes, it is literally like you watching Himalayan range from the clouds. Photographers and nature lovers will love it. Entry will is also only Rs. 20 per person. The in charge has the great information about the spot.

title: Highest point
review: This is the highest point in Musoorie and offers some great views of mountains. There are many eating options here as well.

title: Try and visit this place. It's surreal
review: I spent about 2 hrs before I drove back to Delhi. Though my wife and I didn't want to leave this place but since our baby's supplies were down, we finally left. The tall trees and houses on the slope are a view to enjoy. They have a hawa ghar (road side shed with seating places) to just relax your tired city skin with the cool air up here. This place is at a height. In case you are travelling by car. Park it near sister bazaar and walk down to lal tibba

title: Nice Views..
review: A Much Better alternative to Gun Hill..Laal Tibba provides Spectacular views. It is a must visit place when in Mussoorie

title: Good viewpoint
review: Lal Tibba is a ground +2 viewing structure.

title: Quiet and peaceful place
review: Go to this place only if you are a nature lover and want to relax, looking at the mountain peaks and having a quiet and peaceful walk.

title: Good place but lack of infrastructure
review: There are two small huts there for seeing the snow capped mountains, though the same view can be had from the road also. They will tell you that you will have a better view of the mountains from atop the house but no use. The binoculars they provide are also of very poor quality. It's better you carry your own set when visiting there. The only thing apart from the mountain view that was awesome there was the coffee they served. The way to lal tibba is very steep climb so don't drive yourself untill you are more than perfect as the road is very narrow and surrounded on both sides by shops.

title: Average view but great coffee!
review: Lal tibba, the point from were you can get a good view of the Himalayas and the Valley. With this in mind we went to this place. The drive was not very smooth as we had to pass through a very crowded Landour and an extremely narrow passage where at a time only 1 car can pass through (if you are driving yourself and in a big car). At Lal Tibba, there were two viewing points, one on either side of the road. We went to both and realised that the one on the left side, almost on the valley was way better and also older of the two. The view of the Himalayan range was Okay but the home made coffee and cheese and veg sandwiches were awesome. Nice and quiet place to tick off from the to-do--to- watch things in Mussourie.

title: A nice little trek
review: Though this is a simple trek on a well maintained trek, still the tranquility offered is something to cherish. Views that you get are the best one can expect while trekking to the highest point in Mussoorie. A must do/visit while in Mussoorie.

title: Not worth it
review: Might be a popular place but not worth it. The owner beleives that he sells the finest coffee made in mussorie but its all fake...even the coffee made from the coffee maker of my hotel room tasted better than his coffee....

title: Highest point of Mussoorie
review: This is the highest point in Mussoorie. To reach Lal Tibba  u have to hire a taxi which charges Rs 350.  And if have time u can enjoy hiking up the mountain. If u r  hiking, start your hiking from the government hospital its a shortcut and on the way stop and see the church near Char Dukaan (4 shops) this place has a British colonial feel to it. The hike is 6km up and take 1 hour to reachbwhere as coming down the hill is fun and enjoyable takes around 20 min to come back.

title: Stiff climb, not that worth
review: I took this stiff climb only find it to be a dumb place. may be at some point of time, it was a good hanging out or local with a view of Himalayan peak on clear days. But avoid going to it when you see too may people at Mall Road. The road is very stiff and narrow. Only a skillful local driver navigate it, even somehow managing to give pass to vehicle coming from opposite. Onc eyou reach top, you will feel the smoky burning smell coming out of almost vehicle. While coming back, you will cross residence of Ruskin Bond. Also Sachin Tendulkar had bought a property for his annual Mussorie sojoun around this area.

title: Loved it
review: Awesome view,  brilliant landscape,  good hospitable cafe shops around makes this a must visit if you are in Mussoorie.

title: HIghest Point, but not worth
review: Highest point of Mussoorie hill is the only attraction otherwise there is not much to see there. The road to hill top is very exciting with narrow sharp steep roads which is exciting.

title: scenic climb
review: The highest point in mussoorie. Fun climb with beautiful sceneries (perfect photo moments). you take a halt at Char Dukhan and have piping hot coffee  and paratas and then be on your way again.

title: Extremely disappointing
review: One hazy set of binoculars, cloud-shrouded mountains, disgusting cabbage momos. To add to that, snarling traffic to and from Mussoorie city. Give this a miss.

title: Stunning
review: One has to find time to pass at least an early morning and a golden sunset from this topmost point of Mussourie. I went several times and having a hired car at out disposal, the height wasn't any issue. In a clear morning you can get superb views of huge mountain range. Telescopes at the top of two cafes will get you closer views of the peaks. I particularly loved and will treasure the sunset from that place. Though walk in Mall and surrounding places are more popular, yet, please take a 2 km upward walk from Mall via Landour to this place. This is a lonesome walk but you will get enjoyment of a lifetime.

title: cable car ride
review: The cable car ride up there is memorable although it lasts only 5minutes. The views of Kedarnath, Gangotri and Yamonotri make this place more attractive.

title: Superb location
review: We visited lal tibba during month of may. It observed to be highest point of mussurie. 360 view of mountain range was breathtaking. This Location is peaceful compare to town.

title: A Blissful walk
review: here i would not recommend for cable ride, binoculars or food. Please avoid all these things. We parked our car there and just walk through the cloud filled path and was so blissful. I would special recommend couple for the romantic path. the whole path was almost empty u can sit there and just stare the mountains. It was awesome

title: a walk in the clouds of zen
review: This place is recommended who have been crowded whole their life. This place is recommended for those who wanna know how distant things can be beautiful. This place is for those for whom seconds hand in a watch will become a wheel pacing faster than there pulses i.e you wanna seriously CALM down

title: Excellent view
review: We visited this place on 15th november...when we went there we found there will be shooting of AJAY DEVGAN next film SHIVOY on 18th november....

title: Amidst the nature
review: If you are a nature lover then this is the place. One can reach there on foot, in case you have the potiential to walk in hills or by a vehicle.....Lal Tibba is the point from where one can see the Shivalik ranges including the "bandar poonch" hills. Beautiful deodar jungles surround the area and one can hear the bird sounds in the back ground. A small bazaar "char dukaan" is also on the way to Lal Tibba where one can sip in some coffee and indulge into pan cakes and sandwiches....

title: Himalayan view
review: Lal tibba is very scienic  view .one can view the icy himalayan mountains in the morning to noon .Tea is very special at char dukan near lal tibba.

title: Walk around Lal Tibba
review: This is a clean view point in Mussoorie and offers good views of Garhwal range of Himalayas. The best part is the walk through the roads around Lal Tibba. The roads are well maintained by the military and you can get to see several dogs of good breed which are well fed ;)

title: best place
review: This is the place where u can watch the great Himalayas  with snow capping and place of photography.The haney lemon tea served by the restaurant owner is unforgettable.

title: Avoidable
review: It is the 2nd place in Musoorie which disappoint me the first was Kempty Fall. The Environment is good but there is nothing special to see except famous Char dukhans. Two telescopes are mounted on the roof of two shops for which they charges. But there is nothing to see if sky is not clear, which happens mostly. The road is very narrow and sharp uphill. Go there only  If you have lot of free time.

title: Views of Ice Clad Himalayas: Gangotri, Kedarnath, badrinath Peaks
review: You need to travel thin , no super thin roads to get to lal tibba and that's when you behold your bredth. You see these wonderful peaks of kedarnath and badrinath on one side and possibly Gangotri glacier on the other. Eagles of a different kind fly..the road is laden with Deodar making it cool and MUST sit for a breakfast lunch or brunch at TIP Top in Chardukan...

title: Good view but not good infra
review: View is good from the place but its just a stilt 2 floor building slab to climb and have look through the telescope. Can pass through to get a good view. Need not spend too much time.

title: Beautiful location.
review: The location is extremely beautiful. But be warned that the way to Lal Tibba passes through a very congested locality. You must have good vehicle and a skilled driver to negotiate through painful jams, abusive crowds and steep inclines. Also at Lal Tibba, avoid the photographers offering to take your stunning photographs. They are thugs, avoid them.

title: You get the ssame views from most of Landour
review: Lal Tibba is a look-out point - thats it!

title: Nice and Quite Place to visit
review: Travelers can visit this place by cab/taxi  This place is the highest spot in the Mussoorie  area, from where you can see peaks of Himalaya on clear weather days , Sun rise and sun set are fabulous.

title: Its all about the journey!
review: Lal Tibba is the highest poitn of Mussoorie. But do not focus on this fact while to trek to this place. Walking to Lal Tibba is like walking on an inclined treadmill. Take pauses and halts, and enjoy the road and the silent and serene nature around. We walked from our hotel, stopped at Doma's Inn for a lemonade, and then kept on pausing every now and then to savour the beauty and catch some breath.

title: Worth a visit
review: Good for a quiet time and a great view. The approach however is a little narrow and steep and a little scary sometimes.

title: Most peaceful place in Mussoorie
review: You must visit 'Lal Tibba' if you are in Mussoorie and wish to spend few hours without any disturbance but with nature. It is recommended to park your vehicle at 'Char dukan' and enjoy the path towards 'Lal Tibba' by walk. Here you can get beautiful view of the ice covered peak of Himalayas. You can further extend your walk up to the language school.

title: Telescopic closeups of Gangotri and Jamontri glaciers
review: We had little expectation of any view of the snowpeaks when we waited for our cable car to Gun Hill.. the second highest point in Mussourie. The cable-car goes virtually through people's houses (which must have come up after the car route was planned) blocked by shops and game parkours which has been found to be attarctive by my previous viewers.

title: Good to walk around
review: The views are good, the chaiwalas in the neighborhood have good spiced tea to combat the cold. It is a nice picnic area

title: MOVE ON
review: An awful and  ill conceived  concrete building with a few shops marks Laal TIBBA. ( see the pic) . For a view of the landscape move on, many other locations in this lovely area.

title: Looking North to the Himalyas
review: Lal Tibba is reached by narrow windy road through the tall trees and lush vegetation.  From there one can view the Himalayan rangers and, on clear days, the glacial ranges can be seen too.  This place gives a sense of the remoteness of some of the villages.  I was told by the guide that the village settled by the British is almost self sufficient with locally grown foods, dispensary, school and other amenities.

title: Scenic Deodars
review: From Mall Road, Lal Tibba can be walked but is very steep uphill.  Roads are narrow.  We have kids so we drove our car up to the area of Char Dukaan.  Char Dukhaan is four restaurants which provides basic food and refreshments.  There is an old church also.  From up there it is one kilometre uphill to Lal Tibba.  The view up there is very scenic with lots of Deodar trees.  The sunrise and sunsets are awesome with clouds floating by.   On the negative side, one can also get views of junk and plastic lying around (India has become famous now for that also).

title: Amazing views
review: The walk and the view is amazing and extremely relaxing. With little tea shops, one can have a nice tea and sit and enjoy the view.

title: Highest point in Mussorie
review: It is the highest point in Mussorie from where you can see snow capped mountains in early morning. But if you visit in the afternoon or evening, the mountains are not visible due to clouds

title: Drench in Green peaceful experience
review: Take cab or taxi it is 4-5 from mall road...dont stop at lal tibba...keep walking till linguistic institute...you will enjoy the pathway...

title: Nice place at hilltop
review: It's on the hilltop,, took a walk and enjoyed d perfect serenity and tranquility we miss in the cities.it is a place meant for those who love peace and want to relax

title: Great view of Himalayan range from here
review: The best way to reach this place is on foot. On the way you get a nice eat outs where you can take a break.

title: Great view ...if u are in d right season
review: This place give a fabulous view of the Himalayan ranges if you are lucky . the weather is a major draw back here if the sky is clear the view is spectacular.... One can reach here by private taxi that can be easily available from the library stand .. Its the highest point at masoori. Do not miss this place . very good scenic beauty and calm environment.

title: Don't waste time
review: Not worth spending time going here.  Huge traffic jam.  Useless place.  U can have better view the different other places

title: Short Track
review: Its a nice small trip , can be tracked ( 30 - 450 minutes) or hire a Taxi to go until Char Dukaan and then walk up to the view point.

title: Nice but overhyped
review: Route is through a very narrow lane of a residential village. It's advisable to hire a taxi as drive can be a tiring one. Lal tibba offers a good view of the mountainous range depending on weather of course. But I felt its much over hyped for the experience.

title: Very scenic place
review: This is one of the best places i visited. Very scenic and calm (maybe i visited just around sunset and was not crowded).

title: laces around it are pretty.
review: Just a famous landmark. The area around lal tibba is beatiful to walk. It is absolutely serene and hardly anyone comes there.

title: Nice view
review: Nice view at the top. Road to Lal tibba is very steep climb, so be cautious. One can spend some time here for photographs and have good coffee.

title: Excellent Place..
review: Quite calm and peaceful place and please try the special coffee there and nice view of the mountains on top of the hills... just loved it...

title: Amazing view
review: Very high and steep hill with narrow road leading up to the top. But the view from up there is amazing.

title: What a waste of a breathtakingly beautiful place!
review: You should still go, if you could ignore the zigzagging wires and garbage thrown around the restaurants. We tried getting to the edge to have an unobstructed view, but the restaurants have taken over all those places. Very disappointing...but you can almost see what it could have been perhaps one of the best places

title: Mind Blowing Place!
review: Lal Tibba is an absolutely mind blowing place and breathtaking views of the Himalayas. Here you can have a glimpse of snow capped mountains of Himalayas and you can also use the telescope services for a better view. Also while visiting don't miss the Nescafe at Lal Tibba Himalayan View restaurant. I highly recommended this place to go.

title: Hype
review: This place is a hype. Unless you are blessed with clear skies, you won't be able to see any mountain peak from lal tibba. The so called coffee is also a hype.

title: Great view
review: A great view from highest point of Mussorie you will required a car to gr here ,you can see mountain if view is clear.

title: History with beautiful view
review: Laal tibba is easily the best place to see in Mussoorie, the old vintage charm still exists there the view of great Himalaya old graveyard and all.If your visting laal tibaa do google abt its past you will love it

title: we have seen better views
review: If you have a vehicle then only you can reach this place, or if you are the hiking kind. The approach roads are bad, traffice jams are common factor, a let down

title: Good view if weather is clear.
review: Good view if weather is clear. Otherwise is not worth to visit. If the weather is clear its a very clear view.

title: Do not waste time
review: The place is much hyped. While the entire Landour is scenic, the view of the hills & valleys are nothing different from Lal Tibba. The shop painted in bright red, claiming Lal Tibba view point is an eye sore. Views are generally nice from Landour, so going all the way to only see Lal Tibba doesn't make sense. Rather take a nice long walk while you are in Landour.

title: Best view of snow capped mountains!!!
review: This is one of the view point in Mussoorie where you get good view of snow capped mountains. We reached there by evening and we witnessed the mountain changing color from white to golden orange

title: noting special
review: very long distance from mall road but, if you love to walk you can go, but there is nothing special, main area se door ek choti si basti k pass hai lal tibba kafi upar jake hai agar shanti pasand hai to jaa sakte hai

title: Simple natural place.
review: Fantastic walks in the midst of nature. Loved the small shops and cafes around the area. Walkable distance from the main mall road must visit in Mussoorie.

title: Visit only on a clear day
review: Nothing much to see, try only if you find less traffic on the way or you have spare time or clear skies esp during summers. Otherwise not highly recommended for a INR 1000 rs ride from gandhi chowk and return by taxi.

title: Absolutely horrendous
review: I see no point as to why people would want to go to lal tibba. There is absolutely nothing there. except for a small 20 feet building. The views from lal tibba are the same that are available as seen from any hill. Please don't waste your petrol and time on this.

title: awesome place
review: this place is so epic. i have visited it for the 5th time now. the last time was during snow. the ride was kinda freaky that time because of the snow turning to ice and wheels skidding, anyways it was fun that time as well. it is so peaceful to walk around that road, the small cafe and shops, if you need some time off. Go visit.

title: Get a Himalayan view
review: This is an experience in itself-- Journey itself is an experience. On the way you will have to cross Char Dukaan-- do not forget to have tea there on the way back-- you will be refreshed.

title: Mussoorie Love of Nature
review: I love this place , infact if any one love of Nature , please visit there.

title: why ???
review: if you like to spend a lot of your car fuel and like to put your clutch at risk due to very steep hill and narrow road, it is the perfect place for you to go. after all this exercise you stop before a shop or something like that, a telescope is installed on the terrace for which they charge Rs 20/- per head. also they offer you world's best coffee (as Claimed) for Rs.50/- per small disposable glass. What you get is normal coffee which is half glass full of sugar and cocoa powder.

title: Enthralled!
review: Keeps you captivated. One of the most beautiful and magnificent view ever! Must visit !!!! Best part of my trip!! Love it.

title: mussoorie
review: one of the highest points around mussouri..

title: osm
review: love to visit that place at the top of the hill.....

title: Beauty at the TOP..
review: Exciting view and superb location. Snow covered area during my visit in february.. Eatables are also available. A perfect place to enjoy with friends especially when sun is settting.. U'll also see Sachin Tendulkar's Cottage there..

title: have a walk
review: you need to have a walk around this place to really feel and grasp nature's beauty. numerous birds thrive in the trees lining the road. on your way up from Landour to this place, you can even notice Shri Ruskin Bond sitting by his windowside. there is Cloud's End nearby. also you would find a cemetery there, wherein great men have been laid to rest.

title: Must see
review: Best place to visit in Mussoorie, nothing much except a point from where you can see the surrounding areas with a binocular that is provided there. The building has a small shop that provides some overpriced decent coffee. Must visit once.

title: Amazing
review: Very beautiful view from here you can see himalyan range kedarnath badrinath the shops here are very good you get cup cake here very tasty must visit place

title: Walk the talk at the peak
review: It's must visit place, that gives you the fulfillment of being to Mussoorie. Get dropped exactly at Lal Tibba, take a long walk (3 - 4 kms) which will bring you back to Char Dukan. Sip your hot chocolate / coffee and drive back to Mussoorie. You may also try the telescope view (Rs. 25 per pax), if you are lucky on a clear day should be able to see some peaks of Himalayas.

title: Driving till Lal tibba is fun
review: This is one of the peak points in mussoorie, although the weather was not kind enough to us to enjoy this place fully however we still manage to go to this place and had a good coffee at the roof top of a local restaurant. View from the roof top is simply awesome, it would not take long to visit this so worth a visit. You would not feel that your visit got wasted while coming here.

title: Not worth !!!
review: We went looking for lal tibba to be some sort of unique local attraction. But it is literally a couple of red buildings with telescope on top. We missed it on our way there as we did not expect it to be this obvious.

title: worth watching
review: This was the place where i visited 6 times in a week as it was very close to my the place where i stayed for 9 days. worth watching....

title: Go steep uphill just to find Nothing
review: Nothing to look for when you reach at the top to Lal Tibba. Just 2 dilapidated sort buildings offering coffee and a telescope.

title: Highest Point in Mussouri
review: One must visit this point,when sky is clear.If lucky,may see himalayan range. If misty,one may find wonderful atmosphere and may enjoy climate sitting on top of any of small cafe at point. One must have professional driver to reach this point,as it requires special skills to drive on single road, curvy steep hike..

title: Enjoy the early morning views
review: A nice place but to enjoy the views, one must come early in the morning. The telescope up there is average at best. Bring your own binoculars. Beware of the guy who insists (to the point of irritation) that you drink his coffee which according to him is hankered for by celebrities of the world :-)) and takes money but doesn't give you tickets to access the point. Sad how pwople like him bring a bad name to beautiful places like this. Ensure that you visit Char Dukkan and taste the cinamon cakes. An absolute Must haves!

title: Scenic spot
review: This spot is at a little distance from Mussoorie. The view from this place is absolutely breathtaking, although there's nothing more to do here. Must visit if you like a peaceful and quiet place.

title: Too much hype about it
review: Hi, We had been to this place couple of months back and frankly the experience here was not that great. Before going there people told us that its one of the best tourist spots in Mussorie but when we reached there, it wasn't that great. Also we had coffee for 60rs (really bad one..).

title: Highest point of mussorie...
review: Do visit dis place..and u will have great view of snow covered Himalayan peaks though dey r too far but with binoculars fitted at dis point u will have awesum view of garhwal range and Himalayan peaks..only thing is if u visit dis place during rains won't be able to have nice view as it gets covered wit clouds...lal tibba is highest point at mussorie..

title: Very Peaceful .....calm ....view of valley and mountains
review: Landour.......gives you feeling of .....peace.....highest point of Mussorie is Lal Tibba.....you can have nice view of mussorie range and use the telescope service provided by fast food corner owners ....@100 per person

title: Highest peak of mussoorie
review: This is a must visit place if you r in mussoorie. When we reached there thought that there is nothing to see but when we climbed up and saw the whole valley fell in love with the place. The nature at its best can be seen from this place. They have placed a telescope there so that you can bring nature close to you. You will like to watch the beauty of nature in that serene quite place. Beautiful !!!

title: Just about all right
review: Its amongst the highest spots in Mussorie and therefore has a decent view. But theres nothing particularly great about it. And theres often a large crowd of tourists that makes it somewhat painful to visit.

title: good plce to visit
review: We can watch Himalaya from this point with our own eyes. Binocular  Option is also provided  through wich we can see Himalyas more clearly. due to moisture binocular glasses are covered with moisture.

title: its DABBA instead of tibba
review: When we travelled to Mussoorie in feb 2015. We didn't went to the top of lal tippa due to the road construction and there were lot of monkeys in the road which were running here and there.The reaching to this place is the worst experience ever, approach roads are horrible and too narrow. There is nothing to see instead of tea shops and parking rates are very high. Its a complete waste of time and money.

title: awesome
review: nice place. the drive is worth it. though you need to keep cool and not hesitate to take your car up in 1st gear. its a steep incline uptill char dukaan . post that it is fine. do stop by to have breakfast at road side cafes. they cook fresh and tasty food

title: Nice view of himalayas with nice snacks...
review: We visited this place on 28 jun 2015. you can have a very brillient view of Himalaya with very tasty, delicious snacks served by the owner of that small dhaba,,

title: Very very steep
review: I hiked to this point with my colleagues from office. We had lot of fun in midway and reached the spot in 1 hr from landoor market. We had coffee and pan cakes at some famous shop. The cream on pancake was great. This place is best in early morning as one can see high snow peaks of mountains.recommended for day trip.

title: Super Like
review: We went there around 8:00 am and loved the place. On that day it was foggy still we could see some peaks. but on a clear day its a must go point.

title: Beautiful Himalyan view
review: We went early morning to escape traffic. The Himalyan view was quite scenic. Food joints are nice too.

title: awesome view.
review: awesome experience to be in highest point of mussoorie.

title: ropeway
review: If you go by ropeway you will enjoy it but after reaching there you will only find ome restaurants shops , some swings for kids

title: Great scenic view...and awesome pancakes & maggi at Chaar Dukaan
review: Just go there to enjoy pancakes, maggi and shakes at Chaar Dukaan.....rest if you are looking for good scenic view then its a good place for you....otherwise nothing major to see except Chaar Dukaan

title: not sure where it is
review: I guess I've never really been to Mussoorie at the right time of year to see the mountains really clearly. There's never been a reason for me to stop and admire Lal Tibba...this would be my fault and not the fault of the mountains.

title: The Location was imaging.
review: The surprised place I have seen after a long time. I have visited many time Mussoorie but never visited Lal Tibba, due to family n children. But this time i visited with my staff and the moment we enjoyed there was really imaging. This trip was really fantastic n we enjoyed there lot of fun due to snow fall. The Location was imaging.

title: Excellent Views on a Clear Day
review: Located on the old Mussoorie side of the city. You can either hike upto this place or take a cab(maybe along with a package deal, which is what we did, for Lal Tibba, Dhanaoulti and Surkhanda, we paid Rs2220, for a can from the Picture palace bustand). Gives a good view of the city and mountains on the other side. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Average
review: During early Morning or in Winter season the place must be awesome but in June, It was not that Fantastic, still ok to checkout once.

title: Observatory Point of Mussoorie
review: Before speaking of Lal Tibba, I would like to mention about the walker's paradise which is the perimeter including Lal Tibba. Lal Tibba is a landmark point of the Landour Cantt. which gives an amazing view of the valleys across. Many tourists exploring Mussoorie cover lot of distance to reach the place. Do visit if you are in Landour but do not fall for any enticements from the coffee shops claiming to show China Border etc. through telescope located on their terraces.

title: Worst place of this hill station
review: I strongly suggest you people don't go this place because

title: Beautiful views and walks
review: A cab ride to Lal tibba and a walk down is what I would recommend unless you are the super fit kinds to trek both ways.

title: Amazing view
review: This is highest peak of Mussorie. The place is only for complete Mussorie's view and taking pictures. Not many people visit it. There is a fee of Rs. 20. Do take ticket. The small building has two floors. The building has all edges covered in red that's why I assume it's called as All Tibba. When we reached they were painting Stairs railings with red colour. On ground floor is a small cafeteria. After ordering you can enjoy on any of the floors. The view is available from  three sides. There is a binocular also available. No charges. We were lucky to have quite clear view of Himalayas filled with snow with naked eyes. It's about 8 kms from Clock Tower. Cameramen are also available to take your pictures at this spot. Small but nice and silent place.

title: Nice place but nothing much to do
review: Either hire taxi,bike or you can even walk from mussorie market to Lal Tibba. But there is nothing except 2 small tea shops and they have binocular from which you can see china border.

title: Not that great...
review: The place is a disappointment in itself. The surrounding areas are more interesting . Close to this place is a graveyard and chaar dukaan. The weather blocks the view half the time . The binocular is really old and the weather is simply awesome.

title: excellent view ,highest point best part of mussorie
review: the best view from the top , sunset is very nice to watch, this place has 4 degree less temperature than mussorie , lal  tibba walk is the best walk if you stay in landour mussorie however i didnt like the cafe's its better you walk to chardukan and  try the best cuisine

title: The view
review: It all about the walk to this place, the views u get here n the hot tea u sip.....u will enjoy this place in clear weather

title: Worth less
review: Wastage of time and money.its a highest point in mussorie to view Himalayan range by a scrapy binocular but its good for nothing in cloudy sky.

title: Visit only if you love to walk
review: Lal tibba is just another view point with binoculars which you will find in many places in mussoorie. The only thing is the height at which it is located. If you are planning to go in a car or taxi to this place just to visit it then you better avoid as you will be disappointed. But it you love to walk and enjoy the trekk then you will appreciate the place and the surroundings.

title: BEAUTIFUL
review: We walked over upto Lal Tibba .. though strenuous, it was beautiful once we crossed the villages and entered the wooded area.  The views were worth it.  Takes about 2 hours once you have exited Mall road.  There is a place called Char Dukan on the way where you should have the pancakes and pizzas .. though better keep it for the return trip. Best part of our holiday.

title: The Place to visit in Mussoorie
review: Among the few untouched places in Mussoorie... Go there to walk and talk. Take a homestay in and around this place...

title: Good Sun set point
review: There is a point on the way to Lal Tibba called "Chaar Dukaan" where one can enjoy real good omelette and tea. Lal Tibba is the highest point from where all Himalyan range is visible provided there is no fog.

title: good place to go - but nothing much to see
review: nice place to go - steep car ride

title: HIGHEST POINT OF MUSSORIE
review: We reached lal tibba after a steep climb in car from picture palace.View is good though cloudy.Their is a telescope also to see various view points.

title: top of the hill
review: I think its top of the town.. awesome views.. totally thrilling.. and chilling as well.. look as far as u can.. call it a suicide point

title: Worst approach
review: The reaching to this place is the worst experience, approach roads are horrible. Even the view is not so good, however the food at char dukan is decent enough.

title: Good place to visit in Mussorrie
review: - This place is the highest in Mussorrie. The name is Laal Tibba because at evening time the Himalya becomes red.

title: nice temple
review: peaceful place with nice location and temple design was really very nice. very spacious too. valley view from this temple was amazing....

title: highest point in Mussoorie..
review: Lal Tibba is at the Chaar Dukan/Sisters Bazaar/Landour end of Mussoorie..im still unsure why it is so popular..

title: Nice
review: Place is just awesome.please visit this place in the early morning or at the evening to watch the sun rise or sunset respectively. Mountains will turn red with the amazing view.

title: 7500 ft above Sea Level - Lal Tibba
review: Lal Tibba offers a Spectacular view of mountain ranges of Mussorie, if you are lucky enough, you can also have glimpse of Snow Covered Himalayas as this place offers the view of Himalayas provided weather is clear. I was not lucky enough as there was thick fog on the day of visit. There are 2 coffee shops at Lal Tibba who offer good quality coffee along with binoculars to view. They charge Rs 20 per person as entry fee. It is not easy to drive upto the top most point of mussoorie unless you have a experienced drive as we have to go through very narrow lanes good enough to fit 1 car only, suggest to hire a local cab. It is a view point only as mentioned & if you are expecting any activities at this place, you will be dissappointed

title: Sunset view
review: Drive to Lal Tibba was good with a short stopover at Char Dukaan for some tea and snacks. Sunset view from Lal Tibba was awesome

title: Time & Money Waist
review: There is just a Binocular kept which is good for nothing.

title: High Point of Mussoorie
review: A beautiful and soothing Place to Visit and Spent Time.

title: Another nice spot
review: Enjoyed Lal Tibba and walking around the area. Old world colonial charm and interesting curios. We went here during our holiday with family friends and had a great time.

title: Not a  worth place to visit
review: Certainly not a worth place.

title: Topmost of mussoorie
review: U will get to see Himalayas,  if u r lucky!!!

title: Good place only on a good weather day
review: Its the highest point of Mussoorie so raises intrigue..Nice views from the place itself which has a couple of commercial establishments offering their rooftops for taking in the views (at 20 per head !)..we didnt get a clear weather day so couldn't enjoy the snow capped himalayas view. A place that can be considered for visiting once though

title: Nice views
review: Good place to visit on highest peak of mussorie. Lovely place to visit. Recomended every one   avoid own car due to narow road.

title: Actually New Laal Tibba
review: The actual Laal Tibba has a huge TV tower built on it and is out-of-bounds for tourists. The new place is next to the old Childers Estate (now Nahata Estate - why do people want to forget historical names!) The snow views are lovely from this spot if the weather permits. Most of the way around the chakar the views are impeded with so many huge pine trees.

title: Average place, Lal tibba is basically a shop (red colour)!!
review: Highest point of Mussoorie, average it was!!

title: The highest point
review: The journey to Lal Tibba the highest point of Mussorie is fun, travelling through the old town.

title: Nature and thrill
review: If you have more time in masoorie, you should see this. It will give great experience of nature and thrill. Better go with friends so that you can enjoy better. It is hilly, take care of safety measures. you can have long view from here.

title: Lal Tibba & Dhanaulti Clubbed together
review: Nature...Nature...Nature... Road is what matters, Enjoy the road, do not keep waiting for that one destination.

title: Good place to get 360 degree view of the Mussoorie hils
review: I like the view from this place of the hills however the place is not developed and nothing much to do there

title: Top of the Town
review: Lal Tibba in Landour Cantt!!.... as usual the army occupies the best parts of any good place, but the positive side is it remains as it is supposed to be, doesn't get commercialized.  Lal Tibba is just a view point with two little cafes and a telescope. The drive to Landour is very steep and through narrow lanes. It is the highest point in Mussoorie and the view is awesome. There is this small church and some old British time bunglows. It is a letdown for people who visit places to do something, its just a beautiful place with nothing much to do or see but to feel the wind and calm. There are the" Chaar Dukan" the four small cafes next to the church which serve excellent pancakes, momos, and even home made pizzas and a lot of variations of Maggi, obviously the children ( four teens) loved the place.

title: Himalayan view
review: Hello, this is a place where you can witness the Himalayas, Char Dham darshan, Kailash parbat and Manasarovar. And also back side hills of Mussoorie town. It is a must visit spot.

title: Awesome view
review: It was a peaceful and refreshing trek to the Lal Tibba from our hotel. Superb view from the top although we were slightly disappointed as we could not see the Himalyan snow peaks due to the fog.

title: Lovely view
review: The place was quiet but indeed beautiful, some distance has to be covered from parking lot to lal tibba that particular path is awesome to witness great scenic beauty.

title: amazing quitest place
review: i travelled lal tibba to see the sunset which is very famous viewpoint.if anyone wants to get relax and calm his mind this place is best

title: Nice view
review: Nice place to have good view but sky should be clear. You can watch Himalayan ranges through Binoculars.

title: Horrible, don't waste your time and efforts
review: Visited the place on recommendation of hotel staff and still regretting it. The drive is awful with small roads going through villages and steep height. Once you do endure the journey the place itself is just 2 buildings with little food. They r dhaba type cafes with a terrace that is in bad condition. Horrible coffee, horrible washrooms and nothing else to do. Kindly don't visit.

title: Simply bad luck
review: Lal Tibba is supposed to offer a view to 3 Himalayan peaks. The day we visited the place, it was foggy.

title: Very Nice and peacefull
review: Very nice, calm and peacefull place at landour above mussoorie, one of the best site seeing in the mussorie

title: SNEAKPEAK & PEACE
review: If you are lucky can see the peaks clearly without binoculars but otherwise as well the serene atmosphere and peace is worth a visit

title: Beautiful Place
review: One can get a 360 degree view of Dehradhun and the Himalayan mountain range from Lal Tibba. Beautiful sight. A must visit.

title: Great view if you're lucky. Disappointing if it is cloudy.
review: Great view if you're lucky. Disappointing if it is cloudy. But, to make up for it, the walk to and from Lal Tibba to Landour is beautiful. Especially for nature lovers.

title: just another view point
review: nothing spectacular and can be avoided. especially avoid buying the coffee being offered as a special coffee as you climb up the building to the viewpoint.

title: Highest Top of Mussoorie
review: We were excited to see the Himalayan range but the top had 2small local restaurants who had mounted telescopes.

title: Beautiful Place
review: This is highest peak of Mussoorie. You can see Himalayas from here. There is a fee of Rs. 20 per person. The view of this place is great. You have photographers available.

title: boring
review: the place is pretty boring. no great views nor great food.

title: A  Good Place to Wiew Mountain Range and Sunset
review: Good place to view mountain range (Nanda Devi Range) and sunset if the clouds are not there.

title: Thrilling place
review: Liked the zigzag roads and telescopic view of mountains.  Very very thirlling place to watch.  But road is risky also..

title: great views and photo opp
review: we walked to lal tibba from our rokeby manor where we were staying at landour...the walk was outstanding and the views from the point breathtaking.....the weather was super romantic...loved it

title: peaceful
review: explored some of the old buildings and houses, which are constructed with in British architectural style. Chider’s Lodge located on Lal Tibba is another attraction of this hill. Childer’s Lodge offers some stunning views of the hills and the valley stretching into distance. Accessible by foot, Chider’s Lodge is an ideal picnic spot and does not have any eating places, restrooms or souvenir shops hence enjoy the raw and rustic appeal of nature here.

title: Not Worth
review: My mistake... I listened to my wife... :) ha ha...on insistance of my better half, we drove all the way to the top making our way through narrow (harrowing) lanes of mussoorie just to find out what Lal Tibba is... its a point on top of the hill (supposedly the highest point in mussoorie). the place could feature in the lonely planet edition to be the most boring places in Mussoorie. We fount two huts painted in red. The so called view point (the Hut) had a World War I telescope on top & housed a cafe down below selling momos and coffee. There is notuing more to it. the place can be avoided.

title: Hot maggie with amazing views
review: This is the highest point in mussorie..there are few coffee shops which serve piping hot cheese maggie,pancakes,waffles .Its one of the favourite places of Sachin Tendulkar dat he enjoys with family!!!

title: The Heighest Peak
review: Lal Tibba is heighest Peak of Mussoorie just 7 Km from Library Bazzar.The hill houses a camp of Indian Military Services. Here is tower of All India Radio and Doordarshan. Here is a nice point to view sunrise and sunset for visitors. You can have beautiful views of Badrinath, Kedarnath,Bundrepunch and other beatiful views of Himalayan ranges with a telescope placed at a tower on a cliff.  Nice Visit.

title: Nice morning walk
review: When you walk from Char Dukaan to Lal Tibba, you cross a number of residential properties. The route itself is paved, not very steep and just about an hour's walk, but nothing prepares you for the open valley that you see at Lal Tibba.

title: The Highest Point in Mussoorie
review: The name comes from the deep red colour that the sky dresses itself up in the evening. Its located at 7500 feet and is the highest point in Mussoorie. Sample the variety of homemade pickles and also the honey. I brought home the Pahadi Chilli Pickle and loving it :)

title: Beautiful Viewpoint
review: the weather was chilly and it was a great view.

title: Awesome sunset
review: Lal Tibba is highest top of Mussoori.we reached here before 2 min of sunsets and finally caught RED views of sky .lal means' red and tibba means top that's called Lal tibba.

title: excellent view
review: one will get excellent view of Himalayan ranges. However the approach road is narrow and often heavy traffic.

title: An average Highest point in Mussorie
review: This is called as a highest point in Mussoorie. You can take a cab to reach here which costs 920 for this trip. This is about 5 kms from Mussoorie. When I reached here, there was fog everywhere. So, I have not found anything exciting for this place. The only good thing about this place was Char Dukan which is around 300m meters before Lal Tibba.

title: Nice place noting much though just scenery
review: If you are there for scenic beauty and want to spend time with nature this is the place.

title: Picturesque views
review: This landmark was a ten minute walk from our hotel in Landour. It is located on one of the highest points in the mussoorie area and offers a great view of the garhwal mountain ranges with many of the peaks. Best time to visit is in the morning at sunrise when the first rays of the sun reflect from the snowcapped peaks.

title: Highest Point In Mussoorie - Dont Self Drive !!
review: Highest point in mussoorie with scenic views all around but take my advice and dont self drive. Take a taxi and go with a peace of mind, I took one from the Taxi stand - Picture Palace end of the Mall Road and it cost me Rs. 720.

title: Himalayan Snow Capped Views are excellent
review: Visited this location while in Mussoorie for a day. The views of the Himalayas are excellent and the views from the viewing platform are well worth the modest entry fee.

title: Great Place
review: A bit tiresome walk but it is worth the beauty. Near Landaur Bazaar  but it is better if you are on bike or taxy.

title: Ok
review: This is supposed to be the highest point in mussoorie, but then one gets equally good views all ovbber mussoorie

title: Sunsets!
review: stay for the sunset, it's breathtaking....must see it is worth the while

title: An interesting and calm place to visit
review: It has got a very serene environment and great view. A peaceful place to visit and relax during a trip to Mussorrie

title: Highest point of mussoorie
review: This place is highest point of mussoorie town, ridding experience on bikes is much better as for reaching this place you have go pass through local market, small small residential areas of town.

title: Stunning views!
review: An easy walk from the Rokeby Manor.  Spectacular views.

title: Surreal View!
review: We visited Lal Tibba in the morning, a Point which is 7500ft above sea level. The roads leading to Lal Tibba are very narrow & a driver not familiar with the area will find it extremely stressful to drive.  It is therefore recommended that a local cab from the hotel be hired. The view from the elevated view point is surreal & a calming experience.  The local camera men out there take pictures at precise angles that capture the view of the Himalayas in the background. However, their information on the geography of the place was at times erroneous.

title: Lal tibba- an amazing place
review: Lal tibba is such a wonderful place. I can go there again and again with my family. I have stayed in fortune hotels and that was very nice.

title: Awesome Must do !!
review: The walk in early morning round trip and then eat the maggi / waffle toast in the shack near the lal tibia market.

title: Exciting place in Mussorie
review: Lal Tibba if you are going on walk with friends from centre is one good entertainment. It will take around one hour to visit this place from the bus stop.

title: Walk from Rokeby Manor
review: I loved the walk from Rokeby Manor to Lal Tibba after breakfast. One can see the snow covered mountains if there are no clouds.

title: Pristine Beauty of the Hills - Lal Tibba
review: One of the highest points of Mussoorie is Lal Tibba. The thin narrow road requires a good vehicles and an expert driver to steer the vehicle atop at a height of 8200 ft above sea level. Well wooded hills with pine, rhododendrons and deodars, its a beautiful way and just 500 metres before Lal Tibba is the world famous 'Char Dukan' famous for bun omlettes, pancakes, ruffles, wai wai, ginger honey lemon tea, etc. This place has been highly acclaimed by travel writers, food and travel shows on television including 'Highway on my plate' in NDTV Goodtimes.

title: Decent, but better among the worse.
review: There isn't much to see here, except for two little buildings with telescopes fitted on their terraces to get a "closer look" at the Himalayas. The buildings have two small restaurants serving Maggi, pakodas and few conventional sandwiches. Would recommend the hike till there, if not the destination itself. Like all other hill stations, there are of course, people bulls@#$ting about the history and the order of arrangement/identity of the Himalayan peaks. However, since Mussoorie does not have anything unique to offer anymore and is almost perpetually over-crowded, one could go to Lal Tibba to find some solace, get some fresh air and eat a few home-style snacks overlooking the beautiful Himalayas.

title: Disappointment
review: The day was cloudy, so we could not see a thing, only a colonial village through the binoculars. There are two shops serving tea, Maggi, etc. My husband took tea and my son and I took a coke from one of the shops. The "guide" sold us honey and pickles, which he said were made in the village, at exorbitant prices. Probably because they are from the high Himalayas. The shop at Kanatal was selling these at a much lower price. The cab driver was not helpful. We passed by Char Dukaan (established in 1911, but many more shops now), but he did not stop. When I asked him why there were so many people there, he said that the shops serve good pizzas and tea. I wish we had stopped there.

title: perfect place to see the himalayas
review: feel the top of the world it is situated at the height of 7500 ft  awesome view if weather is clear then must visit not so far you can walk from mall road too takes 1 hour,or hire a taxi

title: The best part is not the tibba but the walk to it!
