review: The lal tibba can be a little bit of a disappointment but if you love walking in the hills, you must go walking uptil the lal tibba in Landour (Old Mussorie). The deodar trees, the great breeze and the views are great and the walk becomes more interesting due to the signages and the "words of wisdom" written on the way!

title: Awesome view
review: Great ride up the hill through Landor to this vantage point.  We climbed the tower and were astounded at the view.  It literally took my breath away.  It was such an amazing view of the big snow capped peaks of the Himalayas.  There was a telescope, while old, you could still view the peaks up close.  A gentleman was there to point out peaks and tell us which ones they were.  We were offered tea as soon as we got there and only asked once if we wanted our picture taken for a fee.  The ginger lemon tea was absolutely amazing.  It was made fresh right then.  We took a walk along the road catching glimpses of the peaks through the pine forest.  When we headed back to our car, we got another tea and also bought some amazing local honey.  Do NOT miss this spot.

title: Beautiful Views
review: Went to Lal Tibba to enjoy the views. there is nothing there except the beautiful scenery. The local shops and view point are run down and they charge Rs. 20 for climbing two storeys to view more mountains.

title: Highest point of Mussoorie
review: Here u can have a glimpse of snow capped mountains of himalayas. u can also use the telescope services for a better view.

title: A must-go location
review: Perhaps the highest altitude point in Mussourie, it is a must-go location for the most beautiful, clear and close up views of the mountain ranges.

title: Paradise in winters!
review: This place is just amazing especially in winters. There is snow and you can hike up and walk all the way to lal tibba enjoying the scenic beauty of the place! You can take rest at Char Dukan and have some really cool stuff! The place offers a muchh better view once you move ahead from chr dukan. The complete himalyan peaks clad in snow can be seen from the way. This place is good and not crowded, also it is clean and kept tidy!

title: Fabulous Views of the Himalaya
review: Absolutely breathtaking views of the Himalayas. The view is similar to the views on offer in Dhanaulti. Visit the place early in the morning or you are likely to get stuck in traffic jams in the narrow lanes.  Also while visiting do not miss the superb Nescafe at Lal Tibba Himalayan View restaurant.

title: Excellent view
review: Excellent white mountain view, must carry a SLR with you during visit and try to stay till evening to see golden peak

title: beautiful and peaceful
review: amidst the beauty of nature falls a nice place called lal tibba near mussoorie. you can have a breathtaking view of the himaslayas. generally crowded but good places attract visitors. nice place to capture the natural beauty in your camera. the best part is you can enjoy some snacks with tea while admiring the beauty of this place. a must visit if you visit mussoorie...

title: A must if you are visiting Mussoorie
review: Lal Tibba is approx. 10 kms and 20 minutes drive from Library Chowk, Mall Road however roads are pretty congested, narrow and steep post Picture Palace. But, the last couple of kilometres drive is beautiful as you start moving higher and higher.

title: What a View
review: Loved the view of the Himalayas.  Was crowded but thats not necessarily a negative.  Im from the states hand have spent a great amount of time in the Rocky Mountains.  These mountains were majestic and you could see them nicely from the Lal Tiba Tower.  It was great to get some village chai too while enjoying the view.

title: Spectacular view point but......
review: Not sure if it's worth making a special trip for as it's just an open concrete platform that is kept in poor condition. You can enjoy a drink of kinds.

title: quaint little place
review: Around 7-8 kms away from Mussorie, near Landour..is this beautiful place called Lal Tibba.

title: Wow!
review: Great views of the complete himalayan mountain ranges - all the way from Badrinath to Nanda Devi. There are two cafes with telescope. I hope that the next time I go there, both these cafes would have more powerful telescopes.

title: Breath taking view
review: From here there is a beautiful view of the snow covered mountain range of the Himalayas. A perfect photo opportunity.

title: The Top Tip of Mussorie
review: If its not snowing in Dhanoulti, then there is no point going to Dhanoulti. Lal Tibba would give you a similar view at the ice clad Himalayas.

title: Nice view, bad coffee
review: The Himalaya range view from this place was nice....binoculars were not very helpful as view was not clear through them. We tried coffee after lot of boasting by the owner but it was terrible, cold and cheap..wastage of 50 Rupees. All in all a good place to relax and enjoy nice view in sunshine. A good trekking path from chardukan to lal tibba.

title: Pristine grandeur
review: Marvellous to see this glorious mountain range. The white snows on these glorious mountains, framed through the deodar pines and under blue skies is not able to be captured in a photograph. You have to see it!

title: Lal Tibba (One of the best place of Mussoorie)
review: Lal Tibba again one of the best place of Mussoorie. You'll really enjoy the views of Himalyas, Pathways will give u the feeling that you are in Switzerland coz its much similar to Switzerland...............

title: Beautiful location
review: The view in one word is awesome.......Beautiful location. You can just stand and marvel in the beauty of the place.

title: Lal Tibba
review: View is awesome but it's very basic and you can spend at the 15 minutes there. The way to the place is through the old town and very narrow lanes and at times the car gets stuck in traffic. Best time to go is early morning.

title: Awesome point with fantabulous view
review: The view from this point was amazing and breath takin. one can clearly see the himalayas infront of them.a panoramic view and a must see place. The way to lal tibba may be a bit steep but it is worth the effort.

title: The highest place in Mussoorie to enjoy clouds
review: The place is awesome from where you can see great peaks of Uttaranchal with the help of the binoculars.

title: Lal Tibba
review: The topmost location of Mussoorie.  You can see Chaar Dhaam with a telescope on top of the cafe.  Nice picturesque place.  Worth visiting. Don't Miss.

title: Best place to spend time in Mussorie!
review: This place is around an hour uphill walk from the city and the top is very peaceful.

title: Short & Sweet
review: there are few stores here and open cafes here.. you will get comfort food here, Maggie, eggs.. the pan cakes here are very different from the authentic pan cakes.. some like them and some don't.. do try ... very reasonable food...

title: Highest Peak of Mussorie
review: We went to Lal Tibba which is the Highest Peak in Mussorie, initially we thought we will see some Red Monuments but when we reached there we found old british bult houses and Market place. Good place to have a Scenic view of Mussorie and the Himalayas

title: Just a vie point
review: It is peak which gives good view of complete snow covered himalayas/Gangotri glacier. Same view is avilable from any high peak. Moreover, you need to get there thru rickshaw or walking 13 kms. Best view seen during day in enough sunlight.

title: Tea at Lal Tibba
review: Nice place for a evening Tea with friends.The ambience will bring to life the old days of " Evening Chai purane Dosto ke Sang" ( Evening tea and gossip with old friends.

title: Good view of the valley from the high point
review: The place is located a short walk away from the char dukaan area. There are 2 small cafes which have upper decks from where one can have a panoramic view of the valley. They have a mounted telescope and also provide binoculars. The one on the left side of the road is run by a cranky old woman. The ginger lemon honey on the other one is quite good.

title: Not sure why the name Lal Tibba
review: The only good thing about this place was using binoculars to check out snow clad peaks of the Himalayas specially the Kailash, Gangotri, Yamnotri, etc

title: Great view from peak
review: There are two building at lal tibba who takes rs 20 per head for entry at their roof top. view from roof top of their shop is awesome. you can use the binocular which are on the roof. You can  view full mussorrie, himalyan ranges from the lal tibba. tea in very cold and dry air in pllution free envoirment make u feel refreshing

title: so close
review: Witnessing sunrise from Lal Tibba you get a feeling of being very close to the mountains and the sun. Breathtaking.

title: Best of Mussorie....
review: This is the best point to visit in mussoorie....get to see excellent view on Himalaya range,mountain cover with clouds....couple of privately place telescope to get closer of view of mountain.....

title: dnt knw wht the hype is all about...!!! Rather Take a quiet Walk around..
review: I guess i was in for a real disappointment when I went there, the only ppl enjoying lal tibba are the ones who charge a entry fee for the viewing platforms and plying innocent tourists with overpriced snacks and hot beverages...!!! The view I am sorry to say is not out of the world..u can enjoy much better scenery form the road to kellog church and the ITM periphery road , go there if you are curious but do NOT expect the moon,                                                                                                   But do walk around the quiet roads of landour and you will enjoy the real blissful peace and solitude of this place

title: Nothing much to do
review: A place just for photography..a 2 storey building from where you can see the valley and the mountains and get some good pictures.

title: Must visit
review: Lal tibba offers a spectacular view of snow capped mountains. Do take a walk further till the language school, and enjoy the pine rich quaint road, soak up the hilly air.

title: snow clad mountain view
review: you can view the beautiful snow clad mountain ranges from here. There are 2 cafes there who offer views from the binoculars. Don't fall for it. Your eyes have better vision then the blurry binoculars. The food at both the places is bad. But definitely recommend visiting it.  Also take a walk from there to the Rokeby manor from the other side for great views

title: Super location!
review: You must visit this place in Musoourie! It relives your hunting for the snow laden himalaya peaks amid a relatively sodden place..Views are heavenly and is he special herbal tea and maggi at the local cafe!

title: Very good view
review: Lal tibba is situated on the very high point in mussorie so you can see the view of mussoorie from this point and also snow covered himalyas can be seen from here further binoculars are installed by local tea shops on the roof to see the important places after paying nominal entry fee  , sunset is very beautiful at this point and a good place for photography also.

title: view of Himalaya
review: The place is nice for some photography. You can get a distant view of snow covered Himalayan cliffs. There is binoculars placed to get a close up view. One of the must see places if you are on trip to Mussoorie.

title: Trek to lal tibba
review: fabulous to trek to the place. One of the best moments in mussourie! If you are an outdoors kind of person. Don't miss it !

title: Highest point
review: You can see snow clad mountain ranges from here. Nearby "Char Dukaan" serves very good food. Old church is worth visiting with history

title: hummmm
review: we went there but could not see anything because of clouds - visit during sunny day, before evening.

title: Highest Point in Mussoorie
review: This place on Landour Cantt is at 8000 feet above sea level. A very narrow circuitous, serpentine, and up-hill road leads to this place through busy Mussoorie  town starting from Picture Palace on Mall Road. You will need an expert driver for this. Once you reach there, you will find two shops selling tea-coffee, cold drink and tit-bits. On their shop roof, they have put telescope and by paying Rs. 20 per person, you can see the Himalayan peaks from left to right - Yamunotry, Gangotry, Mount Kailash, Mansarovar, Kedarnath, Badrinath, and Joshi Math. Further on right Dhanolti Town is there. Cool breeze will welcome you. A must see in Mussoorie.

title: Lal Tibba
review: Excellent place...the view is breath taking

title: Nice view
review: This place has a terrace with a binocular above the small mandir. On a clear day one can see the distant Himalayan peaks. The road to Laa[ tibba is winding and narrow with some steep climbs. A small shop sells tea, coffee and maggi. Best time to visit will be on a sunny day just before sunset.

title: Good views
review: This place is good, but not as the hype given.   The telescopes are good and the pictures clicked came out amazing!

title: Paradise
review: A lovely walk through the forest with a view to kill. Seekers to peace and tranquility would love this place. Where one can sit and admire the beauty of the Himalayas and deep dive into his own soul to seek the blessings of the nature.

title: Adventurous
review: Would advise you to book taxi unless your a very good driver up step narrow roads.  Well worth it when you get to the top

title: Owesome Review
review: Great view from Lal Tibba of Shivalik Range of Himalaya. The person there explained about all the peaks. Ginger Tea very good. Very reason able price.

title: Something more than binoculars
review: People feel Laal tibba is just a view point and stop their journey as soon as they reach the buildings with binoculars. But this place is special since it is abode for a lot of foreigners who come to mussoorie. Drive few km further and you will see private cottages and lovely woods around it. There is a shop called Prakash's shop. it stores all kinds of domestic and imported items for cooking for the foreigners. They also keep some locally produced pickles, chutneys, jams that you won't get anywhere else. This place is famous for cheese, but we couldn't get our hand on any.

title: Best view
review: Nice quiet place away from the hustle & bustle of the main city. Being the highest point of Mussoorie , it gives a panoramic view of the valleys around, pine trees & Himalayan ranges. However we couldn't get a good view of ranges because of bad weather.

title: Nothing to see
review: Terrible roads to lal tibba (gets its name from a 2 storied half constructed concrete red shed)... very hectic and sad journey. Nothing to see... apart from a telescope to see views of mountains... even that is not functioning... simply waste of time... really horrible

title: More Beautiful in Winters
review: Visit this place if you want to get panoramic view of snow clad Himalayas. The look is more beautiful during winters.In summers, this place is nothing but two buildings serving snacks and a plain view of green mountains.

title: WOW
review: Enjoy the beauty of mountains....Paid Rs.20 to be on the top floor..but didn't like the coffee as that man was promoting.

title: Beautiful views
review: Its the highest point on Mussoorie - love the views. Go in July, when the monsoon is just about to start, with the clouds drifting in and out of the trees.

title: excellent view
review: You get excellent valley view and can see colonial village which was establish during British rule. you can see old Mussoorie

title: Great view with a needless 'tourist point'.
review: Lal Tibba is the highest point at Mussoorie (apparently!). The views from there are pretty spectacular, but if you're walking up the stretch, you will gradually get taken in by the view - and the end point is nothing exponentially fantastic.

title: Lovely views and air
review: Lall tibba has very nice views and very quiet compared to the hustle and bustle in Mussorie and mall road. A must go place if you love nature and enjoy good views.

title: Good place to visit away from the hustle bustle
review: Has lovely views and good place to visit away from the hustle of mussoorie. There is coffee shop, nothing extraordinary.

title: enjoyable
review: The nice long walk with shops on either side was entertaining and enjoyable. When the weather is good the place is enjoyable.  Avoid summer.

title: Disappointing, the view on a cloudy day, and the Coffee, always!
review: The place so well known has to be more organised, than what it is today! The 3-4 off Entrepreneurs need to think our of the Box, to make this Lal Tibba, worth a visit. Its just a disappointment, apart from the Natural Beauty, only on a clear day!

title: The best
review: If you are a nature lover than you must should go to there. In a clear day you can have a nice look of yamunotri and Bandar punch glacier.The whole path of 6 km is full of natural beauty. If you are going to Lal Tibba then have a cup of teaat that, you will realy enjoy it.

title: Lal tibba.
review: offers a high point, to view from terrace, distant Himalaya hills and panoramic view of tree covered hills.A binocular is also there.Photographers are also there, in case their services are required!

title: Pathetic
review: Pathetic!!!

title: lal tibba
review: well you see if u go to mussoorie, you have to go to these place other wise your journey is incomplete, believe me mussoorie and the nearby places are just breath taking.

title: A bad ride for an average view
review: Avoid if u have a big vehicle and a rush....the views are pretty moderate and in case of fog might be non existent....if u still go there...have a maggi :) its d air that makes u enjoy it...the momos r crap and so is the tea ....y did i go there???? A question ur very likely to ask yourself once ur back

title: Serenity at its Best
review: well you see if u go to mussoorie, you have to go to these place other wise your journey is incomplete, believe me mussoorie and the nearby places are just breath taking.

title: Serenity at its Best
review: We went on weekend leisure trip and this was the best part. We spent 2-3 hours sipping coffee. We had one of best maggi and momos. Didn't want to come back. The walk in that area was very calming. Highly recommended for nature lovers...!

title: Nice place
review: Must visit. You can hire a cab to reach there. It gives a great view of the valley with beautiful landscape. We went there in June this year with family and had great time. It is better than Kempty fall , the main tourist atttraction there.

title: excellent view of the Shivalik ranges
review: If one is lucky and if the weather is good one can view the majestic Himalayas and the Mount Kailash too. The cool and serene atmosphere thrills and adds to the enjoyment.

title: awesome pan cakes
review: if u want to have pan cakes go to this place.chaar dukan has nine flavours of pan cakes very tasty.u can see kedarnath through telescope if d weather is clear

title: Walk Instead Of Driving
review: The way to Tal Tibba was quite steep so I decided to walk rather than drive. It turned out to be a good decision. We walked slowly up and it was much easier than we thought it would be. The weather was very pleasant with clouds and mist all around. We had something to eat at the char dukan (I think that's what it is called), near the top of the mountain. It was very peaceful and quite and the scenic beauty was awesome. Walk rather than drive, otherwise, you miss out on all the fun bits.

title: Decent vista point
review: We visited here as part of a hike around the Landour area.

title: WASTAGE OF TIME AND MONEY
review: Do not go when weather is not clear. It is just 4 kms from picture Palace and Cab charged Rs.720 both round trip.

title: Beautiful Place
review: Must visit. Great view of the valley with beautiful landscape. Better than Kempty fall. Surrounding area is worth exploring on foot. Specially Church and some beautiful houses.

title: On top !
review: The views and scenic beauty at Mussoorie's highest peak were very good. We thoroughly enjoyed our brief visit to Lal Tibba. Even the drive till up there is quite enjoyable.

title: nothing special any more
review: Very ordinary point...not well managed at all. It used to be a beautiful location but nt any more. The place is ideally a photographer's paradise...

title: Highest point in mussoorie!!
review: Lal tibba is located far from the main mussoorie and the way is through the old and the original mussoorie.One can go walking or by his own car as the cab charges are high.This place has nice views of the himalayas(specially in the morning) as well as the nearby mountains.In the way stands  char dukaan which is a very famous snack stop and the store in over 100 years old!!!!

title: Lovely View Nice Walk
review: walk from char dukan at Landour towards Lal Tibba viewpoint, then on to sister's bazaar, later passing Rokeby and back to char dukan - mostly level, shaded, lovely

title: Poorly managed place, provides good telescopic view
review: This place is called as highest point of mussoorie city. You will enjoy the ride to the place which provides good view of hills and view of Kedarnath etc from telescopes mounted there but the place lacks the charm of "peak point" because of folks who own the area and telescopes. They are rude villagers who don't understand that value of a tourist and are too uncivilized. The place is not properly maintained by civic officials according to its fame ( basic amenities etc ).

title: A Serene Place to relax your mind.
review: A Very quiet and nice place. Nothing much to do. Only 2 restaurants and a great view of the snow capped Himalayas. This is really not a place for noise making and activity doing kind of people. One can go there and sit for a while to relax your mind.

title: Mussoorie routine
review: Go in the early morning if you wish to see Himalayan ranges. Otherwise nothing great to see. Road to all tibia is good including Ruskin bonds home.

title: All U need to Know
review: The highest point in Mussorie and Landour.

title: Extremely overrated
review: This place is one of the highest point in mussoorie and has some good views. We went there thinking that it will be nice and peaceful there but the place was quite crowded. There were many cars and the way up to the place was through some narrow and steep streets.

title: highest point good views..
review: 1 You can visit Lal tbba while going to dhanolti also with your vehicle.

title: Nice view when sky is clear
review: The location is at a higher altitude from Mussoorie. You will be able to see the snow peaks of himalayas only when the whether is good and the sky is clear. Don't go if you see clouds in the sky.

title: Beautiful surroundings..
review: Lal tibba has some beautiful view of Mussoorie and area around drive till there is good. Area around lal tibba is worth exploring on foot. Specially Church and some beautiful houses.

title: Good view
review: It is a small place where binoculars are fitted on two adjacent buildings. They show you different points of Mussorie and expain about it... It was beautiful and value for money.

title: Walk in the hills
review: But the whole trip, will be a part of my memory forever, I strongly recommend, to take time off, and stay disconnected in the hills.

title: stop at Chaar Dukaan for Excellent Pan cakes and ginger lemon tea
review: We didn't go all the way to lal tibba, and just stopped over at Chaar Dukaan; and were overwhelmed by the food we had there.

title: Excellent place to experience what Mussoorie was of old.
review: Just park your car at all tibba and walk around the place. Peaceful, serene and beautiful views of valley is what this place is about. Not commercialized. Get a bottle of water with you. The ride up to lal tibba is very steep, be sure of your riding skills if driving up there by yourself.

title: Ethereal,pristine.
review: As situated in cantonment area, Lal Tibba is unspoilt by the chaotic development of downtown Mussoorie.Situated about 1000 feet higher then city,it is a place to relax and enjoy the panoramic view of snow clad mountains of Himalayan range.This area has retained the original charm of hill queen,Mussoorie.

title: bredthtaking view of the mighty himalays
review: the eatery joint at the lal tibba which serves the best aloo parothas with hot tea. the view point to see the snow on the himalays is stunning ,the walk on the mountain roads is fantastic

title: breathtaking view
review: awesome scenery

title: Average Place
review: Nothing much about it. You take a 5 min ropeway to reach here and see around. Nothing much to do here , just a few stalls etc.

title: The road trip to Lal Tibba
review: Loved the natural beauty and the old cemetery which is hidden from view. The drive there was quite narrow and we were in a temp traveller! that can be avoided. The food there is nothing great but the ambience makes up for it

title: new construction is a patch at nature's delight
review: I am a regular visitor to Mussoorie and every time, I visit, I never miss Lal Tibba, because of the fascinating views, but from my last two visits, I noticed a construction ( very poorly done) in the name of a cafe. This is spoiling the aesthetic beauty and slowly, it will be garbage slump. I am feeling really sorry to see that.

title: provides best view
review: lal tibba provides you the best view of snow laden himalayan peaks..one can easily see nanda devi peak as well as some peaks of kumaon range..there is a cafe on top..on its terrace one can see the peaks by telescopes..must visit place..can also take a small walk over there to feel the place more.

title: Great views
review: Well worth  a trip up here to enjoy wonderful views of the Himalayas especially in the morning.  Very nice old English church nearby too.

title: Highest local himalayan peak in Mussoorie
review: Has a miraculous view of the himalayan hills fully covered with snow with deep ghati on one side. A truly thrilling natural beauty place.

title: Breathtaking view
review: Both the journey and destination are Breathtaking! You can see the snow capped himalayas to the north. We went up to a cafe and paid 40 rps to see everything with binoculars, very worth it.

title: Amazing Himalayan view
review: Enjoyable journey to reach Laal Tibba, on arriving one can find a superb natural beauty, snow all around (if visited in winters), amazingly great Himalayan View and tasty maggi points to overcome hunger.

title: Lal Tibba
review: it's a place where you will get alot of resturants and you will find all the brands to shop and good food corners. Nice market..

title: Good view
review: The view was very beautiful, but other than that there was not much to do. If you do go here I would recommend you stop at chaar dukaan on the way down for cheese Maggie and cinnamon waffles.

title: Biggest disappointment of our trip
review: Having seen that Lal Tibba was rated so highly here on TA, we booked cab from Mall Road to go to Lal Tibba. May be because it was a little cloudy or may be we had too many expectations, but this was a huge disappointment.

title: Tequila Sunrise!
review: Lal Tibba means the the Red Hill. Around 4 km uphill, this is the highest point in Mussourie (around 7500 ft) and offers an exhilarating view of the snowy peaks of Himalayas on clear days. Try going there before 1 PM to have better chances of coming face to face with the mighty Himalayas. There are tea-stalls offering tea/ coffee snacks though it's much better around a km below  where you have better eating options.

title: Top of the world..serene and secluded...
review: At 7500 feet, you could literally see that you are above every other mountain in the vicinity.. the snow capped himalyan peaks were also visible.. there is just one, quiet dabbu's cafe at this point which makes this place calm and free from litter and arbit travelers... this place is 6 km from mussoorie and is accessible by road- we however traveled completely by foot which made this trip more awesome.. a must visit if you are going to mussoorie to watch the sunset..

title: Top view
review: Also known as old mussoorie try to walk from mall road to laal tibba to enjoy the beauty . At the top you can view the snow clad himalayan ranges . Also the house of Ruskin bond,prannoy Roy,Victor banner jet,tom alter. It has a very good sanjay narang hotel rockeby manor which is also Sachin Tendulkar favorite.

title: a lovely gateaway
review: again a very isolated place. Not too crowded .. n i think it's the highest peak in mussorie.. enjoyed having tea with paratha on top and view of himalaya in front.

title: View the Himalaya side and dehradun side
review: This is definitely the best place to visit. Evening before the sun set is best time to visit.

title: Definitely worth the trip up there!
review: This is the highest point in Mussoorie, and a drive of 4-5 kms takes you to an additional height of about 2000 feet! The view of the snow-covered Himalayas is just too good!

title: Quest
review: Best time to visit is just 1/2 hr before evening. Order a Magi and Tea as you pay for the entry ticket to the old woman and guide as it takes a long time to serve.

title: Good views
review: Nothing to see here apart from viewing the Himalayan mountain range. I guess, you could view this from elsewhere as well if you were going to Dhanoulti.

title: Oldest Inhabited Place of Mussoorie
review: Lal Tibba is located in Landour area which is the oldest inhabited place of Mussoorie...There is a 20 Mtr tall tower situated at the edge of the cliff...The tower has an old telescope....One can have a close look at the tempting Himalayan Range from here by paying a nominal fee of Rs. 20/-

title: nothing much
review: Enjoy the trail from Lal tibba to the Sister's bazar. Look to your left for an amazing view of snow-capped mountains.

title: A glimpse of the himalayas
review: Please don't expect to see the entire Himalayas ... only a small portion of it is visible. There are 2 view points from where one can use Binocular and Telescope to view the Himalayas and the valley by paying 60/100 bucks....you can enjoy the sun with a nice cup of coffee/soup...

title: Quaint and Quiet
review: the place has a lovely view and I loved the silence. It's a lovely place to take photographs and basically enjoy the chill breeze whipping through your hair.

title: Not a worth
review: Not an great place to visit after you walk so much and just find a flag . Its not a worth place to go. Specially during the rainy season as we were not bale to see any beauty of the mountains due to Fog.

title: Nice!
review: It has the best view of the Himayalas from Mussoorie!

title: Just me and the nature
review: One of the best place in mussoorie if you want to go far from the busy roads and traffic of tourist. There is nothing special place but the whole place looks like some small hilly village in remote area. Specially i like places when the are less  used by humans. Must go if you like nature. There is small church and hindi language school also located here.

title: 360 degree view, but nothing else to do
review: The view all around is great. Do pick a time in the afternoon if you want to enjoy the scenery else the cloud cover may spoil the view. Nothing else to do there but spend some quiet time.

title: only worth it if you are fit and enjoy a climb
review: If you are in the hills for fresh air and exercise you will not be disappointed.It took me 75 minutes from Picture Palace to Sisters Bazaar without a break. I would rate my fitness as well above average so those who have a sedentary lifestyle will struggle or take much longer.

title: Great view
review: When the weather is clear the view is amazing and well worth the trip. I notice tat most turn around and go back the way they came, however one can keep going as the road up there is a figure eight and will bring you back to the same place with more great views as you drive around. you can also stop at sister Bazaar for handicrafts.

title: nothing much to do but exellent view.
review: when we reached there it was full with the clouds. and after few mins. rain starts. one small shop is there which serves tea and maggi but not suggestable. its better to have something at char dukan . these shops have better eating options with good price.

title: Average Place
review: The food at chaar dukaan is good, but you have to be a supremely skilled driver to negotiate the route to Landour. The momo's, pakoda's, chai and pizza are heavenly though, but not worth the drive and effort!

title: Contacting God
review: Yes. Visit Lal Tibba. Drive "up" and reach there just before sunset. Have a look around. See the peaks, the valleys and the forests of Shivalik hills, the foot of Himalayas. Wait and watch. As it gets darker, you will start seeing some lights from down below the valleys, they seem to emanate from such great distances, just twinkling like far away stars. These lights may be kilometres away, twinkling from huts located at distant mountains. As the night descends on the mountains and envelope you and the forests around you coupled with those distant lights playing hide and seek, you feel as though you are on another planet or may be heaven, near to God. The only terrible thing is that in recent years, the government has built some dirty shelter at the very critical point, hiding the best view. Wonder why people in governments can not think properly!

title: Excellent place for good views
review: The climb up to Lal Tina can be a little tiring, but once you reach up there the views arme breathtaking. However in case it is raining or or is cloudy, your entire experience will be spoilt.

title: Smart Gentle (Sales) Man
review: Its called the highest view point  in Mussoorie and we were told u get a view  of the Himalays when the weather is clear. However, the best thing here was a smart gentleman who wud first tell u about all the history of the place n its surroundings and at  the end very smartly offer u homemade pickles prepared by his wife...since he has involuntarily been ur guide, u have to buy atleast one of those as a goodwill gesture...smart !!

title: Good to visit
review: We planned to go to lal tibba, chaar dukan, christ church in the morning times and gun hill point in the evening times.

title: Excellent
review: This is the best place in Mussoorie. It is the highest point from where I can see himalayas when sky is clear. I had heard in newspaper that hotelier Sanjay Narang had settled in this place and Sachin Tendulkar stays at his place whenever he visits Mussoorie. Incidently when I was in Lal Tibba, I saw Sanjay Narang walking with a couple there. Defintely visit this place.

title: Disappointment...
review: This place was suggested by the tour guide and it was a total waste of time. The place has nothing except a two storeyed platform where a telescope is placed to get a view of himalayas. But even that would be possible if the whether was clear. There is a tea stall apart from the platform. Thats about it. There are better points to get a view of valley. This point best missed in the itinerary!

title: Nothing except for a mountain that is visible.
review: We were excited for visiting Lal tibba as we heard that it is the highest point in mussoorie and when we reached there, it was like one Nahta Estate, with one Tea Stall , a photographer and a mountain partially visible because of the clouds. He said this is LAL TIBBA. dont be surprised now. We were indeed. We came all the way for this??? :P If you can afford to waste a bit of time . then you can come here all the way 15 kms from mall road!

title: Lal Tibba visit
review: Two ways to go. Take the one from the Mall. Pretty steep roads. The other road ( much before the mall) takes you through steep twists and turns and can be difficult for first timers. You would enjoy the telescopes and the location

title: Top of the Hill
review: This is just a view point on the top of the hill. You can have a view of Mussoorie city and hills from here. Very good spot for photography. There are no stall for refreshment and food etc. Approach road is too narrow and having sharp hair pin curves. 10 to 15 minutes visit spot.

title: Amazing View
review: Just when you are about to reach Lal Tibba there is a place famous by the name of 'Chak Dukaanein'. It is a must stop. When we reached it started raining making the stoppage worthwhile. Lal Tibba - silent place - great view

title: run down and rarely open
review: We lived in the area for a few months and daily walked by this landmark.  It consists of a three story old concrete platform.  In the area below some people run a snack shop and sell chips and water.  There is a gate there that leads to the top where there is an old old old set of binoculars that don't work that well.  99% of the time - and we walked by this place daily - it wasn't open.

title: Nothing great at all Not worth the Travel
review: We were lost in search of Lal tibba and when we reached there, it was like one Nahta Estate, with one Tea Stall and a photographer. He said this is LAL TIBBA. dont be surprised now. We were indeed. We came all the way for this, But the view was indeed good and it is the highest point there. But you may give it a miss.
